Slight haze amber. Medium foam. Malty alcoholic. Medium to strong body. Sweet. Dry. A bite sharp. Fine. Bitter medium. Chili!!! Had a dish of chili
12 oz. bottle. Pours cola colored with thick tan lasting head. Aroma of sweet malts, caramel and wet grass. Taste was fresh with a slight bitterness.
Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Uklar, mørk rødbrun farge. Moderat karbonet, tynn skumtopp. Smaker brent sukket, karamell,vanilje,toffee. Meget behagelig

35.5cl bottle. Dark reddish brown colour with a small tan head. Caramel, toffee, dark fruits,molasses, nuts and vanilla in the aroma. Average to low carbonation and medium to high body. Taste is bittersweet well balanced with fruity notes. Overall, a good beer.
Bottle from Daneys Liquor store in Monterery, CA. Darker pour. Flavor was malt forward, but not sweet. Pretty easy to drink considering the ABV.

Birra molto particolare, leggermente vinosa, al palato particolarmente maltata. Bassa carbonatazion, stile particolare. Personalmente buona ma non ne gradisco piu di un paio di sorsi. Per lo stile molto ben fatta.
Bottle bought at Malt Attacks. Strong caramel, light roast, grapes, dark fruit, light vanilla touch. Nice but not my favourite style.

Dark ruby, violet hue. Very low beige head which quickly disappears. Watery texture, clean appearance. Aroma of salty caramel, toffee, molasses, raisins and umami. Mouthfeel bit on the thin side although alcohol is well hidden still. Low carbonation.Taste of licorice, maple syrup, salty soya sauce with hints of chocolate oak and vanilla in finish. Herbal, syropy ending. Well balanced, delicious and complex brew. Not really refreshing but enjoyed in awe.

Opaque brown with a modest beige head. Pleasant, but slightly mild aroma containing notes of vanilla, scotch, caramel, toffee, cinnamon, biscuit, and malt. Mid bodied not unlike a syrup texture. Delectable coalescence of caramel, toffee, sweet scotch, oak, vanilla, cinnamon, with a lingering sweet and mildly hoppy finish. Very nice.
Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is dark fruits, sweet malts, something beefy. Gets better and better as it warms. Excellent Scotch Ale.
Pours dark red almost black small beige head. Medum carbonation. Taste is initially malty leaving a bitter hop finish. Hints of fruit and smoke.

Aroma is light caramel and a hint of corn. Appearance is dark brown ruby red with small frothy head. Taste is large malt up front, raisin plum, hint of roast. Some hop bitterness but still a malt forward beer. Bit of earthiness. Palate is medium and crisp. Bitterness lingers. Overall not bad. Arrogant Bastard is far superior. Lacking the malt depth I expected. Maybe I got an old bottle. High IBUs not helping the malt, definately too high for a Scottish.

Btl pours a burgandy color with a big off white head that dissapates quickly leaving lace all over glass. Smells of earth,wood,toast,alcohol and Tastes of sweet toffee,roasty grain,vanilla,molasses,nuts and a hint of chocolate. Medium to heavy body,bold chewy viscous mouthfeel, clean, smooth slightly alcoholic finish. Very nice well balanced and extremely flavorful beverage. This is the first scotch ale Ive had and I am impressed. Well done!
Clear dark ruby, tanned lacing lasting foam head. Sweet hoppy barley aroma, quite nice. Bittersweet taste, lots of fruit tones, leving smoky bitter aftertaste. (Cleveland 201510)

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey, consumed on 9/11/2015. Dark ruby brown with beige head. Aromas of dark fruit, caramel, toffee. Tastes of dark fruit, caramel, toasty notes, toffee. Medium body with a dry finish.

Bottle. Aroma is sweet malts, toffee, bread crust. Dark ruby, clear, small beige head. Heavy sweetness, light bitter, taste is caramel, toffee, bread crust, some dark fruits. Full body, soft carbonation, slightly dry and bitter aftertaste. Well brewed, good balance.

Pours a ruby color with an off white head. Peat, caramel, raisin, molasses, plum, toffee and molasses aroma and flavors. Medium full body with moderate carbonation and a raisin, plum and molasses finish.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2015 Bottle at The Roebuck, Leek (Titanic) A clear ruby brown colour with a medium tan head. Aroma of bready and a little roasted malt, some chocolate, raisin, toffee and wood. Taste of toffee, caramel, chocolate, bready malt, subtle smoke, slight whisky, raisin, some prune, wood, a little marshmallow and slight brown sugar. Full bodied and moderate carbonation. A warming, slightly roasted chocolate bitterness in the finish. Mainly toffee and fruity with a little whisky and bitterness. A great take on a traditional scotch ale, lovely.
Red apple, maple syrup, caramel, peat, mild smoke, butterscotch, touch of milk chocolate, faint roast, earthy hops on finish.

Pours from the bottle a dark brown with a fine tan head that lingers and fades quickly. First bite is roasted malt, caramel, a little sweet. For an 8.5 the alcohol isnt overly pronounced, but it does add a pleasant warmth to the finish which is complex enough to keep me coming back.

Deep ruby with a short lived tan head. Sweet, rich malty goodness with a hint of smoke, peat and wood... Id almost think it had been barrel aged. Nice hop presence which balances the sweetness well, making sure it isnt cloying. Lovely stuff.

Bottiglia. Colore ambrato scuro con una schiuma fine e poco persistente, aroma dolce con malti tostati, caramello e ovviamente scotch che con lalzarsi della temperatura nel bicchiere si fa sempre più presente, in bocca continua ad essere dolce con una leggera venatura amara unita nel finale all alcool dello scotch. Lho trovata molto bilanciata nonostante il dolce sembra farla da padrone. Consigliata

This is the closest thing to Mac Andrews that I've been able to find, which is my favorite, but I haven't seen it here in the U.S. for decades. Unlike others, this has a nice hop balance. Others are nothing but malt.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours in dark, almost black, body with medium tan head. Long lasting head. Aroma is nutty, light toffee with touch of vanilla. Taste has medium herbal bitterness with full bodied candi sweetness as a balance. Light alcohol touch. Body is full, heavy, medium to high carbonation.

Aroma: Rich chocolate, muscrat grapes. Light rose, alcohol.
Appearance: Clear, dark amber body. Small, tan head, fair retention. Lacing.
Flavour: Medium licorice, munich malt, muscrat grapes, peat. Medium bitterness, raisin, Dry finish with lingering maltiness, peat. Medium-light alcohol.
Mouthfeel: Light warming. Full body, Medium carbonation, cream.
Overall: Rich, warming. The bitterness is not to style, making the beer less smooth.

355 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
9E. Strong Scotch Ale

Bottle from Ruprai, Birmingham. Really well balanced and tasty beer. Red brun coleur. Sticky gobfeel. Beguiling, growing taste: rich choc grain, with warming faintly burnt cereal hops. Hangs together great. Classy.

Pours out a murky brown/maroon with very little head. Aroma is fruits with a little coffee. The two most prominent flavors are fruit and dark chocolate which bring to mind fancy liqueur chocolates. Theres a strong roasted presence as well as some brown sugar sweetness. Thick mouthfeel with active bubbles. Bottled Nov 2014, enjoyed August 2015.

Backlog from lost & found notes: Aroma of malty toffee, earth, fruits, raisins and toffee (yeah twice!). Taste is thick and thoughts go to syrup. Sweet brown sugar, dark bread, christmas fruits, toffee, heavy malts. Awesome!
I am not a huge fan of Scotch so it shouldnt be a huge surprise that I am not a fan of this at all. If you are not a fan of scotch you should totally avoid this.

Probada el Trinity Place Bar, New York. Cerveza oscura, suave. Predominan su sabor a café y especialmente a chocolate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12/08/2015 - 33cl bottle @Erwins platform on the Schelde. Thanks for sharing. Great evening
Dark brown colour with small tanned head. Fruity, chocolate, coffee in the nose. Taste is coffee, chocolate, caramel, nice.

Simply great! Nutty, caramel. Pours a dark black. VERY Smooth. Now one of my favorites!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled. Pours dark brown with a big brown head. Smells a lot of dark chocolate, nutty roasted malt, a bit smoky and candy. Tastes dark chocolate, nutty, candy malt with a smoky mild bitter finish.
On tap at La Tape. Grainy aroma, and then grains, and grains, and grains. Tastes grainy again with some bitter almonds notes. Fruity in the end. Easy one for 8,5%!!. I have enjoyed it. Good.

Aroma of dried fruits, fruits, caramel and some roasted notes. Deer amber with a tan head. Medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter. Full body with a average to soft carbonation. Overall a very good Scotch Ale, really rich and deep flavour with some warming alcohol in the back. Enjoyable.
Nice mix on the pallet plum damson sweetness at the end but with a nice alcohol warmth coming through nice rich mouthfeel.

12 oz bottle. Pours dark ruby, yeah ruby. Off white head quickly dissipates, no lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, dark fruit. Flavor is figs or dates, smoked malt, sweet, moderately spiced, and slightly boozy. Mouthfeel is creamy, full bodied, low carbonation. Another tasty offering from Founders.

Pours a root beer brown color with a large, well-retaining, tan head. Rich caramel, butter, and ripe red fruit on the nose. Soft water mouthfeel. Moderately rich and sweet caramel. Ripe red fruit as well.

DAA; Bottle 355 ml. Pours moderate, clear dark brown with a frothy creamy, lacing and somewhat lasting tan head. Nose is moderate to heavy, roasted, smoked malt and bread, light dried dark fruit and spice. Taste is moderate sweet and heavy bitter with a moderate lasting sweet malt and overripe fruit finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is soft.

355ml bottle. Very clear red-ish brown with small tan film. Aroma is whisky, wood, smokiness, peat, saussage, chocolate, coffee and dark malts. Taste is slightly sweet and boozy with dark chocolate, coffee, wood, roasted malts and slight smoke. Smooth, medium-creamy mouthfeel, light carbonation and noticeable alcohol.

bottle. Pours a beautiful ruby colour, small tan head. Sweet cotton candy, vanilla, smoke and earthiness. Very sweet on first sip, but there is a lingering earthy bitterness on the finish. Im not a huge fan of scotch ales, but this is a good one.
Bottle at The Antelope in Surbiton. Really sweet, some coffee with hints of caramel, vanilla and smoke. Really enjoyable full body, and a pleasantly dry bitter finish. Lovely beer.

35,5cl bottle from Drink Shop, Tallinn. Pours slightly hazy deep ruby to copper coloured with a fairly modest, off-white head. Aroma of caramel, dried fruits, malt and hints of wood. Sweet, very sweet, but still surprisingly drinkable and surprisingly tasty. Usually I wouldnt be a big fan of beers like this, but somehow it works. It is somehow balanced and its surprisingly smooth and drinkable.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2016 Awesome beer, originally I thought it was matured in bourbon/whisky casks as to me it tastes like its maybe got a hint of booze in it, but it seems its not actually matured in casks?  Very nice beer though!

Pours deep brown with decent head. The aroma is an array of caramels: toffee, burnt caramel, molasses. Flavour is deep and rich like a good scotch ale should be. Sweet, syrupy caramel. Delicious!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at the Birmingham Beer Bash, 2015. Poured a hazy dark brown with a round off white head. The aroma is rich alcoholic fruit, malt. The flavour is moderate to strong sweet with a big sweet chewy malt, spicy, Black Forest gateaux, toffee caramel, heart warming palate. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation and a bubbly mouthfeel.

12 oz bottle. Clear dark reddish brown, with a thin tan head and little lace. Aroma is malty, caramel, smoke, peat and a touch of yeast. Flavor is sweet, caramel, smoke, with a touch of yeast and a light hop bitterness. The bottle was 10 months old, so it might be past its prime. Need a fresher example to re-rate.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2016 Pours burnt red/brown with a thin cream head. Aroma is heavy on Vegemite, toast, toffee, scotch. The whole aroma is fairly subdued. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter with a bit of a boozey kick. Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy, medium thickness. Very quaffable for a scotch ale.

Bottle to tulip. Hazy copper pour with about a finger of eggshell white head. A decent amount of lacing. Aroma is fairly mild - caramel, dried fruit, a little resin. Flavor follows - caramel, raisins, candied fruit, and a little pine and booze to balance it out. Definitely not hiding the ABV.

Bottle into tulip. Ruby brown w tan head that does not stick around. Mild aroma of sweet raisin and fig. Full sweet taste similar to aroma but more pronounced. Some bitterness. Can't taste the peat. Good scotch ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
How : bottle Appearance : dark red, minimal off-white head Aroma : plums, caramel, grass, wood, sherry, honey. Palate : medium body, average carbonation.
355ml bottle. Dark copper with red notes color, beige head. Malty aroma, caramel and dark fruits.Taste is heavy sweet and light bitter. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

In bottiglia. Colore marrone, con riflessi ramati. Schiuma fine e poco persistente. Aroma di caramello, legno, tostato, erbaceo. Al palato corpo rotondo, avvolgente, leggera nota alcoolica. sentori di cereale, tostato, legno, frutta secca e finale leggermente erbaceo.
UPDATED: JUL 10, 2015 Aroma isnt particularly standout, but not that bad either. Looks great. Leaves a great aftertaste. Definitely feels like a scotch ale.
Versa scuro tipo tunica frate, sentori di malto tostato, al palato gusto dolce, biscotto con finale amaro.8.5 gradi di pura bastardezza
Deceptively sweet and malty with a strong finish. Mightve found a new favorite!
No es mi tipo pero es una de las mejores scotch ales que he probado y esta es gringa
Bottle. Dark brown colour. Malty caramel chocolate aroma and flavour, bit sweet, very nice

Botella . @Señor Lúpulo. Despacho de cervezas, Frikicata Gijón 27/06/2015.
Bottled: 11/05/2015
Color caoba, aroma malta ahumado, sabor malta, caramelo.

Copenhagen 28/6 2015. 35,5 cl bottle from Meny. A grinning presumably Scottish, dirty bastard on the label. Pours clear dark brown with off-white head. Dissipates to thin layer of foam almost immediately. Strong aroma of fermented dark fruits, sweetness, oak and caramel. Soft carbonation. Taste is sweet at first - caramel and drops - a little boozy alcohol. Some whisky in the aftertaste. Nice brown, boozy sensation - and pretty nice for Americans imitating the Scots.
Bottle. Dirty, hazy amber pour with a tan head. Nose is malty sweet with some light peat. Taste has some booze, malty sweetness, caramel and some smoke.
Aroma is dark berries, caramel, and smokey scotch barrels. Taste is oak barrels, caramel, vanilla, and berries.

Rossa scura con riflessi arancioni, limpida, schiuma color nocciola non molto persistente.
Aroma di fichi e uvetta, nocciole e rabarbaro, zucchero caramellato, liquorosa, leggermente affumicata.
Al palato gli esteri fruttati lasciano subito spazio ai malti tostati che portano la bevuta verso l'amaro, nota alcolica finale.
Gli esteri fruttati si ripresentano anche nel retrolfatto.
Corpo medio, mediamente carbonata.

Avermelhada,opaca,levemente licorosa,espuma com média formação e baixa duração;no aroma lúpulo,malte tostado,caramelo,notas amadeiradas,frutas vermelhas;sabor encorpado,com inicio adocicado e tostado,finalizando com um delicioso amargor e um leve defumado,álcool notado mas bem inserido,baixa carbonatação,retrogosto amadeirado e adocicado. Ótima Scotch ,mais uma bela criação da Fouders.

Bottle. Pours is dark ruby with medium beige head. Spicy aroma of caramel, raisins, figues, hints of vanilla and some yeast, very pleasant. Taste is light bitter, medium sweet with heavy fruity flavour, mainly figues, raisins and coconut. Full body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Very good!
Promises a lot with lots of malts, hops and even peat but is real disappointment for me. Medium mouth. Lots of malts but something bothers me and tjis beer just is not so enjoyable.

Beautiful deep ruby color with little to no head; aroma is very light...some caramel maybe? Taste is robust! Huge floral and fruit (figs, raisins) notes developing to a roasted caramel and some hop resin to finish; mouthfeel is just right...not too thick or thin and just a touch of carbonation. Really just missed on the aroma. Everything else is great!

Bottle, The Hop Beer Shop, Chelmsford, 12th June 2015 .

Loads of raisins, wood and oak barrels on aroma
Some gorgeous textures. Some vanilla and leather. Really nice balance. Drinks really well. Just a lot of raisins on the flavour. More Rochefort than Scottish ale.
Lekkere schotch ! Zoet bittere smaak. Donkerrode kleur met een mooie volle schuimkraag. Gedronken op het vliegveld van Kopenhagen.
UPDATED: JUN 27, 2015 What a beauty. Dark amber, creamy head, lots of caramel and dark fruits, booze very well hidden. Gorgeous.

Aroma caramel, cherry sweet
Appearance red, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste heavy cloying sweetness, 
Palate medium body, soft carbonation, 
Overall a sweet malty beer. I could only drink one or two. Still great beer that I would suggest to a friend

Dirty bastard is a great beer with good color and taste. When I first tasted this beer I got a great taste you know it is a stronger beer immediately and that helps in the enjoyment of it. If I had anything bad to say about it is that it lacks any sign of aroma probably because of such I high amount of malts to hops. I would recommend this beer but only two or three a night.

Bottle thanks to Klimaet. Pours a dark ruby with a small, off white head. Aroma has lots of caramel, raisins, figs, malts, slight alcohol, pretty sweet. Taste is sweet and caramel malty with a slightly toasted bitterness. Again some raisin-like fruityness. Average carbonation and slightly oily body.

Bottle, thanks to lukasmh for buying this for me! Pours light hazy reddish brown with a small offwhite head. Aromas of caramel, malts, dark fruits, toasty notes, figs, toffee, light alcohol. Taste is malty, toasty, toffee, dark fruits, light chocolate.
Bottle. Dark brown with a small head. Powerful sweet flavour with lots of body.Lacks complexity but a straightforward strong ale that doesnt mess around. Not a nice name though.
Red ruby appearance with medium head. Intensive sweet and fruity aroma, caramel sweet taste, some sourness. Slightly high sweetness to reach perfect balance.

Brunt utseende med høyt fint skum. Meget tiltalende aroma av karamell, sukker, malt og tørket frukt. I smaken finner jeg karamell, sukker, cola(?!) og tørket frukt. Utrolig fløyelsmyk i munnen. Jeg kjørte min på 12,2 grader celsius, noe som fungerte fint. Søt som fy, med en ekstremt vag surhet også. Tykk kropp. Minner mye om en Belgian Ale eller til og med en quadrupel.

From 0,355l bottle, BBD: 28/12/15 Pours hazy dark brown reddish liquid, medium frothy tan to brown head, Aroma: sweet, caramel, candy, cherries, ripe red fruits, warming alcohol, raspberries, flowers, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour, malty, caramel, red fruits, warming alcohol, Palate: medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation, long bittersweet finish, Overall: very pleasant beer, especialy in the aroma, rich, warming, but still very drinkable, enjoyed.
Beer starts with light notes carmels and coffee. Then moves to bitter chocolates. Its light and balanced. Kudos!

Bottle from Ridgewood. Aroma: Caramel, dried fruit such as prunes, delicious. Appearance: Orange with a small white-ish head. Flavor: Same, with some licorice in the back which I wasnt a super big fan of (sue me, I dont like licorice.) Semi-easy to drink, there is a bit a balance but it is a bit sweet. It tastes sweeter than youd expect for the APV. Nice.
Deep brown looks. Dank, resin, cereal, hay,dried fruit. Nice brew, very full body and lost if interesting layered aromas. Very high quality stuff! (Bottle from Saveur Bière)

Its not been a great night for beer tasting. I wanted to cross off "English Pale Ale" from my list of styles, so chose a pale ale from England which was labelled as an English Pale Ale, but was actually categorised as an ESB. Ive had a Cornish bitter which was pretty dreadful. Was hoping this was a "Scottish Ale" but again missed the nuance and it is a "Scotch Ale." So much for being a completist! However ... this is great. Lovely rich brown colour, rich and full bodied. Complex - there is dried fruit, brown bread, plum, dark treacle. The alcohol isnt hidden but it doesnt dominate in a harsh way. Big beer. The night is getting better. And we won the cricket!
Chestnut color , nice beige head. Malt , caramel , raisins in aroma. Rich , malty taste with fruity notes. Moderate bitterness in warming finish. Good , classic beer.

Very dark ruby colour, creamy beige head. Aroma of reisins, dark fruits, caramel. Taste is medium sweet, slight tart note, very well balanced. Medium body, creamy texture, soft to flat carbonation. Very nice
Bottle from the Lincoln Beer Festival. Deep ruby colour with a tan head. Dark fruity aroma, taste is toffee sweet. May be just a touch to sweet.

From bottle. (aged). Pours unclear mahogany with a beige head. Aroma of ripe plums, caramel, butterscotch, some plums, figs and nice sweet malts in general. Taste is sweet but with some bitterness as well. Bitter nuts, caramel, ripe sweet fruits and some weak sweet esters. Ends with a weak almost vinous note at the end. Very good!

Bottle, deep brown beer, a little almond colored froth. Aroma is malt an caramel, raisin, faint vanilla. Taste is caramely malt, raisin and dark fruit, faint coffee, cola, some clove even. Finish even has a bit of anise. Palate is smooth and rich, carbonation subdued. This is super. If all scotch ales were this good it might be my favorite style!
Bottle from Beer Dock, Crewe. Pours ruby dark with a light tan head. Dark fruit, whisky, toffee. Good stuff
Bottle @ Kastrup Airport, Copenhagen 150513. Roasted malty, fruity and caramely, dried fruits, sweet, medium to full body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, fruity and caramely.
One of the best beers in one of the best categories of beer: Scottish style ale. Medium-full body with a long finish. Very malty and roasty. Finishes clean. Overall a good beer drinking experience.

On bottle at Vinmonopolet Norway. Amber color, good foam. Medium aroma intensity ; hops, caramel & malt. Medium body & complexity . Some sweetness. Enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Apex, post CBC

A: Brown bordering on mahogany, creme head, some lacing.

N: Toffee, leather, ample malt, hints of smoke, some vanilla and wood undertones, peppercorn and earth from (I assume) the hops, rounded out with raisin and prune.

T: Quite sweet, a bit of char and bitterness to balance.

M: Medium body, creamy carbonation, hint of alcohol.

O: A tasty toasty Scotch ale. One of the foremost in Founders arsenal, and a beer I would be more than happy to have again. Will be curious to compare this to Alesmiths Wee Heavy.

Bottle (trade non Ratebeer member); pours a light brown with a khaki head; aroma is caramel, nuts, malt, and hints of chocolate and vanilla; taste is bittersweet with caramel, vanilla, nuts, malt and a hint of chocolate; finish is dry with a hint of alcohol; very good beer

Pours a dark ruby color.  Rich, thick, foamy head, that lasts about halfway through, and then thin for the rest of it.  Nice consistent lacing throughout.Nose is deep roasted malt.  It also smells a little of burnt toast.  I can also smell some fruitiness and some alcohol.First taste is sweet, followed by some bitterness.  Theres some bitter finish, but not too much.  Also some alcohol at the finish.  Its malty, and a little grainy, but its smoother than you would expect.  Similar to a porter, it tastes like coffee and caramel.  Its pretty well balanced, with each sip you have to wonder...will it be sweet, or will it be bitter?Mouthfeel is medium-heavy.  Its a 50 IBU beer, but it doesnt really taste all that bitter.  It finishes a little bitter, sometimes.  But its not all that bitter.  Its a little heavy to be sessionable, but the smoothness and the sweetness counters that.Overall, its very tasty.  8.5% ABV, really?  You really wouldnt know it.  This one is a dandy!

This beer was very strong it played well on the amount of alcohol and malts. It was smooth and played well with the hops.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at O*Leary at Copenhagen airport. Pours brwon with little light briown head. Aroma of dark bread, some smoke. Tastes sweet, with a bitter finish, well balanced. Full bodied, smooth mouthfeel.
caramel, chocolate, coffee, nuts, black, brown, very bitter, full body, A very heavy malted beer
Tap at Apex. Pours black with tan head. Aroma of raisin, dark fruits, minty. Taste is herbaceous, full bodied, medium carbonation. Overall, not very good.
Smells sweet and reminds me of homebrew. Dark brown with a little red in color. Small white head, not a lot of carbonation. Malty taste with some noticeable roasted malt flavor.
bottle. Deep red with off white head. Ripe fruit aroma, caramel malts, alcohol. Sweet flavour of malt, alcohol
Pours copperish brown with thin head and modest aroma: hint of chocolate. Rich body from the many malt varieties. Meal in a bottle!

A dark reddish brown coloured der with a frothy tan coloured head. A strong rich aroma, raisiny fruit, vanilla spice and woody, with an alcoholic background. Medium mouthfeel. The taste follows on from the aroma, with all the richness, fruity, coffee, dark caramel vanilla and woody with a hint of smokiness, then a mildly sour alcoholic taste that refreshes the richness, leaving a well balanced but full finish.
Good taste of barley sugar and toffee. Hint of cocoa. Small astringency by alcohol. Tasty and long bitterness.

Bottle. Pours dark reddish brown with tan head and substantial lacing. Sweet aroma of peat with cherry notes. Sweet, rich malt, like toast, upfront. Smoke and some plum notes. Some fruit, plum and cherry, along with some bitterness in the finish. Mouthfeel is substantial but not heavy, just short of chewy. Some warming alcohol throughout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Surprised to the upside by this. Ive had some off-tasting scotch ales in the past but this one is good. Quite sweet like a barley wine but not overpoweringly so. Lots of dried fruit, caramel and peat in the malt. Decent bitterness from the hops too.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Big yeast aroma with some cocoa tossed in. 
Appearance- Pours a yellow brown with a small, light brown head. 
Taste- A good hop grain mix, tastes good
Palate- a heavy bodied moderate carbonation beer.
Overall- A really good scotch ale, this may be one of my favorites of that style.

Aroma: caramel, raisin, 
Appearance: ruby-amber, clear, tan foam, 
Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate: full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious.

Finally found this in my local super market. Pours dark brown and slightly redish, the off-white head fates away quickly. Sweet aroma of caramel, raisins and dried fruit. Nice full taste with some punchy caramel notes, some spicy notes and dried fruit. Compared to the price this is a very nice beer.
duft rosin sød karamel rugbrød smag ristet malt rugbrød ristetbrød/rugbrød svesker sød karamel

Cant believe I havent tried this until now. Pours dark reddish brown with tan head. Caramel, citrus, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, butterscotch. Moderately bitter and sweet. A bit of sourness. Full, creamy body.
Both abv and taste match. Its a little much but they were meant to be. Had bottled.

35 cl bottle at a retailer in Manhattan, NY, around $4. brown color, almost clear, thin fune yellowish head. Roasted malts on the nose already. Aroma is well loaded of dark malts, nuts, hazelnut, caramel, vanilla and mild chocolate, while a proper amount of bittering hops balances it very well. Taste is quite bitter and has a nice play. Very rich overall, tasty, umami. The 8.5% is not overwhelming, the texture is smooth and silky, soft carbonation. The finish is pleasing with a brandy-ish leftover. Very very good.
Old rating. Great scotch ape. Brown-red. Sweet malts, mild bitterness, some smokiness. Well balanced.
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2016 Pours a dark red with almost no head. Aroma of caramel, raisin and a little fruity. Taste the same, but caramel prevail. Good stuff, but one glass is enough.
UPDATED: MAY 11, 2016 Tap. Hazy, brown, minimal head, tan foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & long finish.
UPDATED: DEC 31, 2015 Pours a dark hazy red. Aromas of caramel, bread, earthiness, raisin and a little smoke. Taste the same with some malt sweetness.. With a medium mouth feel. Very nice scotch ale.

2015/04/03 - Pours a dark mahogany colour with a foamy, cream colour head that quickly reduces. Aroma is bread, caramel, vanilla, wood, roast and smoke. Taste is bready, sweet malt caramel with a hint of vanilla, roast, oaky-vanilla tones, smoke and a hint of booze. Mouthfeel is medium with low carbonation and a mildly boozy, drying finish. I'm don't usually enjoy scotch ales, but this is delicious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Un insolito colore torbido, che si pone tra il mogano e il tonaca di frate, qualche riflesso rossastro; ed una piccola "testa" di schiuma beige, cremosa ma poco persistente. Laroma è di buona intensità e pulizia, con una marcata dolcezza fatta di uvetta, fichi e datteri, melassa, biscotto al burro. In bocca, offre note di biscotto e toffee, uvetta e prugna, ma anche una leggera ossidazione; lalcool è ben nascosto, se non per un lieve warming etilico finale, e la chiusura è leggermente amara. La birra ha un corpo medio, con una carbonazione bassa e una consistenza oleosa.
best label ever. great chunk of sweet yet savoury malt flavours. soft and round in the mouth, hints of smoke and meat round things off.

Pours clear copper brown with medium tan head. Aroma of raisins and toasty bread. Hints of roast and smoke too. Body is rich. Fairly sweet taste, but matched with moderately firm bitterness and a warm alcoholic punch.

355ml bottle. Dark with tan head that drops quickly. Sweet and malty aroma. The taste is smooth, sweet, cherry, alcohol, oak barrels, caramell. Strong, warm, dry, sweet aftertaste with hints of alcohol.
Quite nice dark brown appearance, with not a lot head which disappears rather quickly. Complex taste of caramel, Whisky, some toffee and alcohol
Boozy aroma. Cherry color pour, small head. In the mouth Im getting a caramelized malt bomb with an early sweetness, and late bitter. Genuine article here.

Pours clear dark red/brownish. Sweet, complex aroma of caramel and roasted malt. Full bodied, sweet taste, finishing off with a nice round bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Klar rødbrun med lavt beige skum. Lukter vanilje, eik og karamell. Søtlig smak med brent karamellbitterhet. Medium kullsyre. Lett bittersøt avslutning. Lillestrøm ølfestival - Klimt

12 oz bottle to tulip. Two finger tan head, gone quick. Some lacing. Aroma of dry fruit and malt. Color is clear ruby. Taste is light to medium sweet. A light bitterness and maybe a touch of sour. Doughy, earthy, Carmel, and dried fruit are all present in the complex flavor. Slick to thick textured. Medium to full bodied with an average carbonation. Long malty finish.
Great malt flavors with a moderate hoppiness with and beautiful caramel coloring.
UPDATED: APR 9, 2016 Dark reddish brown, brownish head. Intense sweet caramel aroma with wood, dark fruits, oak, toffee. Taste is sweet caramel malts, toffee, dark fruits, sth smoky, bitterish.

Poured 12oz bottle. Pours dark with a hint of red, nice head with good lace. Founders never disappoints very good Scotch Ale! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Typically like founders beers. This one however did not do it for me. Cant quite put my finger on it. Something in the finish just turns me off. Comes across somewhat sour with a smoked bitterness that builds as you drink it. . Based on other reviews, Ill chalk this up to not liking the style more than it being a bad beer.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy brown with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is smoke, booze, caramel. Thin mouth, caramel, dark fruits, sweet finish, light booze, very good.
Draught at Tipping Point. Toffee, dry plum, nutty cereals, quite low carbonation, hints of alcohol, bittersweet finish. Decent scotch ale but a bit too heavy for my liking.

Appearance is a dark, murky brown, a foamy beige covering is all that emerges in the way of a head. Aroma- lots of sweet caramel and toffee, fudge, vanilla, chocolate and coffee cake, fruit cake, marzipan, almond, sweet malts, malt loaf, golden syrup. Taste- lots of delicious caramel sweetness, toffee, Christmas cake, burnt treacle, malty, vanilla undertones, caramel shortcake. Sweet, slightly syrupy mouthfeel. Very tasty indeed.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2015 Deep mahogany pour with thin, clingy white head. Aromas of fruit, yeast, and bread with some wine-like quality. Flavors are many - prune, toast, cooked sugar. So smooth and malty. This is just great.

Well-known American interpretation of the wee heavy Scotch style, with deep yellowish beige, moussy, stable head and lightly hazy, dark wine red colour. Aroma indeed strongly resembles the Scottish examples of the style, with impressions of cookie dough, chocolate milk, brown rhum, caramel candy, hazelnut oil, almond, stewed pears, overripe plums, brown sugar, burning leaves, toasted bread, liquorice, subtle hints of orange liqueur, elderberry syrup, mint, cloves, acacia honey, wet leather, some damp cloth or wet paper. Rounded, sweet and fruity onset, hint of brown sugar, pear, fig, prunes, accompanied by a subtle sourish touch; soft carbonation, tingling just a little bit, paired with a smooth, velvety, full mouthfeel, deeply malty middle phase, caramelly in a slick and noble way, chocolatey touch, slightly nutty, with a subtle hint of roasted bitterishness in the end, but remaining subdued and not becoming coffee-like; finish also shows leafy and somewhat peppery hop bitterness as well as a fair deal of warming, liqueurish alcohol, which nevertheless stays very subtle and smooth, with only a warming effect and not becoming too astringent at all; the initial sweetness persists as well, but is in perfect balance with the bittering flavours and does not become boring or cloying at all. Very noble, well-crafted and balanced example of this style, which is not really my favorite, but in this form I can highly appreciate it.

Bottle from Fyne Wines, Argyll. Dark amber-brown with short lasting brown head; Very rich aromas of dark chocolate, espresso/coffee cake and boot polish with earthy, clove & star anise spices and hints of dried apple; Full bodied with a slightly creamy texture; Same flavour as with Aromas but more bitterness and more salinity. Big flavours, but big alcohol also! Only downside is the building bitterness and salinity as the glass empties.

Pours dark honey brown, finger of creamy head. Aromas of caramel, chocolate, a little fruit, honey. Really good, balanced malt budget! Nothing is overpowering. Taste is medium-strong sweet, light-medium bitter. Medium-heavy body. Love this one.

355 ml, flaske, 8,5 % ABV, BB 03/03/15, købt i SuperBest på Øster Fælledtorv på Østerbro, 20. februar 2015.
Kastanjebrun amerikansk Scotch Ale med 4-5 cm offwhite skumkrone, som svinder langsomt.
Aroma: maltaroma af brød og chokolade.
Whisky-noter, gær-nuancer af læder og en smule citrussyrlighed. 
Dejlig smag med sødme og bitterhed samt tydelige whisky-noter. Sødmen er ikke overvældende, let til medium, i samspil med en medium bitterhed. 
Øllet har en middel fyldig krop med en karbonering et nyk under medium og en olieret konsistens. Afslutningen er bittersød og medium lang. 
En dejlig øl, der aldrig bliver for sød, da whisky-noterne udligner niveauet på glimrende vis. Smagte "storebroderen", Backwood Bastard,for nyligt, og den er vild, men denne her har nu sin egen berettigelse og er ganske glimrende.

Pours a dark dark color with a crimson tint in the light. Caramel color smooth head. Heavy caramel flavors. Heavy chocolate syrup tones. Dark fruits. Pretty drinkable and smooth. Nice full mouthfeel. Good stuff.

355ml bottle, thanks to Finn. Pours a deep dark red coloured body and a low, bubbly, beige head that laced well. Sweet aromas of honey and dried fruits. Jammy fruits and nutty flavours. Prolonged dried fruity ending. Well bodied and well masked alcohol. Medium to full bodied. Tasty late night sipper (Tromsø 16.02.2015).

Aromas intensos entre los que destacan principalmente la cebada, así como notas dulces y caramelo.

En cuanto a su apariencia, color cobrizo, turbio, carbonatacion baja, cuerpo redondo, corona de espuma baja de nula retención.

En boca es compleja, espesa, caramelizada y alcohólica.

Al paladar se percibe sumamente maltosa, notas dulces, principalmente a caramelo. Es una cerveza compleja, en donde el alcohol, el dulzor, la maltosidad y las notas a fruta seca se combinan a la perfección.

En resumen es una muy buena cerveza. Alcohólica, con notas dulces y a caramelo que dominan el sabor, y retrogusto es a frutas secas, con un final medio.

355ml bottle at Beer Deluxe, Melbourne. Pours brown with almost no head. Sweet malty nose, a bit of alcohol too. Malty punchy taste, with just the right amount of hops to counterbalance the sticky sweetness.

Caramel, roasty, smoke, woody
Doesnt have much of a head. Sits heavily on the tongue.

Flaske 355ml fra Alko Muonio. Dyp mørk brun med rødskjær. Høyt tett skum med litt farge. Kniplingslacing. Uklar. Sammensatt aroma av ulik frukt. Et lite søtt sherrypreg. Myk munnfølelse. Smaken svakt syrlig frukt. Fin balanse. Får et litt tørt preg etter hvert. KI=4

Definite dark fruit caramel and toffee in the nose. Some alcohol and apple also. Auburn pour thin tan head great lace. Flavors of dark fruit apple caramel toffee and dark toast. Sweet but with definite dry toasty notes. Nicely carbonated. Not too over the top.
Appearance: red, clear, minimal head, white foam. Aroma: caramel, roasty, alcohol, good. Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, plum. Palate: full body, sticky, soft carbonation,
Aroma: caramel, bread, toast, brown, clear, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation,

Pours a medium brown with copper hints. Nearly no head at all. Aroma - definitely some smoky peat notes, malty. Taste follows suit with lots of caramel, smoky notes, and dark malt. Chewy mouthfeel and long finish.

Pours a dark brown color, topped with a decent beige head. Malty aroma, some caramel notes and some not-so-nice soy sauce aroma. Later develops into a very pleasant chocolate aroma. Taste is sweet and very malty. Some chocolate notes and hints of alcohol. Bittery in the finish. Pretty nice.

In bottle. Beige, rocky, fairly frothy head. Fairly persistent. Failry intense and not very persistent at nose. Copper with orange shadows. Chestnut honey, raisin, nuts, caramel, coffe . Medium body, medium carbonation, A lingering roasted bitter in the finish
Smells very malty. Taste is the same with a somewhat dry finish. Medium carbonation with some foam.

Dark brown with light brown head. Sweet sticky slightly musty toffee malt aroma. Mouthfeel is creamy sticky. Boozy caramel and toffee flavors with light bittering. Tasty winter style beer to be fussed over and deconstructed. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Plum-colored with a tan head, some lacing and a strong nose with hints of alcohol. Lightly-carbonated with a medium mouthfeel and a brown sugar, molasses, hoppy finish with some alcohol warming.

Nice sweet malt beer! Pours dark... Thick white head with laces. Tastes sweet malt. Overall good beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
это пиво очень вкусно. я бы, конечно, рекомен& его всем. пожалуй& обратит& его. очень хорошо!

Bottle - Brown ruby color with a small tan head, long lasting and good lacing - Aroma of dried fruits, raisin, cherry, caramalt, malt, plum, brown sugar - Flavor is more malty, dried fruits, caramel, roasted malt and earthy hops - Medium body, medium/high bitterness, good carbonation, sweet and bitter, bitter malty finish - Good scotch ale, not too sweet with a good bitternes

A long time favorite of mine. A beautiful, foggy, reddish brown and a small light brown head. Lotsa healthy fruit, some toffee for the candy lovers, and a nice abv. Theres a lot to like in this beer.
Dark amber with an off white head - Sweet malt aroma - Sweet malt body with dark fruits and some hop bitterness in the back - Sweet malts goes into the finish - This was good
Bottle at Craigs. Pours dark amber, nose is malty toffee, caramel, chocolate, taste is similar.

12oz bottle from Wegmans, West Seneca, NY. A rich reddish chestnut pour with a thin cream head; syrupy butterscotch aroma; smooth and oily in the mouth, packed with rich toffee malts, and a pleasant peaty bitterness; then a syrupy finish with well-hidden, but warming, alcohol.

Bottle. Dark auburn with short tan head. Complex aroma of cherries, dark fruits, and caramel. Medium body and carbonation. Sweet flavor nicely followed by a hoppy bite. High alcohol content gives it a boozy warmth. This is a really great beer of the style.

12oz into a stemmed glass. Pours a super dark and rustic magenta/ruby/velvet. Head is mild and fades fast, lacing is creamy brown and hovers over everything. Aroma of sweet malts, barnyard organics, such as hay, dirt, grass, ... cherries, juicy dark fruits. Taste of sweet malts, tart cherry, velvet cake, with a bitter punch from the abv and the mascaraed of malts. Dark, poinioght, and enjoyable on a late January eve in BWAC waiting for the Pats to win the super bowl. Drinks like a syrup based amber with honey, yet still derives a bitter notch of surprise when paired with the abv. Coasting.

Pours a clear very dark amber body with a nice, fluffy light brown head. Nose has buttery and malty notes. Taste is sweet and warming with a bitter finish. Carbonation is low and feels creamy, palate is quite rich. Very nice and well balanced beer for slow enjoyment.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2015 Mahogany appearance with a small. beige head and nice lacing.   Earthy, malty aroma dotted with toffee and ripe fruit.  Moderately sweet flavor with notes of caramel and dark fruit and an evolving complexity. Alcohol adds warmth to the aftertaste as a modest amount of spicy, floral hops add balance. Full bodied, softly carbonated mouthfeel leading to a lingering finish.

Dark ruby beer with a long lasting bubbly head. Aroma is sweet caramel, malts, raisins, ripe dark fruits, hint of alcohol. Taste is medium sweet, caramel malts, bready, fruity, a hint of alcohol. Medium plus mouthfeel, medium bitterness turn into warming alcohol. Really liked this one, just as expected. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This beer has a nice creamy smell, a slightly rusty taste but a nice creamy mouty feel.
Pours a dark copper from a bottle. Aroma is caramel maltiness, flavor is the same with some bitterness on the backside. Mouthfeel is a rich round shape. Good beer.

12 Oz bottle. Pours clear dark brown with a big tan head. Aromas of cereal grain, brown sugar and cinammon. Medium sweet flavor with nice burnt caramel and dark fruit. Roasted bitterness hit in the middle to balance it, leaving a pleasant burnt sugar flavor. Full body with a thick mouthfeel and average carbonation. Overall, really good example of the style.

12oz picked up at AJs Fine Wine in Scottsdale.

Aggressive pour left a 1" lite tan head... and little lacing.. slightly hazy light walnut brew with chestnut highlites when held to a light.

Deep dark malts with significant caramel ... lite dark fruits and lighter chocolate... very toasty as it warms.

Big body and lite whiffs of alcohol.. very creamy .. caramel with vanilly notes.. dark caramel and more rich toasty malts... no hops are present ... but some yeasty fruitiness could easily be mistaken for hops. Semi sweet for the style with a lingering dried fruit finish... yummy.

A very good Scotch Ale .

Quasiment aucune mousse pour cette scotch ale, au nez on est effectivement dans le scotch, le fût, cest boisé, fruité, fumé,caramel aussi.En bouche, cest en tout premier doux,sucré, caramel, le malt grillé, puis ca sassèche, le houblon arrive, ca reste quand meme doux, une trés légère amertume en fin de bouche, avec une touche non négligeable dalcool,ca reste facile à boire et laisse un bon petit gout au fond de la boite à ratiches. Bien fait, je suis pas sur de men reprendre une si je tombe dessus à nouveau parceque ça ne ma pas fait vibrer plus que ça, ca manque un peu de caractère

Rate 997. Love this brewery and this style. Wanted to love this and it was good but had a couple of flaws. Many aromas including malt toffee alcohol and slight smoke. Nice color and palate. Much of taste was great and as complex as aroma. Taste was like aroma. Just too much hops and alcohol which lowers rating some
33cl @ bottle. Aroma favoloso, però mi è andata giù davvero a fatica. Lo Scotch si sente anche se la gradazione alcolica non è tantissima. Da riprovare in altri contesti.

Hazy deep dark brown with a thin off white head. Lovely malty nose with a biscuity chocolaty tone with a cereal grain tone and a touch of sweet moss, and a touch meaty. Lovely deep malty flavor with a smooth body and a rich nutty toffee and gentle sweet peat-moss. Maybe some dark wheat and a touch of oat or maple. Really fantastic.

Aroma has plums, pear and roasted malts. Pours black with a small head that leaves beautiful lacing, Taste has medium sweetness and medium bitterness. Some salty licorice and smoke. Full body, average carbonation. Long bitter and malty finish. Overall an excellent beer.
Pours a very dark brownish ruby color with a thin fizzling beige head, Aroma is of slightly sour dark fruit. I taste subtle hops, dark fruit. A bit of sweetness and tart. Pretty good.

Bottle. Very dark ruby. Big malt richness with peaty smoke and some hoppy bitterness. One of the classics that made me love craft beer. An excellent strong ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Redemption Alewerks. Heavy chocolate aroma with a little bit of coffee. Taste is heavy on the chocolate in the front with a little coffee after ending with a very plesent malty bitterness. Absolutely fantastic stout.

Bottle pour, deep amber with small tan head, decent lacing. Aroma of Pilsner malts and yeast. Taste is boozy with light malt taste, and plenty of hop bitterness. Not enough sweet to balance the gravity and bitterness. I'd consider this just an average strong ale.

---Rated whilst imbibing
pours a clear dark ruby color with tan head. Toffee and bread flavors with some raisin

Bottle to shaker glass. Pours clear deep red mahogany, almost no head, lacing or retention. Aroma of roasted malts, smoke and nuts. Taste is malty sweet and nice bitter hop balance. Full bodied, faint carbonation, chewy mouth feel. Finishes complex with notes of smoky malts, dates, plum, anise, earthy bitter herbs and slight alcohol. Excellent example of the style. Good ale.
Dark red ale draft poured with ample head. A taste of molases that has a slight burnt taste.
Deep red brown pour with a nice lasting off white head. Aroma is nutty, molasses, and toast with a hint of peat. Taste follows but has an odd sharpness in the finish. Sweet and malty. Medium body.

A very good scotch ale. Medium body and creamy. Grassy and leafy hops sit on bready, cracker maltiness. Some peat, not real sweet, nutty, alcohol is mostly hidden and faint raisin.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tawny to dark brown in colour with a small head with no retention, heavy complex aroma roasted malts, caramel and grains, hints of herbs and grass, boozy flavour, heavy on roasted malts and caramel, warming sensation average carbonation yet lively in the mouth, slick, Pow what an experience great ale.
A nice strong ale that doesnt totally taste of alcohol. Bitter and peaty for sure. Mildly sweet and nutty. Not bad.
Bottle, 355 ml from Svijet Piva, Zagreb. Pours hazy brown with a small head. Dried fruits, caramel, liquorice, toffee. Sweet. Has alcohol note which I disliked. Cant say Im thrilled with this one.

Pours a mahogany-ruby red with one finger tan head which fades to pretty nice lacing. Aroma is of toffee, caramel, sweet malts, smoke, bread pudding, toasted bread, butterscotch, and brown sugar. Taste is pretty similar to the aroma with the addition of some light grassy and piney hops. Has a medium-full body with a creamy mouthfeel and a semi bitter, slightly dry, medium-long finish. Overall, a tasty, complex, well balanced scotch ale that is overly sweet like a lot of beer is the style.
UPDATED: SEP 2, 2016 couleur brun-rouge; petite mousse brune; arômes fruités et maltés; goût un peu vineux; un peu trop dalcool et de douceur

Wine color red with a thick tan foam. Deep malt aromatics of toast and biscuit. There is a slight raisin that hides away. Light carbonation but medium/full body. Toffee and and bread flavors have a touch of smoke in the finish.

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Pours brown to dark brown with a quite large white head. Heavy licorice nose. Thick body. Medium carbonation. Surprisingly bitter. Toffee, some coffee, malt, some licorice flavour.

Not much oomph for a Scottish ale... Would enjoy a heartier flavor!! Skfjkdkdkkdjjdjdjidehebebbdicnbeibrbdojd

Bottle picked up at Jacks Westholme Store, Goring-on-Thames, Oxon, consumed at Mums, Worcester, Thames, Friday 28th November 2014.   Pours dark brown with light beige head. Huge toffee flavours dominate, lots of bitter sticky bonfire toffee. Yes this is sticky and warming with the alcohol noticeable but to be fair it is far from harsh. It is soft in the mouth a little creamy, really pleasant. Far easier to drink than youd think. Nice, in fact it works well it is really nice if a tad one dimensional.  A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov15 3.8

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2016 Bottle from Bacchus Wine, Olney. Hazy chocolate brown. Heavy scent of molasses, caramel, toast. Gooey sweet malty taste, followed by a bittersweet finish. Very nice but less memorable than Founders best beers.

12oz bottle, ruby-mahogany color, with some reddish highlights, a small beige head, falling quickly. Nice sweet toffee, bread, caramelized, biscuity, toasted, pale malty nose, with some sponge toffee, caramelized bread crumb, caramel cookie dough, sugar pie crust, dried fruity, fig, raisin accents, and a faint caramel lollipop, french toast, english pudding, caramel granola bar, butterscotch pudding note in the aroma folllows through on a medium-bodied palate, with a warmth sweet toasted, caramelized, biscuity, pale malty, barley sugar character, with some light flowery leafy, citrus hop, caramelized candied orange, tangerine peel, toffee, sugar pie crust, fruity yeast, fruitcake, dried raisin, fig, caramel butterscotch, sponge toffee, french toast, subtle Grahams cracker flavours, leading towards a sweet toffee, caramelized, biscuity, toasted maltiness, faint lingering citrus, leafy hop bitterness finish.

November 3, 2014. Bottle at home. Clear ruby red with a yellowish dense head. Aroma is sweet malts, dried fruits, caramel, light peat. Taste is sweet malty up front with some light bitter roasted and smoked notes. Finish has sweet dried fruit, light bitterness and light peat. Medium bodied, average carbonation.

Toasty, sweet and warming. Bittersweet toffee after taste in the back of the throat.  A beast.  Is there any real difference between a Scotch Ale and a Wee Heavy?  Ive tried most of available  contenders.   Whatever, this brew rocks and will occupy a space in my frig through the winter until it is dethroned.

12 oz bottle shared from Total Wine & More - Gilbert, AZ. Lightly smoky, rich and malty with notes of caramel, toffee, earth and peat. Medium sweetness and light bitterness. Medium to full body with a nice balanced finish. Pretty easy to drink, but a nice one to sip on. Well done.

Hazy reddish brown in color with no head. Sweet, malt, alcohol aroma. Starts bold then fades nicely. Good sweetness and bitterness, taste a bit like a Belgian. The alcohol I smelt is also in the taste, hard to look past this. Good beer

Chestnut brown with a medium-fine, old-newspaper-colored head. Moderate rate of decay. Aroma of caramel, and deciduous forest after a rain, with a slight bit of alcohol. Toffee. Body is medium, low-medium carbonation with little burn. Somewhat syrupy due in part to lower carbonation.. Flavor is light caramel with a small, spicy hop bitterness to balance. Lingers but is not astringent in any way. Some mineral notes in there. Overall, a very nice scotch ale - drinkable and no smoke.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 Alla spina. Limpido color cola con riflessi rubino e cremosa schiuma beige. Avvolgenti sentori di caramello e melasso; gusto dolciastro e rotondo con note caramellate, maltose e leggermente fruttate, finale luppolato e persistente. Corpo medio, vellutata al palato, cremosa nella struttura e di effervescenza debole. Buona!
redish / brown, hazy color. very malty, tastes of oats, honey and dried plums. full body, taste reminds me of scotch or brandy. Alcohol is apparant. Malty sweetness. tastes of caramel. good texture

Bottle from Pothole ( 4,60 I think). BB 09/05/2015. Pours a strangely enchanting cloudy orange-brown with a small light tan head. Retains not for long; some lacing initially. Nose is thick caramelly sweetness with caramelised dark fruits, vanilla and chocolate, peat, slightly whiskey-like. Taste is similarily or slightly less complex with a more dominant malt character, and kind of smokey. Palate dry and malty, carbonation present but not obtrusive, body above medium. The high ABV only comes through hintingly and yet firmly when swallowing.

Overall a very good sipper, but I honestly expected it to be something more impressive - maybe should not have.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2015 Bottle. Copper body, medium to small head. Aroma has simple toffee and syrup. Sweet caramelly taste that veers dangerously close to becoming cloying. Finish offers some light peat but even the alcohol is lost in the syrup. Sticky finish. Not bad but not very good either. For a highly rated brew this is not complex or interesting enough. BTW, the label looks amateurish - like someones kid applied a Photoshop emboss filter to a random drawing of Groundskeeper Willie in 1998. Re-rate: The same batch, 1 month past BB now but I liked it a bit better this time. Feels less sweet and more complex now.
12 oz bottle poured into pint glass. Great, rich, malty aroma. No head on it at all. Alcohol is totally masked by carmel n scotch essence. My first scotch ale, thought it was great.

355ml bottle. Clear dark copper color. Small size, yellow head, stays.Massive caramel, faint roast, sweet, cake in aroma. Sweet, malty, cake, fruity, hops in taste. Sweet body. Caramel in aftertaste. Alcohol is very well covered.
Dark ruby color with small head. Very rich chocolate malt aroma, boozy, dark fruits. Sweet rich chocolate taste, bitterness towards the finish. Low to middle carbonation, sticky mouthfeel. Very good!

I am not a big fan of Scotch Ale but this IS A Whole new ball game . The mouth feel IS perfect . Almost Reminds me of a Belgian Double minus the yeast, Candied creamy goodness. Sorry about the upper case letters. Tried writing this review by hand writing with my s pen.

Bottle from strait and narrow, Lincoln. Dark ruby brown with no head. Stinks! Very farmy ie smells like manure, not necessarily a bad thing though. Taste is ridiculous malty treacley goodness, lovely. Tingly carbonation and a fairly full body.

Dark reddish brown color, small beige head. Aroma of caramel, malt, dried fruits, wood, spice. Taste has similar notes - sweet with bitter finish and lightly dry aftertaste. Medium to full body, average carbonation, warming touch of alcohol. Nice beer, rich and complex taste.

Nice reddish brown colour with pretty head and lots of lacing. Aroma has nuts, citrus, red berries, caramel malts and some roasted notes. Taste has caramel malts, citrus hops, some pine and wood. Full and soft body, medium carbonation. Excellent scotch ale, so much flavours in great balance.

Decided to try this after seeing that Founders was rated #1 in the top 50 breweries in the USA by The Daily Meal. I havent had a better beer that was brewed anywhere. As their website says, at 8.5% this "aint for the wee lads". Exquisite beer.
Not a big fan of scotch ales, but this is different. Nice creamy finish is what hits you first, and a beautiful brown color. Good brew.
Bottle 33cl at Colletts. Disappearing white layer. Hazy grey black. Aroma is berries, raisins, prunes, leather, meat. Taste is sweet of meat and berries.

355ml bottle at the Tipping Point Brewing Co on Wyndham Street in Hong Kong. Poured into a tulip glass. Dark red/brown in colour with a very small tan coloured head which quickly disappears. Medium carbonation. Sweet aroma, caramel malt and plum. Heavy body, taste of caramel, fruits, chocolate and a little coffee. A chewy mouthfeel. A beer with a lot going on, and a lot going for it.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2016 355 ml, bottled. BB 04/09/16. Pours murky red with a fine beige head. Aroma: Toasted malt, milk chocolate. Taste: Medium sweet, gainy flavour. Milk chocolate. Rye. Roasted malt. Dark bread. Mild acidity. Nuts. Palate: Medium body, average carbonation. Oily feel. Nuts and notable bitterness in aftertaste.+2 O. 
-----
355 ml, bottled. Aroma: Bready malt, Taste: Medium+ sweet, some bitterness. Malty flavours, raisins. Slight acidity. Licorice. Palate: Medium body, avg co2. Ok. (14.11.2014, 6-3-6-3-10)

Ruby red beer, tan head, filmy retention, spotty lacing. Nose is fruity caramel with malt and sweet notes. Flavor is toasty malt, caramel, nutty notes, almost sticky sweetness, hoppy-fruity medium bitter finish. Lingering alcohol, caramel and hops, some bitterness.

355 ml bottle 
Ruby red to mahogany brown colored lear beer with beige head. Aroma has bready malts, slight peat, earthiness, herbs, vanilla and chocolate. Flavor has malts, herbs, dark fruits, raisin, toffee and coffee. Palate is full with heavy carbonation, slightly foamy. Finish has heavy bitterness. Aftertaste has alcohol, herbs, coffee acidicy and toffee sweetness. Decent for slow sipping, but I dont find it that enjoyable. Reminds me of a doppelbock.

Bottle into a pint glass. pours a deep ruby, with a small tan head which quickly fades. Good lacing. Nose is malt and peat smoke. Taste is wonderfully complex, with a slightly sweet, smoky, malty flavor which deepens as it warms. The reference standard for Scotch ales. Outstanding.

Fantastisk sötmaltig med all tänkbar mörk choklad, fudge & grejer som en Ben & jerrys glass. Man känner väl av alkoholens sötma. Men alkoholen blir inte stickig utan balanserad jämt ut. Tyvärr är min sorry bastard lagrad så de 50 IBU's har nog gjort sitt. Man märker att det är en Scotch Ale, en riktigt bra sådan!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a cloudy light brown brew with a small reddish head with moderate retention, aroma is heavy sweet and moderate bitter with caramel, tofee and earthy hops, robust bodied, smooth, flavor is heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a bittersweet finish and a medium aftertaste, good

Appearance is deep brown with ruby red highlights and minimal off white foam cap. Aroma is rich, peat and smoked malt. Taste is rich caramel and roast malt, with hints of whiskey and vanilla. Mouthfeel is light to medium with a slight creaminess, low carbonation, and hint of alcohol warmth. Finishes a little dry and sticky on the tongue with a bit of roasted malt

Poured from 12 oz. bottle. 

Hazy rusty orange with small, fine khaki head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of sweet rich caramel malt with a little plum and cherry. 

Taste of sweet rich caramel malt, a light spiciness, raisins, plums, alcohol, nuts and just a hint of wood. 

Medium body and medium/high carbonization. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Cloudy red amber. Minimal head. Scotch-like, sweet malts on aroma. Sweet, bourbon, bitter, salmiac on taste. Strong and full. Interesting ale.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
UPDATED: FEB 25, 2017 Aika tanakkaa viinaa, mutta onpa maku kohillaan. Haju ja väri hyvät. Suutuntuma mukava, ja alkoholia reilusti. Hyvä iltajuoma.

Rich, sweet, very strong alc taste. Maybe a bit too strong. Amazing malt nose. I think that after this beer I became a Scotch Ale fan. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,355L bottle, best by 09.05.2015. Pours red copper with tan head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is sweet, caramel, malt. Flavor is sweet, burnt sugar, malt, caramel, fruits, citrus. Finish is caramel and fruity dry bitter. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: great brew.
Bottle at drink baar, tallinn. Dark brown color, tanned head. Aroma is malty, woody, spices. Taste is malty, little roasty, woody, spices, full body.

Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours reddish brown with small head. Aroma is like sweet plum,malty, caramel, cherry. Taste is sweet, dried fruits, raisins, bit watery, alcohol. Not bad beer just not the kind I like.
Rich, sweet, complex brew with lots of tart, bittersweet fruits. Heavy on the malts and with a fair amount of alcohol on the finish. Tastes much like a Doppelbock.

From the bottle, pours a very dark brown with a thick off white head. Smells like the reason I got into beer. Aromas of caramel malts dominate, with a rich freshness that gets you excited to drink it. Rich and smooth up front, flavors of malt, caramel, a light, earthy bitterness to balance out the silky mouthfeel, a hint of cherries. Much better in a glass (should go without saying), really good overall beer.

355 ml bottle. Hazy dark reddish brown colour, thin tan head. Lovely aroma of sweet dried fruits, caramel malt, notes of wood. The flavour is toasted malty, with caramel, dark fruits, woody notes and a moderately bitter finish. Delicious.

Sample from tap. Clear ruby red and golden. Smell is roasted malt with sweet caramel. Taste is roasted malt, warm alcohol, sugar and nutty. A bit unbalanced in my opinion. Sweet with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

Bottle. Dark brown, hazy, small to average fully diminishing light brown head. Moderate to full, malty and sweetish aroma, some caramel and dark bread and with light dark fruitiness with light hoppyness. Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish, some caramel and light dark bread, light hoppyness and fruitiness with light alcohol. Finish is average, malty and sweetish, some caramel and light roasted malt, light metal, light hoppyness and some alcohol. Your typical Scotch Ale - really nothing special. For those with sweet tooth.

Clear deep amber nutty color with a fine off white head. Looks really nice. Lovely aroma. Fruity, raisins, toffee and caramel. Full to medium body. A bit sweet, but not to sweet. Stays on the right side. A bit oily texture. This beer really invades your mouth, and stays there. Lovely. Toffee, caramel, fruity, raisins and prunes.[Bottle at SOT Bar & Burger in Trondheim, Norway]

Bottle from Alko. A bit hazy ruby coloured beer. Sweet maltiness, some toffee, ripe fruits and hops. I feel its a bit like a barley wine and disappointed a little. Had better and more interesting Scotch ales in Italy.

A very dark brown beer with a weak and light brown head. The nose is complex and quite sweet, caramel, raisins, strawberries, wood, generic dried fruits, hint of roasted bread and chocolate. Taste isnt so sweet than aroma. Taste has dried fruits, raisins, dry wood, bread, clear and nice bitterness in the end. Even the more sweetness of fruits could be there. Medium+ bodied, low carbonation, easy to drink, anyway. Very complex, at least the aroma. Good beer.

Pours a dark ruby brown with very small thin head which lingers. On the nose there is dark dried fruits like raisins and prunes, brown sugar, caramel, a bit of smoke, resin and wood. Taste initially is highly sweet which lasts throughout but is balanced with enough bitterness to make it work. Quite a thick and oily mouth feel, rather nice!
Bottle. Hazy deep amber color with a thin frothy off-white head. Malty aroma of nuts, almond, butter and caramel. Sweet malty taste with some bitterness. Medium body.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 330ml bottle poured in a snifter glass.
A: Pours a slightly cloudy dark amber color forming a medium thin bubbled tan head. Load retention and only few spotty lacings left in the glass. A very thin layer remains on the top for a long time
S: Sweet and roasted. Strong notes, toffee, caramel, brown sugar, chocolate and oak. Caramel malts, roasted malts, dark fruits like grapes and raisins. Flowery hops
T: Sweet upfront. Strong notes of toffee and caramel. Notes of oak, chocolate, roasted malts, brown sugar, dark fruits. The sweetness is short and in the very beginning. Quickly, it becomes quite dry and malty. Some earthiness and some citrus hops can be felt too in the end
M: Medium body and medium to low carbonation. Very smooth and slightly molasses in the mouth. Malty, toffee and woody aftertaste
O: Good drinkability. Another Founders masterpiece. It sounds like they cant make a mistake...
[ BA Review @ 12/27/2013 ]

Cola brown beer with a small head. Bread and caramel on the nose. Medium bodied. Sweet bread, caramel, a hint of anis, some herbal notes. Quite good. Just a little thin for the ABV but is more drinkable this way.

Pours a darker brown with medium head. Aroma is caramel and roasty. Some sweetness in the background. Taste is on the sweeter side with background hints of hops. Aftertaste is also sweet with more carel and hops.
Very rich taste. Dense and powerful. Bitter finish stays there. Great colour by the way.

Dark brown with cappuccino coloured head. Rich, sweet, alcoholic aroma with prune and other dark dried fruit, chocolate cake. Full bodied, malty, not too sweet, balancing but not overpowering bitterness. Very well crafted and balanced scotch ale.
Sample at SBWF 2014. Fruity and malty smell with caramel. Sweet malty taste, with caramel and fruits. Very nice and complex with a nice and heavy malt focus.

An insanely tasty and hardy scotch ale. Tons of chocolate-raisin, honey, molasses, and burnt caramel. Pours a dark brown with a thick short head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is surprisingly mild. Some malt.

Color is medium brown with some copper.

Taste is mostly malt and alcohol sweetness but there is some hops to provide a little balance, but basically a malt beer. A hint of raisin that is quite nice.

Palette is a bit of carbonation and some oiliness that adds some interest.

Overall a pretty good beer.

Bottle to tulip
Aroma of scotch, malt, molasses, smoke, and peat. It pours a dark red with a 3 cm head that reduces to 1 cm in 30 seconds, leaving a mottled tan head. Taste is scotch, caramel, molasses, lots of malt, peat and some nice hoppy bitterness.
"a tiny bit of hop presence. subtle smoke in the nose and flavor. roasted malty sweet with peat and nice layers of complexity. standout in the style for sure."

Bottle from the roommate. Pour is so dark amber brown/red I can barley see through it. Head dissipated after a few minutes but was had thin lacing and about half a finger. Aroma of caramel, malt, prune juice, rootbeer, cranberries, and licorice. Very interesting nose.medium light body. I too get a nutty, fruity toffee flavor that is sweet in the front and boozy in the back. Kinda like the mullet of beer. Favorite scoth ale right now.

Bottle from SuperBest Amar Foodmarket, Copenhagen - dark brown coloured pour with beige head. Medium sweet malty aroma and taste, toasty, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, dried fruity and nutty, some spices on the palate, good mouthfeel, nice boozy finish. Quality brew.
Delicious. Great malt flavors. Doesnt taste as alcoholic as it is. Rich complex notes.

You can always count on Founders to deliver a great beer experience and this brew is definitely no exception! Pours a dark ruby brown color with a big head that dissipates quickly. The aroma is complex (a portent of things to come) with cherry, toffee, and other rich notes. Taste is extremely complex, though I dont perceive any smokiness, there are a broad range of notes- nuts, dried fruits, toffee, and some burnt hints towards the end (but in a great way). This is a "warmer" beer, with a bit of booziness to it that is very subtle (and cozy on a cold rainy night!) Its advertised as Founders flagship brew, I can no doubt understand why. This is a superb beer, and definitely the best scotch ale Ive ever had.

Really nice caramel aroma, along with tight head and brown amber color. This tasted really malty but despite its malty sweetnes, which was wonderful, it finished nice and dry. Not cloying whatsoever. Perfect balance of this malt forward brew.

Bottle from a shop in Sao Paulo. The dirty bastard is dark red brown colored with a smooth tan head. It is a very malty ale with caramel, toffee and smoke aroma as well as the expected alcohol and some roastiness. Sweet taste with some fruity-hoppiness in the finish. The body is strong and thick as it should be with a warm alcoholic finish.

Café, ótimo paladar, interessante, estilo bock com boa finalização espuma cremosa

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark brown with decent head. At first didnt get a lot of flavor, but complexity started to show as beer warmed up a bit. Taste of raosted malts predominate. I didnt notice any smoke. Very enjoyable.
This beer had everything you want from a scotch ale. Think, smoky a bit of hops and a nice kick. Love it

Reddish brown with tan head. Soft aroma, sweet caramel. Taste is sweet, caramel, malty, mild alcohol and no bitterness. Medium to full body. Very good but I get no hops and no smoke. Wonder if I got an old bottle. Feel like Im drinking curmudgeon.
Aroma and taste of butterscotch great example of tasty full flavoured malty goodness. Very nice smooth tasty beer. Deceptively smooth!!!
12oz bottle thanks to Rob. Pours a reddy brown color with a bit of head. Smooth easy going Scottish ale. Nice spice, lots of malt and good alcohol balance.

Brown/deep red appearance with a light brown head. Smells of scotch, sweet toffee and malts. Tasting a very slight coffee with toffee and molasses. Theres some spice in there with with a hint of gently burnt toffee. The sweetness and bitterness balance out really well - this is an extremely well rounded beer. Really dense mouth feel, gentle carbonation and beautiful lingering thick after feel. This is great.
Pure caramel and burnt sugar followed by spicy toffiness and a thick sugary hit with an even coating of the mouth both in flavour and bitterness. The 8% is hidden perfectly

Dirty Bastard is basically everything you want a Scotch Ale to be: boozy, rich, complex. Providing an excellent balance between bitter and malty, Founders did a fantastic job of giving some spicy edge to this immense malt bomb on an ale. Flavors of dark fruits, toffee, smoked peat, and roasted malt make the strongest impressions. Expect a full-bodied mouthfeel with some pleasant alcohol warmth (and added sweetness), as well. This ale may be called Dirty Bastard, but it certainly makes a clean getaway.

Bonus bottle from Homer321; Thanks Sean. Nose is sweet toffee, with hints of molasses and smoke. Very malt forward. Hazy brown with a small beige head. flavor is sweet and malty with only a very tiny hint of bitterness.

355 ml. bottle. Clear, amber to deep red colour with a thin, lightly tanned head. Sweet aroma with caramel malts, overripe fruits, light smoke and peat. Toasted malt and toffee. Light booze. Rather rich. Taste is sweet. Full body with an oily texture and a soft carbonation. Long lasting dry finish with floral hops and a peat note. A rather rich beer - the smoked notes and hops mellows down the malts. Good.

Bottle 0,35L. Clear, dark amber/red colour with average big, frothy, light brown, long lasting head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel and some dry fruits. Taste starts moderate bitter with dry fruits on tongue and finish heavy bitter and slightlysmoked. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Another excellent Founders brew!
This is a good example of a style I dont care for. Scottish ale are too sweet for me.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2015 On tap, poured into a shaker-like glass. The aroma is roasty with notes of raisin, fig, cherry, caramel, and bread. It pours an oily looking, raisin brown.The head is tan in color and sudsy, but reduces down to a clear, clean surface, clean ring, and clean glass. The taste is a good balance between medium sweet and medium bitter. The oily texture has a medium high body, and a sudsy, small bubble carbonation. Initial flavors are slightly burnt with characters of dark chocolate, coffee, light fig, and bread. The finish has flavors of coffee, fig, light cherry, chocolate, caramel, toast, and cookies. The aftertaste is bready and burnt; mild but long lasting
Bottle. Cloudy mahogany liquid. Small tan head. Full body, light carbonation. Caramel aroma. Bitter aftertaste. Medium sweetness.

Pours clean with a caramel chocolate aroma and a rich red/brown hue. Slightly hazy on the pour but quickly clears. The taste mirrors the aroma with rich caramel and light chocolate flavors which have a fruity finish due to the high alcohol level. Full body and thick with average carbonation and a long finish

Love this one. Very beautiful red-caramel color in glass with beige head. Aroma of caramel and maybe cherry or fig. Tastes like malt, burnt caramel. Very drinkable. A favorite and staple in our house.
Bottle. This beer is absolutely great, taste is amazing and I'd drink it quite a bit. Very good beer.
Draft at Founders. Pours a dark ruby color. Aroma and taste are caramel, malts, and is very easy to drink.

Strong. Very strong flavor accompanies by deep color and a nice off white head when poured. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2016 Bottled. Pours a deep rich caramel color with little head. Aroma is rich caramel, toffee, and of course a scotch. Flavor is toffee, vanilla, caramel, bready maltiness. Slightly bitter finish along with a smoke and oakiness. Warm sort of booziness but pleasant.

slight yellow head, fades with with some lacing. dark brown colour. aroma is caramel, sweet, oxidized, barleywine like, dried fruits, raisins, boozy, figs. taste like aroma but finish is bitter and ends very wry like from burnt raisins (krenten) or burnt sugar. quite dense and viscous pour, soft carbonation. the aftertaste spoiled it for me, pitty. bottle 35.5cl

Disclaimer: I really like Scotch Ales. Poured from bottle into shaker. Dark, translucent amber, with thin white head that diminishes immediately. Smell is packed with sweet malts and caramel, bursting out of the bottle as soon as its opened. Taste is more sweet malts, with a very slight boozy finish. Feel is nice and smooth. Overall, I really like this beer.

# 3513
ersma: welch einladender name für ein bier. ein schotch style ale, das kommt einem nicht so oft ins glas. gibts auch als variante mit bourbon-getränkten rosinen und vanille.
dunkelbraun bis schwarz mit viel beige-farbigem schaum, der sich stabil gibt.
der geruch ist süßlich bis süß, melassig. aromen von sirup und etwas röstmalz. 
der antrunk ist ebenfalls sehr süß. schoko, karamell und noch mehr schoko, dahinter pflaume und rosine. die mitte bringt zusätzlich etwas hopfen mit, betonung auf etwas. die karamell- und schokonoten bleiben bis zum abgang sehr intensiv. ebenso die süße, die schon nach dem ersten schluck klebrige lippen macht. auch pflaume und rosine finden sich im abgang wieder, ebenso röstmalz.
die flasche ist ok.
fazit: die süße und klebrigkeit sind anstrengend. aromatisch ok, aber jetzt auch nicht der überflieger, als der es von vielen hingestellt wird. gut trinkbar, mehr nicht.
13,9,9,8,9,9 - 9,25

355ml bottle @ Silja Symphony. Mahogany color, thin tan head. Aroma is dark bready, very malty, raisin with some notes of smoke. Flavor has raisins, plums, bread, hops. Long, dry raisiny finish. Quite the sipper. Full bodied, no sign of alcohol here. Solid.

12 oz bottle from Steve
pours like a stout
nice malt aroma
really smooth malt slight bitterness
seems I really like good scotch ales
Bottle from Clapton Craft. Pours tartan with ginger head. Aroma is Commonwealth 2014. Taste is raisin, milk chocolate and haggis. Not bad beer :)

Beautiful pour from a bottle. Lasting cream colored head over dark clear ruby amber. Just a little caramel on the nose. Flavor is light caramel with some dark fruit and malt. Tiniest bit of smoke. Surprisingly dry with a pleasant spicy bitter finish. Really smooth and yummy.

Pours dark amber/brown on tap. Aroma of burned sugar, caramel, and malt. Smooth flavor of malt with some oakiness. Good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dunkel mørk brun farve med lyd beige skum. Lukt av røstet malt, karamell, sjokolade og vanilje. Smak av malt, karamell, sjokolade og frukt. Venøs. Melkebaren.
Duft av stikkelsbær, ei og noe karamell. Dunkel brun farge. Lite skum, litt heng langs kant. God smak av rosin og karamell.

Bottle.

A- Caramel, burnt sugar, sweet, dark fruits, dough.

A- Very dark mahogany color, clear dark liquid, off white head.

T- Caramel malts, brown sugar, slightly sweet, dried dark fruits, 

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, strong finish.

O- A very good beer. More of a Barleywine than any scotch ale I have had. Full of complexity and lots of flavor. The malts make for a sweet caramely dark fruity goodness. Much good to be said about this beer.
Bottle. Aroma is like chocolate raisins with some woody character. Appearance is a dark reddish brown and translucent. Taste is sweet and bitter. A heavy bodied ale with a bitter bite on the finish.
Damn tasty. Dark red brownish pour thin head. Lots of malt and some peat aroma. Toffee and caramel with peat and roasted peanuts. Very tasty and a nice to go beer. Medium body light carbonation.
Deep ruby-brown with no head. Smells like peat, licorice, dark fruit. Taste is quite smoky; lots of peat, some sweetness. Hops give it a crisp backbone. Very good.

Bottle - small foamy head, nice dark amber color, sweet rich malty aroma and flavor with a hint of smoke - very good for a scotch style ale (which I am normally not a big fan of)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy red/brown with a beige ring around the edge of the glass.
Aroma has caramel, lots of sweetness and vanilla.
Taste is as above but with a small hop bite.
Medium/full body, soft carbonation.
Dry after taste.
Bottle from Archive Beer Boutique August 2013. Another very good scotch ale from these guys. Big vanilla and toffee notes and a smooth almost rum like flavour.

Elegáns, mahagóni színe van, habja pedig bézs, krémes és nagyjából egy ujjnyi vastagságban állapodik meg.
