A fő csapásvonalat a kakaópor bársonyos illata jelenti, melyhez csatlakozik egy huncutul édeskés, zselés szaloncukor, gyümölcslekvár, egy kevés rum, szárított narancs aromája, melyek alapján talán nem tűnik túlzásnak, ha azt mondom, egy egészen különleges és egyedi illattal operál, melyhez foghatóval ritkán találkozhatunk. Selymes ízében visszaköszön a kakaó és kávé, minőségi étcsokoládé és egy kevés szivarfüst alkoholos támogatású jelenléte, majd egyfajta édes zöldséges utóíz következik egy vékony, gyógynövényes-komlós réteggel. Mindez egy közepes testben és mérsékelt szénsavtartalommal, korántsem visszafogott, vagy felejthető ízélményt produkálva.

Poured from 355mL bottle. Copper brown with full beige head. Aroma has lots of caramel malt, some subtle chocolate, and toffee. Same taste with a bit of alcohol. A little lighter bodied than I wouldve thought.
Deep dark brown very murky color, thin tan head. Fairly faint aroma overall, semisweet, roasty. More roasty flavor as well, semisweet, chocolate. Moderate bitterness. High carbonation for style.

Bottle - pours deep ruby with a big of white head. The aroma alludes to a big beer, lots or rich sweet caramel malt, dried fruit and burnt sugar. Taste sweet up front before transitioning into a mellow caramel and dry finish. Mouthfeel is rich and creamy.

Bottle, 0.355l. Hazy dark brown color with small creamy tan-like head and poor lacing. Aroma of strong caramel, dried fruits, dandelion syrup and cask wood. Taste starts with smooth and rich maltiness, follows by dried fruits and alcohol, mouth coating, while finish is almost without any bitterness. Full body, syrupy texture and average carbonation in palate. Damn strong scotch ale...

From a bottle shared by jheath99! Pours clear copper brown with a bubbly beige head. Tastes like roasted malt, booze, nutty, light dryness and light astringency. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like alcohol, nutty, roasted malt, dry toast.

Bottle shared by jheath99. Pours clear dark amber with ruby highlights and creamy beige head. Aroma is bready and cookie malts, caramel, fig, dates, light berries, and faint floral notes. Flavor is malty with some caramel sweetness, light woody notes, light hop bitterness, and faint dark fruit esters; dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

A very drinkable scotch ale. Strong notes of caramel and scotch. Would highly recommend it.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Mahogany pour with a very small head. Very malty, with raisin and toffee, oaky notes and a touch of peat and chocolate. Very rich and complex, nice full mouthfeel, well balanced. A great scotch ale.

It is ruby indeed. Great color and sticking head. It smells of sweet malt and mild roasty grains. Palate is lingering and boozy, but not overpowering. The abv WILL sneak up on you... get your moneys worth though! A solid malty style from my favorite brewery.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2014 Bottle (12oz): Very dark amber. Very small head. Somewhat sweet. A little burnt. Overall very nice.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Updated rating from 3.9 to 4.1

An extremely rich brew that I had in bottle at Porterhouse in Dublin. Pours a dark muddy brown with a finger of dense beige head. The aroma is rich and malty with caramel and toffee notes in abundance. A bit sweet in the middle with light caramel apple flavours and hints of spice and earthy characters. The finish is heavy and rich with some boozy warmth as though aluding to its scotch namesake. Overall the best scotch ale Ive had.

Bottle pour. Bottled but 3 weeks ago in Grand Rapids, where this was opened. Pours a deep brown/caramel color with a small head. This is peat, malt and smoke. A beer that would go down a treat with a whiskey chaser. All the typical characteristics of a Scotch ale but ramped up to a bold finish.

On tap at Malarkeys in Lake of the Ozarks. Aroma is quite restrained - perhaps it is too cold and we will see if it opens up a bit. Beautiful copper-mahogany with light tan head that webs down the glass and leaves a dusting across the top with a full collar. Taste is rich caramel with overt chocolate and slightly smoky on the backend.
Very nice dark amber, decent head and carmel flavor. Very drinkable and not a heavy hops taste.
Great taste! Perfect balance of hops and flavor. First beer I had at Founders. Definitely recommend!

Im not a fan of Founders as of yet but this scotch ale is making me rethink that notion. Dark plum hue. Lacy head. Malty. It has a butterscotch sensibility buoyed by a full body. The wash down is smooth. I like the fluidity of the beer. The ABV is an 8ish but it seems deceptively more boozy. Frankly, a nice scotch ale. Pleasantly surprised.
Draft. Pours black with off white head that disappears fast. Nice toasty flavor. The alcohol taste comes through a little.

0.355 l bottle, this one was Markos I guess, so thanks for sharing! It poured clear amber-copper body with modest ivory head. Fine malty aroma, caramel, figs and honey mostly. Quite sweet flavor as well, caramel, some dried fruits and sugar. Showed only subtle hints of wood and maybe some herbal hops but I wasnt sure anymore. Medium to full in body, with alcohol evident but nicely subdued so far. Nice long, sweet, thick finish, alcoholic as well (bitter bite). Not nearly complex as expected, also expected more from it, but a fine and effective ale anyway.

Bottle, 355ml. A dark rubi beer with a creamy head. It has a strong alcohol aroma with some dry fruits. The aroma is complex and there are a lot of things I can´t distinguish yet. Taste is bitter, especially at the end, very dense and maybe with a hint of chocolate. This beer is medium on carbonation and astringency. Overall a magnificent beer.

Bottle, 355ml. Pours a deep, dark ruby colour, not exactly cloudy, but pretty opaque, with a creamy tan head. Intense, rich aroma of dry fruits, caramel and alcohol. Medium to robust bodied, smooth, with low cabronation and astringency. Heavy roasted character with hints of nut and spices, Well balanced with a strong bitter and alcohol finish. A class ale.

Pours deep mahogany red with a large tan head. Smells strongly of caramel and hints of roast. Taste is caramel sweetness and hints of resinous hops. Full-bodied with a slick texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Founders Dirty Bastard Scotch Ale finishes with a slightly cloying sweetness.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2014 Laroma è sicuramente il suo punto forte: deciso, complesso e avvolgeste! I suoi 50 IBU non si sentono, coperti da un corpo strutturato e ricco di sapori, dove emergono il maltato, il caramello, il biscottato e il tostato. Un eccellente esempio di Scotch Ale.
Aroma of sweet malt, appearance is deep red with tan head, taste is sweet beginning with a hint of bitter chocolate with a little alcohol burn
I really like the flavor n aroma of this smooth Scottish ale. I feel like I need to don my kilt n visit my relatives!
This is my go to beer right now. It has a nice bold flavor and tastes best between fridge and room temperature.

Bottle. Dark chestnut brown with a medium sized beige head. Caramel, molasses, chocolate, rum, spices, warming alcohol, toasted malt. Medium/full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, medium sweet and bitter. Pretty soft and pleasant. Scotch ale or barley wine?
On tap at The Roundhouse Taproom Hong Kong. Thought this beer would be bigger. Some fruits, darker fruits and citrus, caramel and hints of smoke. Sticky, medium body. Soft carbonation.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a deep copper red color with a thick rocky beige head. Subtle caramel malt nose with hints of smoke and milk chocolate. Sweet toasted malt flavor has notes of caramel, sweet coffee, raisins and smoky peat. Very smooth, yet complex. Finish is chewy with a sticky, spicy hop finish. This is a nice Scotch style ale worth seeking out.

Bottle. The Dirty Bastard presents himself as a lovely deep red beer with just a small off-white head. The aroma is a barrage of deep caramel malt, raisins, brown sugar, a nutty quality. Sweet, dark ripe fruits. Bold and rich: pleasant.

Pours a dark ruby red with a creamy frothy head and decently laced. Aromas of aged crystal malts (caramel), caramel, caramel, caramel, brown sugar, nutty, raisin and some dark molasses. Flavors of raisin, caramel, brown sugar, molasses and a hint of grass. Medium sweet and primarily malt driven. Taste much like a dopplebock! Good desert beer.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2015 From the ticks: 4/4/2013 Malty, thick and heavy. Noted that it was a bit yeasty.
2/6/2015 Malty, dark roasted, coffee in the nose. Thinner then I remember. Pleasantly carbonated. Easy drinking. Slightly sharp. Soft and quick aftertaste. Smoky finish as promised.

Smell is vanilla, sweet, peaty and old malt. Pours dark reddish. Taste is malt, sticky, peaty and a slight bit of hops and or alcohol. Rich body. Not a fan of the style but if I were Id say this is pretty good. As it is, I dont like it at all. Too sweet, and a hint boozy. Down the drain it goes!

On tap at 1885 at in st elmo. Very good beer. Smooth finish. Great aroma. Refreshing on a hot day. Will get again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a deep, deep reddish-brown, with a medium light-colored head. Roasted malts are at the nose and a little booze shines. A tad bitter, medium body, and a dry finish.

I had a "Founders" evening and drank this prior to drinking Kentucky Breakfast Stout. Nice rich red color with stark flavoring. Very malty and good hop finish,. I didnt find it to be a "bastard" at all.

This beer pours a dark copper with a medium off white head that left a lot of lacing around the gas. The aroma was very toasty, some caramel and sweetness, and slight plum as well. The taste caramel, some sweetness, the ibus are masked very well. The mouthfeel is syrupy and medium heavy. Not my favorite beer from founders but a solid beer that is worth a try!
Tap at Houston beer fest. Reddish brown pour with a lot of mocha head. Caramel, oak, raisin. Smooth medium body. Awesome sweet and balanced/silky finish

Pours a brilliant red when the peering through the light with a tiny head from bottle. Lightly carbonated. Taste of alcohol, malt, sweetness and scotchiness. Smooth moderately thick mouthfeel that?s not very carbonated
Deep chestnut color with off white head. Huge malty aroma. Sweet sticky aroma. Full bodied and raisin really come ls through. One of the best. I have had for the style. Finishes sweet and sticky.
Very nice and sweet. Aromatic and quite malty. Nice aftertaste and in shape is also good.

Poured from bottle courtesy of Marko. Honey, chocolate, caramel malt, alcohol. Also in flavor. Brown color. Well balanced sweetness and bitterness. Sweetness dominates. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma mostly malty, fruity, raisins, plums. Hints of alcohol. Caramel, touch of chocolate. Clear amber to brown colour. Taste is fruity, raisins, caramel, chocolate. Background bitterness. Light alcohol.

Bottle from Svijet Piva. Shared with the Croat & Slovak crews. Yay! Poured a dark amber-red body with an off white head. Malty aroma, honey, alcohol, slightly sticky. Dry malty taste, not nearly as sweet as expected, slightly creamy but bitter, light herbal notes, raisins, good, but not as good as Id expected.

Bottle from Archer Road Beer Stop, Sheffield. I nearly always have one of these in the cellar. I never get to rate it, mind you, because its the Missuss favourite, and she always beats me to it. Except today. And the verdict is, shes very discerning...
Crazy good beer. Bottle from Fry's Grocery. Pours deep amber with thin tan head. Tastes of malt and dried fruit. Delicious. Hops are subtler than 50 IBU's suggests.
Bottle. Amber-copper color with a light tan head. Really tasty beer. Aroma was caramel, candy corn. Taste is sweet caramel with a slight hoppy finish.

Bottle into a DFH Ale signature glass-- Pours a dark mahogany with very little head. Has a somewhat sweet smell maybe dark fruits? First thing I tasted was booze (not complaining), yep booze with a slight Scotch ale flavor coming through at the end and than alcohol at the back of the tongue and throat to finish it off. This is a little different than the other Scotch Ales Ive had but it is good and it will be interesting to see how many I can put away tonight.

Dégustée (bouteille) le 8 juin 2012 au Mondial de la Bière 2012 à Montréal (D7C4KPPO). Bière brune limpide. Col mince très durable. Odeur de caramel. Douce, très sucrée, peu amère. Saveur de caramel/toffee bien présente. Pas trop sirupeuse, bien équilibrée, alcool bien caché, ne ressort pas trop. Très bonne, se boit bien même si très sucrée.
Pours a nice brown color with off-white head. Sweetness, bourbon, caramel malt, and earth on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with an earthy tone.

This is the beer that originally turned me on to craft beer. Probably the best scotch ale I have had. Not too sweet like many other scotch ales. The hops still come through with some peat in the aftertaste. Great beer, easy to find, not too expensive. This is one of my go-to beers.

Tap in a tulip glass at Republic Uptown. An unbelievable $3 value. Dark amber color with a white head. A surprisingly easy to drink scotch ale. Aroma is sugar-filled and malty. A balanced flavor profile with a pleasant finish. Malty, caramel, and some bitter notes. Biscuity comes to mind. A good one if you?re looking for a scotch ale.

You can definitely tell that it's a scotch ale. Dark, bold, hoppy with a full finish this is a keeper. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark cherry red from the bottle with a bubbly head that dissipates quickly. Nice aroma of caramel, malt and dark fruit. Tastes of toffee, chocolate malt and a nice balance of cherry and plum. A good bit of booze to boot. Medium mouth with good carbonation. This is one of the better wee heavies that Ive had. So much flavor, and everything blends together so, so well.

Type: 12-oz. bottle
Glass: Hotel glass
From: Whole Foods in Tempe, Ariz.
Price: $2.59
Purchased: May 15, 2014
Consumed: May 15, 2014
Misc.: Bottled Feb. 23, 2014

Poured a caramel, red, semi-clear color with 1-to-2 fingers of tan head that dissipated pretty quickly. Average-to-above average foamy layered lacing along the sides of the glass. Below average-to-minimal lacing on the top.

Smelled red amber malts, boozy, caramel, toffee, dark apple, dark fruits, dark berries, raspberry iced tea and candied sugar.

Tasted completely different than the smell. Got light butterscotch, caramel, toffee, candied sugars, booziness, roasty nuts and dark fruits.

Medium body. Creamy texture. Average carbonation. Long, smooth finish.

Just a really good beer. Smooth and tasty. Id try it again.
Medium body, dark amber. Aroma of caramel with a hint of barrel wood and alcohol. Taste of caramel, some alcohol, a tiny hint of flowers. Lasting aftertaste and low carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2017 (Founders Dirty Bastard Scotch Ale) Bottle 355ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 8.5%
Deep brown colour on the body, tall and thick beige head on top, with very good retention.
Aroma of caramel, red and dark fruits, toffee, sugars.
Taste follows, sugars, caramel, toffee, dark fruits, marmalade, red fruits, prunes, raisins. Mostly sweet but with a nice bitter finish.
Medium body, good carboanation.
Nice.




From a bottle at Zeebra II. 
Beautiful appearance, with a deep red ruby colour on the body, very clear, a small off-white head on top, with good retention for its size and light lacing left on the glass.
Aroma of dark fruits, with prunes and raisins, caramel, sweet malts, sugar.
Taste also of dark fruits, strong prunes taste, raisins, toffee, moderate bitter, some caramel too.
Medium thin body, good carbonation, nicely dry on the palate.
Good one.

Clear dark ruby color with small off white head. Aroma of malts, yeast, toffee, dark fruits and faint smoke. Taste of malts, caramel, toffee, dark fruits and very faint peat. Full bodied, nice carbonation, a little cloying by the end of the bottle, good beer.

Lovely aroma, malty and biscuity with a hint of miso. Cloudy amber appearance with a lot of suspended sediment. Well rounded taste, same qualities as the aroma. Very nice palate, slightly bubbly, quite smooth. Overall very drinkable!

355 ml bottle! Dark copper color, hazy, with a slight off-white head. Aromas of caramel and general maltiness. taste was even better, especially when the beer got warmer. Caramel, some chocolate, bready notes, some dark fruits. Sweet aftertaste, sticky and long. Mdium to full body with low carbonation.

Poured from bottle into pint glass

Appearance - a nice rusty red color which formed a foaming head which lingered ~ 1 min after pouring.

Smell - Not a very potent odor. Smells of alcohol a bit with a little bit of fruit possibly, but not very strong at all.

Taste - An upfront bitterness that seems to persist. while not heavily present at first, begin to get the alcohol taste a bit later.

Mouthfeel - A nice level of carbonation with an average body.

Overall - Not a bad beer, but not what it is lived up for or costs. Would not buy on any regularity and would choose other Founders beers over this.

Pours reddish-brown with a thin, filmy head. Toffee nose. Syrupy sweet taste with some booziness. Medium body. soft carbonation. Decent brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Corks of Cotham. Lovely mahogany colour with a decent, beige head and touch of carbonation. Big toastiness, liquorice, blood orange, a hint of chocolate and some hops in the finish. Very good.

Founders Dirty Bastard has a medium, cream-colored head, a mostly clear, bubbly, deep copper appearance, and a lacing sheen left behind on the glass. The aroma is of some oak, sweetness, toffee, alcohol, and dark bread crust. Taste is of those elements, with low bitterness (even with 50 IBU) and a hint of citrus, oddly. Mouthfeel is medium and slick, to an extent, and Founders Dirty Bastard finishes wet and rich. RJT

A strong one, to be sure! Pretty ruby haze color, taste is caramel, bananas, smoke and booze. Solid Scotch Ale, not for those who are afraid to taste booze in the "heavies." Overall, a solid offering in a style that I am learning to appreciate slowly but surely.
smells like a petshop. dark ruby coloured tastes a bit whiskeyish nothing special. shit name.

Bottle. Deep dark ruby red with a thin tan head. Nose is smokey, gnarly, alcohol whisky, banana and turps. Raisins and dark fruits in there too. Rich raisins-soaked-in-whisky flavour in the mouth, some toffee, some bready notes, banana, more whisky. Smokey, mysterious, tasty. Really malt-heavy making this sweet and complex without too much of a tongue-burning zing. Sipper for supper. Delicious warming ale!

Theres a lot going on in this one. Each sip is a little different, and the flavors change rather dramatically as it warms. Caramel, raisin, fig, in the beginning. There seems to be a nice hop presence as well. At various times, I picked up some citrus, dank, light pine and earthy spice. Some nice bready hints in there, too. My favorite aspect of this beer was a wonderful dark chocolate flavor in the finish, which completely pulled you away from the flavors that led you there. Super subtle booze and easy burn in the malty aftertaste.

The first scent that hits you is milk, followed by coffee, milo and alcohol. I fear someone may have disguised a kahlua and milk. The flavours are similar in the mouth, with the alcohol a little more prominent. Too milky for mine.

Bottle from Cotteridge wines. Dark ruby brown beer with small head and patchy lacing. Aroma of toffee, fruit loaf and treacle. Taste is sweet dark malts, toffee, dark fruits and some smokey treacle. Medium bodied with a little oil. I really liked this one.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Dark reddish amber, fine beige head. Smells of malts, caramel, burnt sugar, ripe fruits. Lots of malts and caramel taste, slightly smoked notes, light final hopping.

6-pack from the LCBO. Pours a dark brown copper with deep amber colour highlights. Big frothy yellow-beige cap with good retention and some creamy foam lace. Aromas of sweet malts (caramel, butterscotch) with heavy fruits (plums, dates) and some burnt sugars. Thankfully, the taste is not as sweet. Yes, the dark fruits are there, but milder with the malts, but some decent bitterness from the hops come in and adds some dryness to the finish. This makes this an interesting Scotch Ale, but not one I would seek again.
Pours dark brown, little head. Soft aroma, slightly sour first taste that evolves in to a gentle sweet aftertaste. An excellent beer.
A very delicious and enjoyable Scotch Ale. Full of flavor and depth. It has a very tasty blend of malts and hops.
Pours clear ruby red with a small tan head. Aroma is sweet grains, dark fruits and some earthiness. Taste follows nose.
Lovely representation of a scotch ale. Dark with hints of ruddy red. On tap at creo thick off white head. Malty and bready. Medium bodied and long through the taste.
UPDATED: OCT 10, 2014 Bottle. Very malty flavor, with a nice malty aroma. Nice Brown color, with a red hue. Full bodied.  Doesnt really taste as big of a beer as it is.  Good beer.
Nice dark ruby color with medium tan head. Medium body. Caramel and slightly hoppy. Creamy texture. Bitter finish.

Bottle at Piccadilly, Bodø. Pours a cloudy dark nut brown colour with a small, light beige head. Sweet aroma of caramel, chocolate, oak and brown sugar. The flavour is more malty with tones of alcohol, nuts, licorice and dry hops in the end. Has a silky and rich mouth feel, and a light to medium bitterness. A rich and sweet scotch ale, and probably nice with hearty dishes.
12oz Brownish Red pour, small head. Mild malty and lite fruit nose. Nice blend of smooth caramel roasted malts with some dark sugars. Nice body. Easy to drink. Alcohol well hidden. Very clean finish.
Great start- smooth palate- awesome finish. A great dinner ale-------- I would recommend to anyone

Appearance: pours with a medium to small beige head, the beer is a very dark clear ruby color, 

Aroma: malty, possibly some smoke, sweet, caramel, faint alcohol, some bread, some hops, not overly strong but complex

Taste: malt of course, bread, sweet, molasses, caramel, plum, alcohol

Palate: this stuff is thick in the mouth, high alcohol burn, slight bitter aftertaste, soft carbonation

Overall: not bad but not a beer Id really seek out, too much alcohol in the taste for me
Awesome scotch ale.....bought this one because of the name...it is fantastic....chocolate coffee and berries?....somehow there is 8.7% alcohol...but it is hidden very well.

Pours a rich dark red with a thin smooth beige head. Aroma of dark fruits. Body is refreshingly medium and very smooth in carbonation. Flavour is bitter and creamy malt. Finish is silky and bitter. Easy to drink.

From bottle. Pours a dark red with minimal tan head. Sweet nose with cherry and a hint of alcohol. Very clean for a Scotch ale with subtle hints of peat and smoke. Big finish with some hops coming through. Seem to get something new with each sip. Very good.

Cervesa amb molt bon color i aroma correcte, el gust és bastant acaramelat.
Cerveza con muy buen color y aroma correcto, el gusto es bastante acaramelado.

Dark murky amber brown. Minimal tan head. Bourbon, roasty, chocolate, coffee, resin, dough, leather, smoke, woody notes. medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Full body, thick feel, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish. WOW first experience with the good old Dirty Bastard. What a beer! Had a great time rating this one! Not my favorite of artwork, but very interesting.

Caramel, chocolate, toasty, roasty and coffee-ey all in one malt! fairly lively carbination, beautiful dark brown and cherry color. subtle hops and notes of dark cherry, coffee, and very dark chocolate most prevalent.

Clear red pour with a thin head. Lots of carbonation. Aroma is sweet, hints of roast & sugar. Medium mouth. Taste is sugary with some alcohol notes present. Grain and slightly smokey. Leaves a sweet aftertaste that hangs around for a while.

Bottle shared with S&G.
APPEARANCE: dark blond beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: sweet, caramel, some alcohol.
TASTE: sweet, alcohol, caramel.

From tap @ BBF 2014. Pours clear, intense, red-brown with a very tiny head. Moderate malty aroma, sweet, caramel. Flavor is light whiskey but without the alchool, caramel, moderate to heavy sweet,creamy, sticky, light alchool in the end.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2014 First ratingBottle at CBC, April 8 2014.Clear dark brown color, yellow head. Malty, sweet scent. Malty, apple, tart taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium high bitterness. Pith aftertaste.6/4/5/3/10=2.8RerateBottled at Rotary, Göteborg, on May 30, 2014.Clear copper color, tan head. Sweet malty scent. Malty taste. Smooth mouthfeel, low bitterness.Really liked it better than last time. Not very complex, but drinks very well.7/4/8/3/15=3.7
UPDATED: JAN 2, 2016 Couleur brun foncé. Pas de mousse. Nez alcool, quetsch macérée, pruneau. Palais caramel, alcool bien présent, malt, fruits noirs.

Bottiglia 355ml ordinata su birraland e bevuta a casa.
Grande corpo, malti in evidenza, finale alcolico ed amarognolo.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

Pours dark brown with a tan and creamy head. Aroma is heavy malts, some lightly toasted and alot of caramel. Licht vinous notes of dried fruit, raisins dates. Taste is rich, caramelized malts. Light toast and faint vinous notes Medium slick on the palate and softly carbonated.
UPDATED: APR 13, 2014 Holy caramel! Loads of malt, crystallized sugar and buttered biscuit. Light citrus bite at the end. Smooth creamy feel and pleasant sweet aftertaste.
Bitter.. Whiskey smell and taste that was profound.... Nice appearance.. Not much head.. Brought to top golf Dallas out of bottle.. Roasty, alcohol taste

Bottle. Pours clear amber with virtually no head. Aroma is quite malty, caramel, toffee, raisins, ripe fruit and subdued peat. Taste is moderate sweet, bitter and very light acidic. Body is light, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. Finishes is short but warming with smoke and mild metallic notes.

Ruby brown with lasting lacy foamy tan head; aroma is sweet fruit strawberry raspberry(?); Flava is rich and sweet of same fruit with malty backbone; feels thick and rich; finishes dryish and sticky some hops come through

Kind of middle of the road for me not to sure how to rate this style. Has a sweet malt taste almost cloying matched with glittering hops. To me its just okay not something I would drink on a regular basis but is drinkable.

苦味が少ない  
ホップが少な&
Aroma of sweet malts, taste is sweet, peat, almost saltwatery bitterness. Very pleasant and drinkable.

draft at Unos Oaks. Pours medium to dark ruby brown with some head that fades. nose is malty sweet smelling with some smoke and booze. first sip is complex mix of brown malt, peat, and and unmalted barley. finish is more dry than I anticipated.

29.03.2014. 0,355l bottle. At Stuelands Apothek, Haugesund. Dark brown colour with no head. Malty and strong. Aroma of dark malts. Strong with good body, alcohol and bitterness. Sweet with bitterness. Strong and wry good beer!!!!!!

- via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown pour, very little head. Sweet, malty, toffee aroma. Taste - slightly boozy, malty, cocoa, leather, nice peaty whiskey feel to it. warm, slightly boozy (but not too much) finish

Bottle into an ale glass. Pour is a dark brown amber. Aroma is complex with different malts and bitterness. Taste is warm and very deep and rich. Finish is warm with rich malt after taste. A great ale.
Excelleny beer. An excellent scotch ale. Very smooth taste and very drinkable. Excellent

Dark amber pour with a head that dissipates quickly. Sweet aroma - scotch malts and light caramel. Medium carbonation...flavours of sweet malt, caramel with a touch of smoke. I really like this scotch ale.
Dark amber, small offwhite head. Bready, malty aroma. Big mouthfeel, malt, chocolate and well balanced bitterness. Discrete, warming alcohol.
Theres a slight sweetness to this one. Very smooth. Slight hoppiness. Copperiness and spice that is very nice.

355 ml bottle in Margate, FL. Pours a dark copper with a large, foamy head. Aroma is a sweet rich malt with treacle and sultana characters along with soft bready notes. Not as overbearing as the flavors. Some of the malt remains in a supporting role but its overwhelmed by out-of-place spicy hops and a fair bit of booze. Not for my soft Bavarian Palate.
Bottle. Booze, raisins and slight choc aroma. Flavour is wood, leather, sweets nuts with a bitter finish. Rich barely carbonated body.

33 cl bottle. Red brown fluid with white head. Aroma is of fruits, dried fruits, a bit roasty, caramel, spices. Palate is medium with notes of red and dark fruits, dried fruits, caramel, roastiness, burnt malts, nice aftertaste with a spicy hint.
Very nice scotch ale!

Dark ruby color. Little to no head. Just a thin collar. 
Nose is soft peat and smoke, oak, raisin, dark cherry, and roasted malt. 
Taste makes up for the softness in the nose. Sharp hop bite with dark cherry, raisin, smoke, peat, and bread. Maybe a bit too much booze but workable. 
Full on feel. Medium bodied and light medium carbonation. Brilliant base beer for a Barrel.

Poured a deep amber. Lightly carbonated with practically no head. Fruity fragrance, with a hint of alcohol in the flavour. Fairly bitter finish. The high alcohol content somewhat over powers the flavour. Not a favorite.

Poured from a bottle into a Founders pint glass a deep reddish brown with a thick tan head.
Aroma is straight up malty sweetness some slight hops & booze even slighter peat/smoke.
Flavor is sweet caramel malty with a slight hop finish. The breadiness isnt overwhelming balanced beautifully with dark fruit. Not a huge scotch ale fan but this brew works everytime--solid in every way.

Clear, medium copper color, quick rising red head, spotty remains on glass. 
Rich, medium full body, non agressive mouthfeel, with low alcohol heat or acidity, short, weak finish. 
Moderate bitterness, malty but not sweet. 
Predominantly malty, left me missing the aromatics of American hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
amber, clear, frothy, tan foam, lightly bitter, umami, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter,

Bottle. Nutty brown sugar aroma with some cereal grain. Almost clear chestnut-red under a wispy off-white cover. Cereal grain and rye bitterness with nice nutty accents and a subtle fruitiness. Medium light body, medium carbonation, lingering bitter finish.

Ruby mahogany with a thin beige head. Full body with medium carbonation and a bit of astringency.

Aroma: rich bready caramel malt, cherries and dried fruits, silage, alcohol notes, and faint hops and roasted grains.

Taste: sweet wort with lots of pale ale type base malt, caramel malt, leafy hop bitterness, alcohol warmth, and a touch of acrid/astringent character common from brown malt.

I don't know if I got a bad bottle or what but mine poured with no head, no lacing. Dark Carmel color that was almost red. For 8.5%ABV it was really smooth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark amber with a medium head and great lacing. I feel a little spoiled having had the Backwoods Bastard before the Dirty Bastard. This ale has great amber malt flavor and a smooth finish. A great scotch ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ Tröls. I always love a scotch ale, especially a micro-brewed one. This is an average addition to the style, you wont be disappointed but you wont be blown away either.

Bottle in the Hemelvaart Bier Café, Bedale. Pours ruby with a fading tan head. Quite sweet with caramel notes before a very fruity bitter finish with pineapple. Alcohol is warming and pleasant. Theres some treacle and pear drop in there too. Nice.

33cl butelka.

OCZY : Piwo jest ciemne z odcieniami czerwieni i ciepłego brązu. Ma średniej wielkości piane o beżowym kolorze.

NOS : mocne aromaty słodu o lekko podpalanych i dymionych odcieniach. Karmel, toffi i pralinka. Alkohol, wiśnie, suszone śliwki, nugat i pomarańcz. 

USTA : delikatnie gazowane i oleiste. Podobna konsystencja do mleka. 
Piwo jest słodkie o barwach czekolady i suszonych owoców. Te ostatnie nadaje delikatną kwaśność. Ale nie jest cierpka. Piwo ma głęboki i bardzo złożony smak. Pod koniec, wraz z gorzkością, wyłania się delikatny posmak cytrusowego orzeźwienia. Ale i tak gorzkością dominują barwy podpalane, podobne do pestki jabłka i alkoholu. Posmak podobny do suszonych i wędzonych owoców i piernika. 

ODCZUCIA : wreszcie udało mi się dorwać te bardzo znane piwo w świecie craftu amerykańskiego. Jest smaczne i świetnie skomponowane. Przyznam się, ze oczekiwałem czegoś w stylu Arogant Bastard z Stone, który jest również mocno chmielony. Ale i tak jest spoko. 

OCENA :
smak : 8/10
pijalność : 5/10

How: Bottle.
Where: NK Bar, Stockholm.
Appearance: Brown colour with a small beige head.
Aroma: Caramel, malt, alcohol, plum.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Caramel, malt, plum, alcohol, dried fruit.
Aroma is very subtle, malty some alcohol. Redbrown color with no head. Malty sweet taste with some hoppy bitterness.

Pours a beautiful translucent red ruby-brown. Smell is faint, sweet candy sugar and a bit of raisin. Taste is hoppy and maple syrup sweet with an almost medicinal rye flavour. Ends on a sharp acidic note.
Cerveja escura, cor rubi, com boa formação de espuma. Aromas doce. Sabor de caramelo, com amargor no retrogosto.

Bottle.
Pours a deep bronze body, little clarity, small beige head persists.
Rich complex nose; moist-cakey malts, burnt caramel, dried fruits, Scotch whiskey undertones & complexities.
Very full thick, creamy on the palate, chewy. Low carbonation & boozy warmth.
Lots of burnt caramel & roasted nutty malt upfront, notes of plum, raisin, earthy spice, with Whiskey barrel notes & boozy twang.
A serious sipper. Carries more weight than expected for abv. Damn tasty!

Bottle - pours dark brownish red with an average head. Has a malty aroma and taste of smoked wood and cherries. Very rich and smooth on the palate. This is one excellent beer! Is there anything Founders cant do with beer?

A beautiful Scotch ale. Pours a dark brownish red, somewhat purplish and semi-opaque. Aromas are cherries, vanilla, and oak. Medium bodied with hints of smoke and alcohol, raisins, cherries, and malt. Nicely done. Will buy over and over again.

Pours mahogny with no head
Aromas butterscotch, caramel, resin, fudge, cherries
Taste has burned brown sugar, wood, tropical fruits
Instense bitterness with loads of burned sugar

Pours mahogany with minimal tan head. Aroma of toffee, butterscotch, nuts, light citrus. Taste is big, deep bitter with sweetish backbone. Body is creamy and full with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
pours a murky reddish brown with a medium frothy tan head. Aroma is complex. malt, bread, cocoa. Thick mouth feel with a nice sweet toasty taste. nice warming finish. Great beer!
12oz bottle: Appearance is a dark amber brown with slow fading off white head. Aroma is faint, but of oak and caramel malts. Taste has an almost whisky like burn, rich in malt and hints of chocolate.

Bouteille 330ml. Couleur acajou foncée avec des reflets rouge, mousse beige foncée laissant un anneau. Arôme de malt grillé, caramel, un peu de noisette, tire dérable. Goût de malt grillé, caramel, sucré, lalcool est bien camouflé, légère amertume, épices léger en fin de bouche. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen-dense.

Bottle. Brown Body with tan head. Aroma is some caerramel with malts. Taste was slightly roasted malts with hints of dried fruits. Aftertaste is medium bitter with some sweetnes and hints of smoke. Nice one.

Caramel reddish brown in color... Aroma of caramel, hint of scotch malts... Flavor is peated malts, caramel, light bodied, hint of smoke on finish... Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: caramel malts, hints of iron, light alcohol. Appearance: dark brown, small head. Taste: light sweet and bitter. Palate: medium carbonation, some smoked and toasted flavours, turns more bitter, medium-long dry finish. Overall: very nice Scotch Ale - great palate. Bottle at The Lazy Fox, Fulham.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours nicely clear dark brown with and almost orange head. Nose is sweet and toffeelike with a bit of dark fruit. Taste is similar with molasses/burnt caramel and maybe raisins. There is a nice strength to the alcohol. A really nice scotch ale but maybe just a little bitsingle dimensional. Body is medium with a nice carbonation. A nice sweet long finish.
Bottle brought home from lake. Pours rich brown with medium head. Rich caramel taste...sweet and tasty

355ml bottle 
8.5% ABV 
King/Spadina LCBO Outlet (Toronto, Ontario, Canada) 
January 16, 2014
Part of the Founders feature at the LCBO (Backwoods Bastard, Breakfast Stout, Dirty Bastard, Pale Ale, Porter). The beer pours a dark copper colour with a thin ring for a head. The aroma is dark fruits and caramel. The mouthfeel is medium bodied with above average carbonation. The flavour is sweet malt, molasses, some smokiness, and fruit. Not the best Scotch Ale in my opinion, but one of the better ones Ive tried.

Bottle brought from the States.
Pours hows I expected - deep amber, with a cream tan head. Aroma is sweet toffee. Says 50 IBUs on the bottle, but Im not getting much hop bitterness, only caramel malts with some burnt candy sugar. Nice hit of alcohol, and strong and malty as it should be. I
If I think of a Scotch Ale - then this pretty much ticks all my boxes.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2015 Had a taste at Bohemian Bull.  Scotch ale not really my thing, but it is Founders so should balance out. Pours a bit darker than a quality pale with a reddish hue. Nose is malty, bready and some earth. Taste is really well balanced- IBUs at a nice 50. More hops/bitterness than I would expect, but nice malty, caramel/toffee sweetness upfront .  Good scotch, but not my favorite from these guys.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2014 Hazy reddish brown with small head. Full body, soft carbonation. Rich and complex. Creamy texture, very smooth. Strong caramel aroma, raisins, dried fruits. Alcohol is very well hidden. Medium sweet with medium bitterness. Long bitter finish. Very well balanced. Great beer.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2015 Dark brown color, big tan/light brown head. Medium to full body, creamy and thick texture, average to soft carbonation, sweet finish. Aroma is caramel, alcohol, brown sugar, roasted malt, oak. Taste is wonderful, chocolate, caramel, oak, brown sugar. Love this one. 
(Svijet piva 0,355l bottle)
Malty. Scotchy. Sweet. Like a piece of scotch flavored hard candy.scotchy scotch scotch .

Bottle - Bought Aug 2013; BBE undated; Drank Oct 2013 - Deep Amber in colour; Ruby Red against light. Very Malty; toffee, caramel, toasty malts, dark candy sugar. Fruity; dark fruits, raisins. Hoppy; some grassy hops. Syrupy sweet. Very sweet malty fruity throughout, with increasing hop bitterness in the finish. Decent beer; but too sweet for me.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2014 Tap: Deep ruby red color with mild clarity, letting a decent amount of light shine right through. A cream, light-tan layer of foam rests on top & fades to a collar rather quickly. Aroma is mostly sweet & malty, boozy & dark fruity. Tinted caramel, toffee, faint smoke, apple skins, grapes... Taste is similar with a good alcoholic warmth up front & a handful of fruit filled ester-y notes. Boozy raisins, caramel sweetness, & a hint of apple skin & red grapes that tows the line between sweet & lightly tart. Some yeast in the finish, aftertaste of booze-soaked baked bread. Pretty nice Scotch ale, although admittedly Im not the biggest fan of the style. That said, this beer was destined for barrel treatment (Backwoods!).

Bottle. Pours a very dark Ruby colour.

Aroma. Smells a bit like espresso.

Nice Scotch Flavour, very complex flavours, not my kind of beer, but still alright.
Dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig süß, harzig, fruchtig. Geschmack sehr malzig fruchtig, würzig, harzig.

Can pour. Nice dark brown. Smooth malts on the nose. Good scotch flavor, strong but smooth.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

35cl bottle at Amundsen. Very dark amber ruby colour with a minimal head. Aroma is moderately sweet. Notes of port, oak, dried red fruit, malts and honey. Faint hints of alcohol. Flavour is round yet a little bitter. Malts, red fruits, oak, caramel. Alcohol is noticeable but not dominating. Medium long aftertaste.

Sort of complex woody medium dark beer. I'm more of an IpA fan but this was an interesting beer id order again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
caramel, herbs, leather, licorice, soy sauce, brown, black, minimal head, tan foam, brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, creamy, average carbonation, soft carbonation, alcohol
Sample at a tasting. Dark brown body with a medium head. Caramel, butterscotch, nuts, alcohol. Nice malt body.
January12, 2014. 355mL bottle from LCBO at Queens Quay and Yonge. Caramel and toffee flavour, with a toffee aroma. Mild hops, very balanced and smooth. Very nice.

Bottle pours a dark almost mocha brown with a quickly retreating head. Vaguely bourbon like nose with caramel and hop notes.
Tastes of brown bread and faint floral hops. Good Scotch Ale

Poured an average creamy off-white head that diminished rather quickly.This had a rather heavy burnt caramel nose.Medium body with a thin alcohol on the back end of the mouth. It did have a lasting moderately sweet flavor. A good example of a Scotch Ale.

Bottle from Ninas Mini Market. Hazy mahogany body with a large beige head. Excellent lacing. Aroma of toffee, nuts and leafy greens. Flavour of brown sugar, leather, gingerbread, a hint of marzipan and bitter earth on the finish. Tastes like a Belgian beer, and a good one at that. After reading other reviews, I expecting more of an alcohol burn, but I found this to be very moreish. Medium body with an almost chewable mouthfeel. Very faint carbonation prickle. A delicious, complex beer.

Im afraid I dont get this one. Shes a strong one but tastes even stronger. Very harsh alcohol covering up hints of smokey toffee and a sticky, woody taste. The beer feels very sticky in the mouth which really wasnt for me but theres a lot going on and I commend it for that.
Pours Amber to light brown in color with an off-white to light beige head. Malt aroma with a caramel/malt flavor with a hoppy finish.

Pours with a small head that disappears quickly, but has nice lacing. Smells of bourbon scotch, caramel, malty, and syrupy. Color is a dark red/light brown and a tiny bit hazy. Amazing flavor with hints of scotch, caramel, slightly woody and a little sweet. A nice heavy beer that has a near perfect finish with a hint of smooth alcohol. A beer that complements itself. This is a beer that will be on my list of regulars along side beers like DFH 90 minute IPA and Leinenkugels Big Eddy Russian Imperial Stout. A must try beer for all beer lovers.
Pours an amber, cloudy color. Aroma of oak, slightly sweet vanilla and bourbon. Taste is sweet bourbon and spice. Slightly woody. Thin and lightly carbonated. Pretty tasty.

Bottled 355ml. -from Svijet Piva Zagreb. Reddish/brown coloured, small to medium sized beige head, caramel and dried fruits in the nose. Sweet malty, caramel, dried fruits and hops with discreet touch of alcohol in the finish. interesting and not bad at all.

0,355l bottle. Brown color with beige head and nice lacing. Aroma is malt, caramel, candy sugar and peat. Taste is medium bitter with sweet caramel notes, some dark fruits and toasted malt. Full body with soft carbonation. Nice and complex beer.
Dark ruby in color with beige head. Hints of smoke, aroma notes of peat ad smoked malts, some dark fruits. Taste dark chocolate, brown sugar, coffee. Medium carbonation. Very good beer.
Not as bitter or flavorful as I would expect but still strong. Tasty none the less for sure

@ Party Source / Bellvue KY Aroma of rich malt and hops. Nearly clear brown with a thin head cover, thin stripes of lace. Taste is semi-sweet malt that adds a bit of dark fruit and biscuit in the palate before letting go for an infusion of hops in the finish. This is a well-conceived and well-balanced scotch ale. No wonder Founders treats it as the flagship brew. Excellent in any setting or weather.

Pours teak with a spider web thin cap. Aroma punches out of the glass & foreshadows whats to come: rich malt, candy apple, deep caramel notes & almost a vague suggestion of whiskey. Finishes has a long sustain. Fantastic brew. If I were a craft brewer in toronto - home of me & my crack smoking mayor - Id make a study of this brew to learn about its balance & depth.

If this was brewed in Ontario, theyd spit it into a 750 ml bottle & charge the same for what this 6 pack sells for.

Easy on the palate for a strong ale. Doesn't come across as heavy at all. The alcohol-booze flavor lasts through the whole experience. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ive had this beer before so I wont be surprised this time when it lives up to its name in the morning. I believe the gentlemen who brewed this sampled it heavily the night before they gave it a name. After the palate adjusts it tastes sweet and goes down smooth, a nice brown color with an almost red foam forms in the glass (probably a sign of the devil). Everything about this beer says "drink me Im good, have more" but then later when staring the cook county bull pen square in the face you realize youve been tricked by a "Dirty Bastard!". A word of advise, dont drink the 6th bottle, leave it on the sink for the next morning and maybe, just maybe youll be in your house to enjoy it, if you are lucky!

Bottled Swirl on the snifter no 1) Boozed covered caramel .. swirl no 2) boozed covered raisin and cherry. earth .molasses ... A damn aroma I luv . good looking beige head above burnt gravy colour . Drinking this youre met with finesse , just like their great Porter , Founders , on my limited sampling are slick . A nice rich caramel palate is just on the right side of not being too sickly sweet for my taste. Complexity between differing dark fruits and syrupy cakey malt depth . Boozy , rich , complex . gets the fucken job done like a legit winter warmer  should

Slightly hazy reddish brown pour with just a little bit of white head and lacing. Malty nose. Nice malty nose. Just a little sweet in the taste, quickly fading to hops and hop bitterness in the finish. A bit of booze in the finish too.

Bouteille. 8.5% Merci Charles. Couleur brune foncé, reflets rougeâtre. Mousse beige mince. Arôme de toffee, caramel, alcool. En couche, sucre brun, toffee, malt. Légères notes de tourbe, peu damertume. Excellente Scoth Ale.

Sweet but balanced. Marmite toffee and leathery nose. The flavour is a collaboration of dark fruits, toffee, brewing coffee, brown sugar and caramel. The body is spot on. I'd drink it again. One of the better scotch ales I've had overall.

Bottle thanks to quicklearner, thanks! Pours a nice mahogany with a medium offwhite head that settles into a small rim that leaves good lacing. Nose is made of caramel and light smoke, not too intense. Taste is not quite sweet, malty but with a nice bitterness. Flavors of caramel and slight roasted malt. Alcohol show up a little in the taste but it is not really warming. Body is medium, mouthfeel creamy. Carbonation is moderate. This is good beer but nothing to write home about.

12oz bottle served in a snifter

A - Pours a cloudy mahogany with a thin tan cap. The head is thin and forms a tight collared ring around the glass.

S - Chocolate covered caramel, dense toffee, coffee, maple, roasted barley, brown sugar, canned cherries, salty, leather, spice.

T - Candied plumbs, brown sugar, chocolate, prunes, spicy but chalky bitterness, charred caramel, sugary cherries, hazelnut, amaretto, earthy peat moss, finishes sweet but a citrus bitterness creeps up on the edges creating a dryness. Orange tea tannins are left on the palate.

M - Medium to full body, rich with low carbonation,

Wow! This is one, if not the best American Wee Heavys Ive had to date. Probably the most bitter Scotch ale, but it works. Excellent layering of toffee/caramel with a touch of chocolate and coffee. Fruity and bready with a stellar rounded out bitter finish. What more could you want in a Scotch Ale?

Serving type: bottle

11-03-2013

Bottle from Mane Liquor Hat and Trouser Retail Superstore. Pours a delightful dark brown with a creamy dark khaki head. Upfront aroma of dark and toasty caramel malts, partially scorched walnut and a freshly turned brazil nut after a few hours on a 37.5 degree day. Flavours a rich, dark malts and a barleywine style sweetness. Lots of toasty/burnt nuts and caramel. Slight bitterness. Would go down a treat with a cigar.
Excellent beer, strong malt flavors, especially of caramel. Light sweetness that finishes bitter.

Not my favorite style to be sure, but when a beer is well made it shouldnt really matter, and this is a perfect example of that. SWEET bready malts without any real note of hops except a slight spiciness in the finish. Not a beer that makes you want to have another one, one is enough. Tried to find the peat flavors, as I love peaty scotch, but didnt really happen for me.

355 mL bottle. Pours dark mahogany with little to no head. Deep malt notes of amber caramel, raisin and dark honey. Smoky phenolics and heather herb like hop notes. Moderate sweetness offset by a bitter hop bite with a touch of roast. Full bodied with below average carbonation. Very much a love it or leave it style of beer for me.
Very nice beer. Strong, but balanced. No taste shows itself too much. Nice bitter end.

Smells average nothin special, looks great nice dark with brown hint, alot smoother than expected with great flavor, overall decent beer I would buy again and I am proud of this local brewery will go for a tour in the summer

Dark red pour with a nice white head that fades to thin lace. Aroma is malty and sweet with a hint of peat and caramel. Taste is complex, nice mix of sweet malts, smoky scotch undertones, with a nice dry bitter hop finish. Really good beer, hides the abv exceptionally well.
Red with nice yellow head. Raisins, malt in the aroma. Dry, sweet malt raisins mild hoppy aftertaste.
Pours dark red with a slight off-white head. Aroma is strong and hoppy. Taste is very bitter on the back end with a strong finish. I love the Founders Porter, but this one doesnt do it for me.
Aroma is hoppy bitterness. Rich sweetness followed by bitter carbonation and dry hoppy taste. Dried fruit, but not overpoweringly so. Almost creamy texture, nice.
Great beer. Tons of complex and layered flavors going on here. The higher than normal ibu's marry with the malt nicely.

Poured from a refrigerated bottle into a pint glass. Dark Reddish brown with a  slight tan head. Aroma of toasted breads, malts, and sweet maple syrup. Taste up front was sweet and delightful with some scotch coming through. Hints of vanilla and maple syrup or molasses and a smoky malt complexity. Thick to drink but very good and very creamy.
Pours a dark copper with a smallish head. Dried fruit and burnt caramel aromas. Not my favorite style as they can be cloying, but this is delicious. Well made brew.

This dark ale, with an average head, has a terrific taste. The malt is deep and complex and so very good. The hops are strong but they dont overpower the wonderful malt taste. Medium to full body, this is a wonderful brew.

Bottle to glass. Pours a light brown reddish mahogany for with a good off-white head. Aroma is malty, light scotch character. Characteristic scotch notes more present in flavor, lingering well into the finish. Excellent and very drinkable beer, but definitely prefer its barrel aged big brother.

Bottle. Clear brownish red color with a foamy tan head that lasts on the sides. Aromas of caramel, brown sugar, some earthy malt and light fruit. Flavor is the same with some spice and a warm finish. Medium bodied.
Awesome beer! Have had both bottled and on tap. DB is always a good choice.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

On tap at Founders. The pour is a nice ruby color with an off white head that fades down to a film, leaving sporadic lace. The aroma is heavy on molasses and dark fruits with a lovely maltiness enshrined throughout. The flavors are much of the same. There is a light sweetness that comes through, and is greatly appreciated. The mouth feel is a little thin, but the flavors are big and last a decent amount past the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from the LCBO. Deep hazy reddish brown with a two finger tan head that leaves some lace. Smells of roasted malts with caramel and vanilla as well as some dark fruits. Mostly sweet but with an additional unexpected hop bitteness in the finish. Some wood and smokiness is more evident than the initial nose. Full sticky mouth and a long finish make this really enjoyable.

12 oz bottle into tulip. Minneapolis..

Appearance: dark brown, small tan head with decent retention. 

Aroma: roasted malt. Toffee. Chocolate. Almost a little oaky. 

Taste: Slightly sweet upfront. A little bitterness towards the end. 

Palate: Rich and medium/full body. Silky smooth texture. 

Overall: A really well made beer. Very balanced and flavorful. Great texture.
From a tap at Yard House. Great dark brown color, small head, nice lacing. Butterscotch and vanilla, well-balanced alcohol content.
UPDATED: JAN 2, 2014 Bottle. Dark reddish brown with short lasting foamy head. Rich molasses and alcohol aroma. Dark fruit, licorice, raisins. Flavors are clean and distinctive.

large frothy offwhite head. good lacing. fully diminishing. translucent thick reddish-brown body. aroma: moderate malty, milk chocolate, raisin, alcohol, chestnut, coke. if: moderate sweet. ff: light sweet moderate bitter long duration. palate: medium body, oily texture, medium carbonation, metallic moderate alcoholic finish. Delicioso dulçor maltado, achocolatado, amadeirado e alcoolico. Forte Aquecimento alcoólico lembrando whisky. Amargor lupulado balanceia um pouco o dulçor. Mais complexa do estilo que já degustei  até agora havia achado todas elas sem graça. No último terço da cerveja, aparecem frutas secas, como uva-passa e banana-passa. 260 s

355 ml bottle bought at Craftissmo in Tsim Sha Tsui East.
Clear, deep burgundy colour with traces of yeast particles; Half finger head and beige foam which fades in 30 seconds; Pretty good sticky lacing and zero carbonation; Very fragrant aroma of brown sugar, dark fruits and hard liquor as soon as it was popped and can be smelt a feet away, with caramel, toffee, malt, light alcohol and light straw; Pleasant medium sweet taste of malt, with strong caramel, toffee, light butter scotch, dark fruits, molasses, light smoke, light alcohol, liquorices, lime and grass; Mid to full body, slick and oily palate; Mouth feel is quite rich with intense flavours, all in a thin but oily body. Brown sugars sweetness is surprisingly lower than the aroma suggests and not cloying at all, a good match with the strong, melting caramel and toffee. Nice! Smoke is light, booze is warm and slightly expressive and never scream out. I like it! Hoppiness is fresh straw nose, good liquorice and grassy taste. Bitterness is low but well balanced with sweetness for a nice bitter sweet finish; Quite dry after taste, bitter sweet and slightly boozy to mouth.

Comments: This is a well-made Scotch Ale, with strong and wholesome aroma, just right sweetness and maltyness, and some good light peat smokiness and hoppiness to round up a pretty nice experience. Only its somewhat watery body holds me back. Otherwise, this is a just right brew in all aspects. A really enjoyable winter warmer!

Very nice aroma on this one, chocolate malt, scotch, light malty sweetness. Hint of alcohol. Slightly subdued but very nice. Dark hazy brown with quickly fading head. Delicious tasting. Upfront some smoke, caramel notes, dark fruit, syrupy sweetness with a sweet and smoky finish. Not super complex but very well crafted. Medium bodied (although slightly syrupy) and average carbonation. A great Scotch Ale.

Pours a dark brown, with a frothy head. Aroma notes include peat, smoked malts, raisin, plums, and other dark fruits. Upon tasting, I can really taste the smoked peat, scotch, and a fiery peat bitterness, the palate is rounded out with some chewy malts. Definitely a nice scotch beer!!

Hazy, dark brown/ruby beer with a beige head. Little lacing on the glass. 
Nose: Caramel, raisin, dark syrup, brown sugar, whiskey and roasted malt. 
Taste: Dark chocolate, brown sugar, coffee, dark bread and caramel. 
Full body and medium carbonation - Great, tasty beer!

355ml from the LCBO. Pours a shaded ruby/brown with a khaki, one finger head that thins to a thick film but leaves great lacing. Aroma has big notes of sweet caramel, raisins, and other dark fruits. Taste is malt forward but not unbalanced. A touch of sweet and caramel to start with hints of smoke, spice, and roastyness on the finish. Medium-full body with a medium carbonation. A touch syrupy in the mouth with just the right amount of carbonation to make it drinkable. Very little alcohol taste. Overall this is a big malty beer. A bit sweet but balanced really well. A big flavour to be enjoyed slowly by a fire. Certainly worth a try for everyone. Would probably buy again when Im in the mood.
Ruby red color. Very well balanced, finishes with a bit of smoky caramel. Perfect beer for a rainy day.

(Bottle) Hazy dark brown with ruby hint and negligible head. Subtle pleasant sweet aroma. Medium body with full bright carbonation. Rich complex taste. Caramel, dark toffee with creamy hints; develops black coffee / burnt / peat bitterness in the finish. Little hint of the high alcohol. Impressive, but not as impressive as I had been led to expect.
Cannot compare to Old Chub. Very boozy with a kind of prevailing pungent sour taste which I?ve seen described as "creamy", but I beg to differ.

355ml pour into a De Struise tulip. Deep brown with ruby highlights, very small head that disappears almost as quickly as it was created. Aroma is whiskey straight up, with some peat, smoke & sweet roasted malts. Taste is dark chocolate, whiskey, coffee, brown sugar, sea salt, smoke. Quite sweet with a dry-ish finish. Mouthfeel is medium body & just right for me for the style. This beer really works for me as both a beer & scotch whiskey lover.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Drank this bottle at 1908 Draught House. Smooth and coffee flavored. Great smell. I like!
bottle 355ml from AbM @ home. Pours slightly hazy dark brownk with a beige head.Aroma of spices, raisins, dark malts. Sweet malty, raisins, dark malts, spices in the aroma.
Light nose but great look. Smooth light body compared to what you might expect, very balanced. Mellow scotch/molasses flavor. Very good!

From notes at bier baron in dc. 

A: ruby red with brilliant clarity. Rim of creamy foam borders and climbs the rim. Spotty lacing. 

S: dark malts, sweet caramel, a hint of tea. 

T: not as sweet as would expect for the style. Toasty and dry. See nose for flavors.

M: medium to Heavy with medium carb. A hint dry on the finish. 

O: not a bad beer. Wish it was a little sweeter for the style. I can see why so many love this beer. Just not my cup.

Serving type: on-tap

06-23-2011
Pours a hazy brownish-amber. Has a sweet malt, coffee, chocolate, and some prune. Has a sweet malt and prune taste with some yeast and coffee. Aftertaste is similar to a stout.
Nice appearance. Smells great. Great flavor, scotch alcohol finish but goes down smooth
On tap at founders, this my go to scotch ale, toffee and roasted malts... great stuff!!
Boozy, malty, rainsiny aroma. Brown with a flat head. Medium carbonation. Long creamy finish. Cream is the keyword here, incredibly creamy. Fantastic palate for 8% beer. Good stuff

355 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a murky mahogany colour with thin beige cap. Aroma is rich and malty with brown sugar, toffee and dark fruits. Flavour has lots of sweetness but not cloyingly so, with brown sugar, toffee, prune, raisin and cherry. Lightly carbonated. Slick mouthfeel. Nice.

355 ml bottle from LCBO, served cool in a tulip glass. 
App.: Deep, clear ruby-mahogany with a nice orange-tan head.
 
Aroma: Very rich and sweet, tons of brown sugar, dark dried fruits, a little molasses, toffee and treacle, so malty, some cola-like herbal or warm spice notes, a little booze, inky and sticky and rich.
 
Palate: Medium+ body, moderate carbonation, a little prickly.
 
Flav.: A little less sweet and sticky than the nose, more dark, burnt sugar notes, black strap molasses, less fruity, still some treacle, some booze (nice on a winters day), maybe some pine/resin from hops?; not quite dry with pretty good bitterness and a long, thick, somewhat boozy and very deep/dark finish.

Very nice. Glad to see this in the LICK-BO.

On tap at Tavern 131 in Milford, MI. Dark color throughout, with light head. Strong taste, could be off-putting on first taste. But drink it a little more and you really enjoy the subtle flavors, including the comfortable aftertaste. Very drinkable -- high ABV but doesnt overpower you. One of the best Ive had.
Nice! Pours an amber brown with tan head. Aroma is cherries, nuts, caramel, cola, and toast. Taste is medium to high sweetness with light grassy hops. good stuff.
Bottle - very dark brown with beige head. Aroma of sweet malts, dark fruit, prunes. Similar in the taste, rich, fruity and well balanced. Full bodied, moderate carbonation. Very nice.

Great color and nose. Classic Scotch Ale taste with a little bit of chocolate in the finish. 

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10
As scotch ales go, this one should be considered a standard against which other Scotches should be judged. An orange color with a head that starts strong even if it finishes weak (try a straight
355ml bottle. Pours dark orange brown with a small head. Aroma is rich toffee, orange and molasses. Taste has orange caramel to start. Malty molasses on the finish.
VERY malt dark bronze orange. Pretty typical scotch ale nose. Taste is where things get exciting. Malt sweetness, oak and caramelized malts. Really solid and tastes bigger than 8%

This is all right, but the hops used are just a bit too bitter for my liking.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Caoba oscuro con reflejos rojos, espuma beige claro. Aromas de regaliz, caramelo. En boca es suave y dulce con toques de azúcar moreno, caramelo, y ligero anís. Muy rica.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Buddy got me a 6 pk for xmas..much better than previous version..had to have been a stale batch..burgundy color with nice sweet aroma..fruity,caramel..smooth dry taste..with some sweet/sour notes..would definitely drink again..just gotta make sure I check bottling date.
Smokey and sweet and strong and malty with a long and reasonably hoppy finish. Completely brilliant ipa variant.

Subtly cereal, sweet caramel malty aroma, perfectly balanced. Beautiful rich dark red colour. Surprisingly subtle flavour at first leading into a creeping cereal taste accentuated by the caramelisation.

Delicious beer. Huge malts, very sweet, and even some bittering hops in the back. Almost reminds me of an American Barleywine, with its sweet viscosity. Pouts a dark mahoney amber, leaving a nice dark red lacing; with a forward, almost creamy head. Superb stuff.
Delicious!!! A great flavour. Very chocolatey taste. I will be getting this again!!!!
Super smooth, a little smokey, Scotch flavours and some awesomeness. This stuff is great, go and buy it now, lots of it.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a medium, well retained, light beige head, with some lacing, over a slightly hazy, reddish brown (SRM 18) body......nose is light dried fruits, including, plum, cherry, fig, light brown sugar, hints of cereal.....taste is slight sweetness to start, leading to dried fruits, with plum, fig, cherry, then a dry, mildly bitter finish......mouth feel medium, sticky, carbonation low with light acid finish. This falls well within the style. The fruit dominated malt characteristics are very typical. The mild bitter finish is a bit higher than in many, but otherwise it is a quite good "Wee Heavy". BJCP 8/3/15/5/7

3/8/2013. From bottle. Copper color with a tan head. Malty aromas with spice, caramel and light fruit. Bitter hoppy flavors with fruit and spices. I didnt pick up any smoke, but still a very good beer.

This stuff was fantastic. Hazy copper colored beer with an off-white head. Aromas of toffee and sweet caramel. Tastes of caramel, toffee, and lots of butterscotch. Sweet caramel malts mix with earthy/woody flavors quite nicely. Some hints of smoke too. Sweet toffee/butterscotch finish. Really smooth, yet a bit heavy. Delicious brew. I need some more.
Bottle to pint, pours a dark brownish amber, murky. Malty caramel aroma. Taste is caramel, toffee, dark fruit, light bitter hops in the finish.

12 oz. bottle, sent from Daniel719 (thanks a lot, man), pours a dark mahogany with a finger-width of tan head. Nose brings out caramel malts, whiskey, a touch of peat and booze. Flavour is similar, bringing lush, soft caramel malt notes, dark dried fruits, some light whiskey, and a touch of booze. There is even a decent hop component to this. Extremely smooth and rich in the mouth, with a very pleasing warming effect. Very well-constructed scotch ale - one of my favourites of the style.
Bottle 33cl. Dark amber, hazy with a orange head. Malt and dark fruit aroma. Medium sweet taste with a dark fruit end.
Dark brown pour with a beige lid, moderate lacing. Malty caramel, liquorice, chocolate, slight nut and spice. Good carbonation and full bodied. DB is another great drop from a great Brewery.

bottle. Poured opaque mahogany with a thin creamy beige head. Woody alcohol aroma. Full body, a touch oily with a warming alcohol finish. Roasted malt flavours of dark fruit , brown sugar and pepper. A sweet and spicy beer, a nice sipper.

Pint glass. Nice deep amber brown with a one finger white head. Lacing is nice. Strong aroma of malts, caramel, scotch and wood. The taste has the scotch booziness, wooden barrels, significant malts, peat and vanilla. Full body, slight oily. Butter finish with a scotch aftertaste. I really enjoyed this one.
Ale @Hourglasson tap-tan-dk brown. A-sweet med malt-peat/toffee/licorice. T-sweet med malt-peat/toffee/licorice, 2nd earthy hops.

Ruby brown with minimal head. Sweet sticky caramel notes followed with moderate hopping. Very smooth texture. Not much of a bite to it but pleasant.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at home from alesela dark garnet red with dark beige lacing. Rich sweet malt, Turkish delight, sticky caramel. Sweet, astringent notes, full bodied, low carbonation. Not for me

Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma is chocolate, alcohol, liquorice and a lot of caramel. Taste is moderate sweet and lots of chocolate again. Full bodied with average carbonation. Great.

FROM NOTES: August 8, 12
Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a tulip. 

A: Strong and sweet malts and a strong alcohol note with some dark fruit aroma and some dry bread type notes as well. 
A: Pours a nice copper color with a khaki head with hints of red. Head dissipates quickly, but leaves a nice lacing.
T: Nice blend of malt, dark fruits, and slight alcohol. Even has a hint of hops in the finish. 
M: Medium body. Good carbonation. 
O: A fantastic example of a wee heavy, and its incredibly drinkable, making it a sniper...

Pours dark brown into a thistle glass. Beautiful tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma of sweet malt with some yeast. Complex mouth feel of malt and a nice amount of hop bitterness for balance. Noticeable alcohol feel towards the end. Long lingering finish.

Good beer. Poured from the bottle into a snifter. Pours a dark ruby color. Smell of scotch. The taste is more of the same. Its like CCB big sound on steroids. I like it more.-- via beerbasher/winphone
Brown murky pour, aroma is sweet rich malt, taste is nicely balanced with bitter sweet finish, very nice scotch

11/5/13 bottle given to me by Dan. Pours a dark reddish brown with not much in terms of head. The nose reminds me of a fruitcake. Taste is similar (albeit slightly to a Trappist. ) in terms of dark bready fruit. Gets better as it warms.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours a dark reddish color with a off white head. Taste malty, sweet, warm. I thought this was pretty good. I would drink this again.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy amber orange. Aroma is malty sweet. Taste is full bodied malt sweetness, with a nice balance. Overall drinkable.

bottle at the american stand at berlinerbierfest 2013. rich reddish colour with a steady head; rich peaty aroma with some salted caramel and burnt grass flavour; quite bitter for a scotch ale. delicious stuff

Dark, ruby, red. Tight head. Malty aromas, gentle on the hops. Beautiful balance of dark malts. Huge mouthfeel. Sweetness from the malts but also due to the high alcohols. One of the best interpretations of a Scotch Ale/Wee Heavy out there.
12 oz bottle. Pours a red brown with light head. Aromas of berries and malt. Flavours of brown sugar, raisins, roasted malts and toast. Bitter finish.
Not overly complex, but a solid Scotch ale. Malty and creamy with a nice mouthfeel. Could it be a little "deeper" and more complex? Sure. Not bad though.

Tasting pretty bland, something has happened to my buds. Slight hints of scotch, slight coffee/roasted malt? Head dissipated quickly. Low carbonation. Low sweetness slight tang/citrus. Not overly impressed :s. 

-- rated via screw free advertising for Blackberry 10

Looked good but the smell of alcohol dominated making me wonder how good this was really going to be. While there is the distinct alcohol twang it is still quite good with the tastes of roasted malts keeping things in perspective.
Sample from bottle @sbwf13. Deep amber with white head. Aroma heavy and sweet, burnt sugar, caramel, toffee and wood. Taste has alcohol, barrel, burnt sugar, caramel malt and vanilla.

Draft at the Coffee District in Delray Beach, FL. Pint glass. Nice deep amber brown with a one finger white head. Lacing is nice. Strong aroma of malts, caramel, scotch and wood. The taste has the scotch booziness, wooden barrels, significant malts, peat and vanilla. Full body, slight oily. Butter finish with a scotch aftertaste. I really enjoyed this one.

On tap at the Wheat and Rye in Romulus, MI. Dark copper color. Rich malty aroma. Perfect carbonation. Nicely balanced with flavors of caramel and a pleasant sweetness. Alcohol not particularly noticeable, despite the 8.5% ABV. A wonderful Scotch ale.
Bottle. This is a great hoppy scotch ale that really captures the essence of the style and then gives it a little twist.

Styles get confusing - to me this is a dark ale with some carbonation. Malty balanced drinkable. Pleasing aroma. Not bitter. Clearly not in gravity of imperial stout but still some complexity. So to me a buy again favorite

Aromas of chocolate and leather. Dark ruby red color and caramel head. Deep rich taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: Deep Amber/Brownish Hue, Passes Little Light, White Head Ring, Minimal Lacing

S: Maple Syrup, Brown Sugar, Mild Molasses

T: Brown Sugar, Molasses, Raisins

M: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Sweet, Semi Dry

Overall, definitely a better beer in the bottle than from a stale tap. A decent Scotch Ale but I dont think it is worthy of the grade it has.

The nose is of spice, smoke and malt. Moderately hopped, this brew lets the malts shine with their complexity of sweetness, smoke and roast flavor. For an 8.5% alcoholic brew, the balance is a brew masters masterpiece. No alcoholic faults are present, medium bodied with a slightly creamy texture coupled with an outstanding flavor profile from start to finish.
12 oz bottle. pours a reddish brown with thin head. aroma is similar to a bitter but more malts. taste is good. spices, malts and some alcohol.

From bottle. Pours clear red brown with a medium dark cream head. Aroma of malt, dark fruits, caramel, toffee and light nuts. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Bottle. Very nice looking scotch ale with medium head. Sweet caramel malt taste but not too sweet. A little bit of alcohol after burn.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2013 Complex roasty slightly smoky nose. Some banana too. Rich thick creamy magnolia head. Firm bodied, some dryness in the mouth though a richness dominates. Prune too. Good complex lacing is left after every sip. The difference between this and Gordons Finest is very stark.

Pours dark ruby red. Yellowish head. Spicy Cola aroma with alcohol finish. Nose follows through to taste. Quite sweet with a nice dry bitter finish. Was expecting a more syrupy full body but this is lighter than that. Still a sticky mouthfeel but Medium body. Nice.

Bottle, thanks sevenhokie! Toffee and caramel aroma with subtle smoky and brown sugar notes. Pours copper colored with a ruby red hue and a good 2 finger light brown head and excellent lacing. Taste is sweet toffee and caramel malt with brown sugar notes. Finishes very smooth with a hint of smokiness. Excellent scotch ale.

Sample at Stockholm Beer and Whiskey Festival 2013. Almost clear deep ruby liquid with small light tan head. Aroma of bread, toffee, light smoke, biscuit and toast. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of bread, toffee and light smoke. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice.

small head on a reddish brown beer.
aroma is roasty sweet sweet malts
sweet caramelized taste offcourse scotch
medium body

Cor marrom escuro avermelhado. Pouca formação de espuma e media persistência. No aroma, malte tostado, passas, açúcar mascavo, frutas secas. Great beer from a great brewery. This is a great beer and it does have a slightly smoky taste. Great scotch ale.

Lovely scotch ale from one of the best breweries in the country, let alone the state of Michigan. Founders flagship is hard to beat for its unique flavor and high abv. A tad sweeter than I would have liked, but still very solid.
Pours out a reddish brown with a small tan head. Medium carbonation with a malty, caramel flavor and hints of brown sugar. A little on the thiner side, but, overall, its an above average brew.

Bottle poured a reddish brown hue w/ a small head. Medium malty aromas. Initial flavor is moderate sweet w/ a light bitter. Tastes are caramel, brown sugar, toffee, and malt. Medium bodied with a boozy finish.
A very solid scotch. Mellow and rich. Amber colored. Medium bodied. Earthy hops and malty.

Dunkel, weiss verflüchtigernder schaum, süsslich im aroma, malzig süsslich im geschmack, feinherb im nachklang

Dark Reddish Brown, Medium Head, Lots Of Lacing. Malty, Sweet, Caramel, Bitter Finish with Slight Alcohol Zing. Medium Bodied Belly Warmer. In my humble opinion, It Might Be Slightly Overrated. Nevertheless it pretty Good and enjoyable savory drink. Like the name, reminds me of Austin Powers Fat Bastard... Recommended.
I could describe the aroma, flavor and appearance, however, I feel as though the only thing that must be understood about this beer is that it is delicious.
Aroma of chocolate and malty goodness. Pours dirty Brown like an altbier. Taste is chocolate, toasted bread and malt. Thick and warm. Perfect Scotch ale.

Light tan head. Roasted malt aroma. Tastes like burnt coffee, caramel, and sweet. Aftertaste is bitter but none of the main malty sweet taste lasts long enough.

Founders Dirty Bastard Scotch Ale is good but doesnt live up to its high rating and elaborate description. (I am starting to see this as a trend with Founders beers.) Ruby red color with an off-white head. Light aroma of peat. The peat is more pronounced in the taste with some sweetness and a bitter bite. I did not detect the smoke flavor (guess it did say "hints") that I was expecting. Dirty Bastard is a better than average Scotch Ale but not overly special.
UPDATED: OCT 16, 2015 Malty, caramel, dark fruit, earthy, full-bodied - all the characteristics one looks to in a Scotch Ale.

Bottle. This beer really comes to life as it warms up. Raisin, toffee, and alcohol on the nose. Syrupy mouth feel. Strong raisin and caramel flavors with a noticeable warming sensation. Reminds me a lot of Dogfish's Raison D'être 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 Oz bottle from Redmonds. Murky brown, red highlights, cream coloured head, doesnt last. Dark fruits in the nose, plum and raisin, sweet malt and a little sugar. Flavour follows the nose, almost Belgian in character, sweet, packed with fruit, some yeast sourness. Decent body, medium carbonation. Finish is more estery sweet dark fruits and a little more toasted malt. Lovely.

Pours a beautiful deep reddy amber. Small off white head. When I first popped it I picked up a citrus aroma but as it warmed or a few sips it seemed more cereal to me. Had a malt cereal taste and a slight alcohol finish. Mouth feel was a lite syrup. This beer points out a problem I have with rating a large amount of beers, when I find something this good I stick with it awhile. A wonderful beer, job well done.

Compelx malty nose with milky weetbix, gentle treacle and a touch of boiled green vegetable. Pours a rich amber with a creamy head. Flavour is boatloads of malty sweetness with just a hint of balancing hoppy zing in the finish. Hugely moreish and a damn fine scotch ale.
Pours a deep ruby with a slight off white head. Nice malty, caramel smell. Good bitter taste.

Nice mild aromas from caramel to vanilla with a little bit of spice. Beautiful Amber color, exactly what you would want from a scotch ale. Nice bitter taste when it hits the palate, as you get the finish a good peat taste overall well pleased

Pours brown with ruby hues and tan head. Aroma of of caramel some raison and a nice nuttiness. Flavor is the same with a nice sticky sweetness and spiciness. Medium body with medium-high carbonation. Overall, good stuff!!

12 floz bottle.
Pours a dark brown-red color with not much in the way of head.
Nose is very rich and sweet. Theres some caramel, raisin, plums, just a hint of booze and a little bit of hop aroma.
Taste is some caramel sweetness on the attack. This is followed by a dark fruit, plum and raisin component, and the finish is mildly bitter, with a tiny bit of sweetness.
Mouthfeel is very heavy and syrupy, and quite mouth coating.
Not really my style, but I can appreciate the quality.

Botlle. Pours dark reddish brown with a thin off-white head. Aroma on this beer is sweet malt, caramel, faint smoke, faint hops and a nutty flavors. Taste is Sweet malts, swet caramel, light coffee, hops and slight smokey peat. Full bodied, creamy balanced beer. One of the better Scotch Ales I have tried. NIce Beer.
One of the best scotch ales i have had. Malty, full body, but very smooth, you will not realize it is 8+%. Gets better as it warms a bit.

I am enjoying this beer immensely! A coffee/caramel flavor, a complex aftertaste, easy on the palate.
