Pours a nice reddish brown color with a tan head and a little lacing. Aroma is very sweet with caramel and malty notes. Flavor is very malty with caramel notes and a little coffee aftertaste. Delicious, excellent scotch ale.
Reddish pour, white head. Aroma is very malty with maybe hits of caramel. Taste is caramel followed by a malty finish. Smooth and a touch of alcohol at the end. Good beer.

Pours deep ruby with a finger of rich reddish-brown head. Very malty aroma with a wisp of smoke. Very complex malty flavor with notes of smoked peat, nuts, and alcohol, with a nice hop finish to balance it out. Good stuff.

Bottle at the Great British Beer Festival 2013. Dark red-brown with a good yellow-cream head. Zesty, spiced aroma, boozy. Nice, malty, good body. Hint of spice, quite rich, boozy, crystal malt. Enjoyable.

The aroma is more hoppy than most of the style but is also caramely and buttery. The appearance is brown with an average head for the style. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is smooth. Overall hood beer but to bitter.

Delicious toasty with deep malt and nutty tastes. The beer pour lovely with a dark brown with lots of potent power of flavor, this is what you want to look forward to.

Bottle from BlackHearts&Sparrows. Big and malty. Aromas of coffee, toast, caramel, cherry, hint of whisky. Taste is sweet, with bitter notes, long length. Palate is sticky, and full bodied. Dark brown, frothy head.

Hop malt spice aroma with a hint if chocolate. Dark brown colour with poor head and lacing. Malt chocolate spice flavour. Thin palate.

Grain and Grape (15-Sep-13) Sweet malt and veg hop aroma. Medium brown colour, poor head and suds lacing. Sweet malt and veg herbal hop flavour. Thinnish spirit, roast malt and a touch of steel finish, with a floral roast malt aftertaste.
Overall: Sweet honey and porridge.Note: Bottle 355 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2013-09-14.

(Bottle): Pours a deep red-brown, medium off white head. Big aroma of rich, sweet malt with dark fruit, caramel and an element of alcohol but more of a spirit, like whisky, than straight alcohol. Very thick mouthfeel, superb carbonation. Lovely big sweet malty flavour with dark fruit, burnt caramel notes and even some small hints of hops. Absolutely fantastic, though expected of founders brewery.

Bottle, about 8 months old. Pours an unattractive brown/black with little head. Smells caramel, smoke, yeast, burnt crisps. Body is medium to full. Taste is semi-sweet burnt caramel and toffee, tangerine, raisin, centennial hops? Not bad overall. Quite a pungent flavour which I generally like but its a little nauseating here. Tastes better than it smells. Decent.
Currently my favorite beer. The predominate flavor is caramel malt. It is sweet but not overly so. Medium mouth feel, somewhat light for the strength of the beer, but this is a good thing.

Ótima scotch ale americana. Cor marrom/Madeira, com media formação de espuma e aroma de bourbon envelhecido em Carvalho. Na boca, ótimo corpo, com notas alcoólicas e frutadas, ameixas secas, Carvalho, Madeira, licorosa. Final longo, álcool evidente, aquecedor. Ótima breja!

Another great beer from Founders. Sweet aftertaste makes this a great choice for Scottish Ale.

355ml bottle form Appellation Wines. Pours dark red-brown with a very thin, and short-lived white head. Lots of dark toffee aromas, hint of alcohol and almonds. Chocolate sweetness on the taste, then some burnt and smoky notes coming through. Full-bodied and rich palate. Very complex and enjoyable.

Nice heavy scotch. Deep rich malts. Raisins, plums, booze. Heavy Can only get down one but is a good one.

As good as the first time i had it. DB is exactly what you would expect a scotch ale to be. I loved it when i got into american craft beer and i still do. Now i want it on draft!

Poured from bottle. Dark reddish brown with beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is herbs with some fruit. Some raisin. Taste is very complex. Nuts and fruity sweet malt taste with some good hops bitterness. Medium bodied. Very smooth and well balanced. A great scotch ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Finishing up the last of a six-pack and its been good to the last drop. Its not Belhaven but Im not in Scotland.

355ml bottle. Pours a hazy deep ruby, verging on black, with a small light beige head, which lasts quite well and leaves good lacing. Herbal hops mix with meaty, savoury notes, nutty malt and berries to create the aroma. A mild berry flavour up front gives way to quite strong hops, which bring in fruity, spicy flavours. There is a rich blend of savoury and nutty malt in a weighty mid-palate. The nutty flavour is joined by dark, slightly sweet berries in the finish. This is a very classy Scotch ale. It is quite well hopped for a beer of this style, which helps, along with its savoury feel, to prevent it from being too sweet. Nevertheless, there is just the right amount of sweetness in the finish. A highly enjoyable ale.
Pours deep amber with a solid finger of head. Caramel and fruity aroma. Taste is caramel and toffee and a bit of smoke.

355ml bottle @Delirium Cafe, Hoppy Loft, Brussels.Caramel, some wood and liquorice, malty aromas. Pours dark amber-copper, with nice creamy off white head, persistent, some lacing. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily and creamy texture. Taste is caramel, some residual sugars, sweet, malty, some aging-like flavours. Smooth and balanced.. Enjoyable.

Poured deep reddish brown with a frothy tan head. Aroma of zesty alcohol soaked berries, toasted malt. Full body, flavour of the aroma, sour cherry, liquorice, cloying, sticky sweet end. A bit of alcohol burn develops in the aftertaste.

Pours a slightly cloudy ruby amber in the glass. Slight smoke aroma right out of the gate followed by a bit of toasty malt. Rather clean tasting, not much peat or scotch flavor that I can detect. The aftertaste though, definitely has a bit of toasted malt and scotch hint to it. Overall, a very drinkable brew... almost too drinkable. "I love scotch. Scotchy, scotch, scotch. Here it goes down, down into my belly..."

From a 355ml bottle on 30/8/2013. Pours a very dark cloudy amber with a small head. The aroma is relatively subdued with some caramel, toffee and dark fruit presenting. Its a slightly odd beast in the mouth, with lots of not particularly sweet dark fruit (berries, slightly sour red grapes), some toffee and brown sugar, followed by a seriously big lingering hop bitterness. Has a fullish body and medium carbonation. Its a very interesting and unusual brew, but a little hard to really love because the bitterness is just a touch harsh and unbalanced.

Dark red pour with a thin tan head. Aroma is strong malt & dark fruit. Flavor is strong with malt, plum, brown sugar and some smoke. Finish is sweet, malty and moderate alcohol presence.

---Rated via @jxray76 on Twitter
This beer was absolutely disappointing to me. The taste was very bitter, and the beer was simply otherwise not appealing. I was not a fan of this beer.

Bottle. Dark amber color with white head. The aroma is a mixture of yeast and hops. The taste is sweet with hints of malt and scotch. A bitter aftertaste that lingers in your mouth. A definite favorite beer.

355ml bottle.
Drunk the night after the Wu-Tang Clan gig in Stockholm, in a sort of honor of ODB. Or something.
Pours a slightly hazy deep amber, with a fast receding beige head.
Malty, spicy aroma, caramel, toffee, chocolate, lightly roasted, apricot, dried fruits, figs, diacetyl.
Off-dry, full bodied, mid to high bitterness, creamy CO2.
Malty, spicy taste, hints of smoke, caramel, apricot, hops, earth, dried fruit, toffee, diacetyl, lightly burnt butter, yeast.
Feels like a quite robust barley wine, with some of the Scottish rye bread notes. A fireside sipper. With an awful label. (2013-08-23)

Into a snifter at just on cellar temperature. Compact and tight dollop of beige cream sets in atop, laces a thin weave. Body is a dull brown in the shadows and hazy but it shimmers a deep russet copper when held to the lights. The carbonation fine and rises sluggishly. Rich, sticky and spicyy aroma dominated by caramelised stonefruits, sultanas, raisins, brandy and toffee brittle. There is a faint waft of heather and peat in there also. First thing I noticed in the taste was the bitter wall it puts up in the rear. Almost a herbal tonic reminiscent of Unterberg aperitif that lasts long in the aftertaste. Body is medium with an oily, resinous mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Medicinal alcohol gives it heat with a touch of brandy, burnt wine that roughens it up. The savoury fruit of the aroma fills it out. Residually sweet with plenty of fruit sugars left like a film on the tongue. Id say a good few years in the bottle will soften the blow of this one, maybe sand off the burrs. A cross between an English and American Barleywine over the Scotch ale listing. Still, bad points aside I do actually like this. Boozy and heated, bitter and spicy. An after dinner ale! (12fl.Oz, BB 01/03/14, Liquor Barons Ocean Reef)

Bottle at Tilleys, Newcastle on 27 July 2013.
Poured a clear amber with a dense, off white head. Aroma of toffee, sticky dried fruit and alcoholic wafts. Similar flavours with brown sugar, syrup and sweet malt notes. Lingering sweetness and warming alcohol.

This "Bastard" pours a dark amber color with an off-white head. The aroma is a pungent mix of yeast and hops. The taste starts very sweet and malty and finishes slightly bitter. Not really what I was expecting in a Scotch Ale but still very good!

Pours deep amber, slight tan head, cloudy. Aroma huge bread, toffee caramel, ever so slight floral hops. Taste follows nose, sweet caramel and toffee, bit of hop presence to balance it out, biscuit and floral hop linger. Mouth feel towards the full end, low carbonation, subtle spicy note, little alcohol warming, finish is on the dry end. Overall nice beer, very tasty, malty, yet balanced, enjoyable sipper.

355ml bottle from Good Spirits Co, Glasgow (£3.50):
A rich and deep aroma with a complex blend of darker fruits and some alcohol alongside some brown sugar, caramel and toffee notes. Some darker malts too with some dates, plums and raisin coming together to make up the rest of the nose.

Caramel red to brown colour with a thumb sized, creamy, foamy head that holds well.

Darker fruits that included plums and some figs among others. There is a caramel malt taste backed up by plenty of sweetness from the fruits as well as some brown sugar.

Medium to full mouthfeel with mild carbonation and faint hints of alcohol and plenty of sweetness. The balance of this beer is also excellent and the beer is a smooth and creamy feeling one that goes down well.

A very nice beer, one of the best Ive had in the last few weeks and one that I wouldnt mind picking up again considering it wasnt the most expensive. A very nice and wonderfully complex aroma that fades slightly in the taste but in nonetheless still an excellent beer.
Malty flavors. A hint of chocolate and coffee. Strong, yet not easy to tell. Delicious.
Had numbers of times in Grand Rapids. This is a great beer. Malty and lots of toffee. Very smooth. Love this beer.
rich, dry cocoa aroma. brown malt note. dark caramel color. rich tan head. almost creamy aroma. very bitter up front. a sweetness, rich malty flavor mixing with the bitterness. med-hvy body.
Just the right amount of smokiness elevates this scottish ale to superior status among its USA-produced brethren. One of my favorite beers to come along in the past few years!
Pours a dark ruby copper with a minimal white head. Smells of smoke, berries, citrus. Taste is malty sweet - hint of smoke and fruitiness, mildly bitter.

Poured from a bottle. Cloudy brown amber with a foamy tan head that dissipates into a thin cap. Aroma is very sweet - toffee, brown sugar, dark ripe fruit and toasty malts. Taste starts medium high sweet and transitions to a slight bitterness for the finish, also slightly dry in the finish. Body is smooth yet has a bit a prickly carbonation. One of my favorite Founders beers.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a deep brownish amber, decent head and lacing. Smell is roasted malts, nuts, caramel, a bit if alcohol and hops. Taste is robust and full. Lots of caramel and toffee, a touch of smokiness, and some booze on the finish. Texture is thick and heavy. Another nice beer from Founders

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle. Pours dark amber/brown color with a moderate foamy off-white head.that dissipates quickly. Aroma caramel malt, toffee, smoke, raisin, and hints of chocolate. Taste had lots of caramel, toffee, chocolate, light dark fruit, grass, and good bitter finish.
Drank numerous times: draft and poured from the bottle. Dark n color and heavy on the palate, big on maltiness with a some hoppiness, too. For me, this is the "standard" to compare scotch ales.
.33l bottle @Harry?sPours cloudy reddish with low head. Aroma is sweet malts, hops, alcohol, berries. Flavor is hint of chocolate, malts, liquorice and brown sugar.

Pours brown with hints of orange and does look like prune juice with a head. This head is thick light tan. Aroma is coffee and toffee malt. An explosion of flavors to the taste. Coffee, chocolate, caramel/toffee, darkfruits and supremely well-malted. Just enough hop and alcohol on the backside and leaves you with more coffee and toffee. Scotch style ales, well-made, are growing on me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Low carbonation, but thats probably the fault of a bad growler fill. Very malty, lots of caramel flavor.

prune juice color with rapidly fading tan head the vanishes almost completely. The is just a malt explosion in the aromas, caramel, smoke, fig, sweet like molasses. Full body, creamy and enough hop to prevent it from being cloying. Dont drink much of this style, but this is damn good. Only other memorable Scotch Ale for me is the FFF Robert the Bruce.

Bottle. Pours clear deep amber ruby with good off white head and lace diminishing. Big malty aroma, deep complexity, chocolate, burnt toffee, continental pils feel, a touch of peat, wheat and yeast character. Hops are about but overshadowed by a nice complex med malt aroma. Medium chewy body, good bitterness, big malty sweet burnt toffee caramel character finishing with a good peat malt character, toffee and munich malts. Hop character is present throughout. Again the peat lingers well on through the complex malt forward finish.

A dull red, lighter at the bottom of the glass, with a moderate nicotine coloured head; aroma is stewed fruit, sweet and boozy, really good; taste is sweet, treacle, balanced with a bitter hoppy finish, with some peaty notes.

Pours a dark hazy brown colour with a small beige head. Aroma is very malty, caramel, smoke, dark fruit, woody notes and some peat. Taste is medium sweet leading to a very nicely balanced finish. Excellent stuff.

WOW!! I love this beer. It pours really easy. Not much head and it dissipates quickly. Clear brown color and the taste is amazing. I get the scotch right away and it makes me happy. The finish is just a tiny bit funky, but I attribute that to my lack of appreciation of ales in general. This beer just makes me happy. Also, try this one if you like bourbon barrel beers!

From 341 ml bottle. Looks great - a dark brown with ruby red highlights and a small latter head that sinks to just a ring. Aromas of dried fruit, plums and a touch of peat smoke. Flavours of dark caramel, figs, raisins at the front, before a roasted bitterness comes in the mid-palate, then smoke and spice at the end with a little sweetness. Medium bodied and beautifully balanced. Very nice indeed.

Small head misty red brown pour medium strong carbonation aromas grassy note brown sugar toffee burnt caramel say toasted the flavours toasted caramel and toffee brown sugar rich nut a bitter taste that rolls over the palate dark hoppy fruits grassy note very morishing ripping ale the finish good ale best flavours toasted malts lasting sweet and bitter tastes hop such a good bodied ale

One of my favourite beers. Pours a dark amber brown. There are so many complex flavours in this beers. Everything from coffee and chocolate to dark dried fruits and sweet citrus. Has a bitter hop finish with a hint of alcohol, as is typical in scotch ales. Delicious
Pint on tap. I agree with the description up top. This beer is very complex, which I really liked. Its heavy for a scotch ale, actually, but I liked it. It brought out the bastard in me.

Draft. Aroma is of a dark fruit yeast with an extra sweetness. Appearance is a dark brown with a little tan head. Taste starts sweet then turns toward dark fruit and finishes dark and dry. Finish leaves a dull raisiny flavor in your mouth. Overall, a good beer. Would buy over lots of other beers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 14C. Clear deep brown with a pale beige head that leaves clumps. Gentle toffee aroma with some dried fruit and bread. Rich and sweet, dries out towards the end with discreet bitterness. Singed, vaguely smoky toffee, hints of dried fruit, a little spicy at the end. Alcohol is well-integrated. Fine beer.
I loved this beer, Im a fan of brown ales and only wished this one was a just a little darker.

Bottle from uto beer. Pours a dark cherry amber colour without much of a head. Sweet caramel, booze, dark fruits, smokiness and some funky b.o. in the aroma. Medium to light body. Its sticky rich fruits, caramel, some distinct citrus bitterness, a good hit of booze and its fairly well balanced. Tasty.
UPDATED: NOV 3, 2013 A dark brown beer that has a "dirty" scotch flavor. Smooth, not bitter. Has strong flavor and is very delicious.

Bottle pours a reddish brown with a medium tan head. Aromas of peach, caramel, apple, and molasses. Taste is sweet caramel malt with a crisp bitter finish. Sugar and oil on the palate. A tasty, rich scotch ale.

A: Poured into a snifter because I was too lazy to get something else. Pours hazy red brown ruby color. Creamy head dissipates quickly leaving some good lacing. 
A: Like a plum grape currant sort of thing. 
T: probably the most grape tasting beer Ive had (even more so than some belgians and stuff) A bit of malt backbone. goes down insanely smooth for the high ABV. A bit of spice in the finish. 
P: Palate is amazing. Lots of great flavors. No harsh afterbite. Perfectly balanced.

Overall. while not my favorite tasting beer, this is an amazing brew. The balance is amazing. The flavors are too fruity for me but may be liked by some. A must try.
Reddish brown. Aroma is mild malt and caramel. Taste is the same with a good dose of sweetness leading into a bitter finish. Palate is a mild bitterness. Overall, a nice sessional 8% scotch ale.

Pours dark copper with a large, moussey head.
Nose shows sweet rich malt with treacle and sultana characters along with soft bready notes.
Not as impressive flavours. Some of the malt remains in a supporting role but its overwhelmed by out-of-place spicy hops and a fair bit of booze.
Too highly carbonated.
Wow. All the malt you can handle. Let this bad boy warm in your hand and enjoy the ride.
Pours dark amber with frothy tan head. Overall amazing aroma of malt, booze, medium roasted caramel, and brown sugar. Taste is heavily sweet with a full body and a crisp finish.

Pretty much no head, but a ring of carbonation sticks around the edge of the glass. Dark and cloudy. Smells like raisins, prunes, you know, dried dark fruit. Very malt forward, sweet and boozy. Surprisingly light but syrupy mouthfeel, very drinkable for how strong it is. Overall a pretty tasty and sneakily strong beer, but not mind-blowing. Try it.

Bottle @ home, 27 / 7 2013. Dark unclear brown, small tan head, okay lacing. Aroma, malty, toffee, bread, grass, alcohol, . Taste, roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, bread, grass, hay, . Malty oily aftertaste. Good mouth feel, soft carbonation. Great beer.

12 oz bottle and draft, loads of malt and caramel aromas, big hop palate well balanced with the amount of malt in this beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle. Poured a dark brown with red highlights and a thick and creamy tan head. Aroma was toffee, dark fruits, caramel, and molasses. Taste was sweet and malty with toffee, dark fruit, caramel, and butterscotch.

Pours an orangey, brown color. Not much head but decent lacing. Smell is malty and a little alcohol. Taste is the same with some caramel/toffee thrown in. Nice full, rich feeling in the mouth. Pretty good taste overall.

Pours clear medium-brown from a 341 cc bottle. Off-white head. Nice lacing. Aroma is muted dark malts and light hops. Flavour is pleasant sweet malts and well balanced hops that give it nice bitterness on the finish.
Bottle. Reddy Brown with an off-white head. Densely malty with bags of Toffee and Caramel. A touch of liquorice and a scarcely concealed alcohol burn. Well put together. Drank chilled on the meadows.
Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. This is a dark brown beer with red fruit, currants and sarsaparilla notes and a rich, warming spicy fruity and roasted finish.

Bottle 355ml @ Sommerhus
Pours cloudy dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, oxidization, alcohol, dried fruits and chocolate. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long caramel and chocolate finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle from mane liquor. Pours a deep brown with a small light tan head. Aromas of chewy caramel, biscuit and toffee. Taste is rich creamy malts, some earthy notes with a lingering warmness. Solid but not fantastic. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark red body, thin white head. Aroma is full of malts and booze. Taste is malts, a little dark fruit and a good amount of alcohol warmness. Very rich. Good for the style.

Pours a deep root beer color with a tan head. Aroma is sweet coffee and oozing of alcohol. Taste is coffee, graininess, sweet, malty with a warm alcohol showing up late and lingering with a thick mouthfeel.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2014 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours clear chestnut brown with a small, khaki head which has good retention and lacing. Nose shows heavy buttered shortbread and dry toffee biscuit notes. Quite earthy and woody. Grassy hops behind the malt driven tones. Very earthy taste with burnt caramel. All very well balanced. Very solid stuff for a style Im not overly fond of

Medium-dark reddish brown in color, very clear, light head, diminishing quickly, good lacing. Odor is malty with peat/smoke/raisiny notes. Also a hint of herbal/grass notes. Taste is initially sweet on the tongue, with caramel, dark fruit (raisin), mild roast finish with peat/smoke aftertaste. Full to medium body, good mouth feel. Full mouth sensation from beginning to end! Excellent Scotch Ale!

Deep color. Nice bite. Pleasant aroma. Not for the weak. If you like dark, heavy beers with above slight kick, this one is for you!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
BeerBill

On tap at SoHo Kitchen & Bar in Sioux City, Iowa. Served in an interesting 12 oz tilted glass. A very dark ruby color, with a light tan head. Fruity on the nose; fruity and malty on the tongue. A bit like a porter or a stout, but with more fruit. Nice!
Love this offering from Founders! Along with Breakfast Stout and the elusive KBS, this is among my favorites currently.

From a bottle at the beach in Delaware. Dark copper, very little head, no lacing. Sweet aroma , complex, smokiness with smooth finish... A beautiful brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark ruby red with no head. Slight malt sweetness in the aroma. Flavor is malty sweet with coffee and hints of chocolate. The roasting of the malts really shines through. Slightly hoppy and alcohol tinged finish. A nice sipping beer with a cool name.
8.5% hazy dark brown colour with a nice head, fruity (prune) aroma, fruity butter scotch whisky taste.

First scotch style Ale Ive ever had. Im mostly a whiskey drinker and dont drink much craft beer. That said, this one had great body heavy caramel up front and a whiskey like finish. I like it alot. Hiccup.

Dark brown with tan thin head. Smells like a variety of malts and no hop aroma. Big malt flavor. Complex the whole way through. Has a bitter after taste from the hops showing up after each sip. Nutty presence us abundant.

Bottle. Dark golden brown with an off white foam. Aromas are nutty with fudge and rye bread. Earthy with light smoke and hints of lemony yeast. Weetabix with peppery alcohol and spiced tea. Flavours are sweet chewy toffee with marzipan and mixed spices. Peppery with berries and fudge. Earthy with hints of honey and leafy, floral notes. Actually quite simple but still very good.

Bottle from Habershams, Savannah. It pours deep ruby with a small yellow-white head. The nose is light roasty, dark fruit, candy, boiled sweets, light toast, earth, spice, vinous notes and gingerbread. The taste is roasted malt, toast, ginger, dark fruit, earthy, light alcohol, cola bottles, vinous and caramel with a dry, earthy finish. Medium+ body and moderate carbonation. Fruity, well-balanced and pretty drinkable. Tasty stuff.
The younger brother of Backwoods Bastard...this beer is smooth and clean. Slight hop finish, deep caramel in pour. Its easy to drink all day long.

Wonderful beer. The aroma and appearance of this beer are very pleasing. Extra malty but not too thick or sweet. I'm not a huge Scotch ale fan, but this beer is very smooth refreshing and relatively light for its class. Well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thought this was a good deal at only four bucks. Pours a medium brown with red tinge and thin tan head. Smell is grass and molasses. Taste is sweet up front with not enough back end bite. Little flat for my taste. Bottle - Dakota Blue - Decatur, GA
35 cl bottle @ home. Pours reddish amber with some sediment and an off-white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is caramel, dried fruit, and alcohol. Flavour is much like the aroma.
Bottle, not to bitter with a strong toffee flavor. Not extremely filling and packs a mean punch. One my my absolute favorites.

The beer pours a nice brown ruby red color into the glass. Decent half finger of off white, tannish head that dissipates into a ring around the glass. There is a decent lacing on the glass and a bit of alcohol legs being seen as well. On the nose there is a nice caramel depth, notes of toffee. There is a hint of peat. There is also a hint of alcohol. The beer comes across the tongue with a hint of carbonation. There is a nice slight bitterness along with flavors of toffee and caramel. The beer leaves a nice sweet stickiness on the lips. Excellent beer. Would love to try this beer barrel aged.bring on the Backwoods BASTARD!

sampled from son Brown colour with a light beige head that quickly diminishes. Aroma is sweet, caramel, molasses and alcohol. Flavor is quite similar as aroma with dry fruits notes and raisins. The final is alcoholic with caramel notes, decent alcoholic sensation and malty. Creamy, smooth and dense on palate.
Appearance is a dark brownish red clear with minimal head. Taste is high malt with molasses, coffee cherry flavors.
Bottle. Pours dark amber with a slight layer of head. Aroma of smoke and alcohol. Taste of caramel with a nice alcohol taste that lingers.

This ones really interesting. It smells of copper, malt and sweet caramel. Theres a short lived almond head that leaves tendrils on the glass. The body is a beautifully deep reddish brown. The taste is primarily of malt, backed by some heavy metal caramel. Fantastic. The palate is treated by a light burn of alcohol and an aftertaste similar to that of molasses. For lovers of Scotch styled ales, this one is a must try.

Deep copper, thick off white head. Nose is roasted malt. Slightyly sweet. Middle is toffee,caramel. Alcohol starts to show. Finish is brown sugar, peaches, and slight hops. This will be even better during cool weather!

Dirty Bastard is a rich nut brown hazy liquid that has hints of red brown at the edges. The head is almost non existant with a faint ring of white bubbles around the edge of the glass that do not even cover the top of the liquid. Nose is medium light with hints of caramel, hazelnut and resin hops. Taste is malty but only moderately so with good bitters on the mid to back side. Touch of metallic taste on the finish that quickly resolves. Body is lightly fizzy. The high alcohol heft is not immediately apparent, but it becomes more evident as time passes. A very nice beer. I could see more than a few of these going down easily on a chilly day.

Deep gemstone red ale. Aroma is mildly smokey with a hint of an old growth forrest. Robust with malt and hops...full of flavor but not overpowering. Sweet and rich finish. Lovely really.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nose is dark fruit and toffee. Taste is figs, damsons, Christmas pudding slight peat, caramel, molasses, spice slight pepper, very light smoke and toffee in the finish. Moutfeel is full and with alcoholic warmth. 

Complex and tasty beer. My first American Scotch beer and its good. Name is dreadful though.

A great scotch ale. Good looking with a deep ruby colour and good head. Palate is perfect for the style with enough carbonation to stop the beer feeling sticky and the flavour is malty, sweet and with a hint of hops. Not my favourite style of beer but when done this well I would buy again. Another triumph by Founders.

Deep ruby red. Aroma: Caramel, malt, alcohol, raisins and chocolate. Taste: Very noticable spicy alcohol notes, raisins, caramel, chocolate, rye, coffee and a slight hoppy bitterness. Smooth palate. This is an amazing scotch ale, really delicious and dangerously drinkable

Mmmmmm scotch ale. Bottle poured into glass, dark amber. Tastes light for the alcohol. Haha! Good way to kick off a Saturday. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

P: A frothy ice cream float crown resting on a body of dark hazelnut brown. 

S: Dirty wet socks, moldy grain, sweet roasted caramel, dark fruits, crystallized sugar, subtle brown sugar and melted milk chocolate. 

T/M: Burnt sugar, roasty caramel malt and booze. Spicy and earthy hops cut thought the sweet malt and finishes with lingering bitter apple peels. Rich milky feel with prickly carbonation and a gritty end. 

O: A great take on the style. Earthy, dirty rich with a surprising spiciness. There is a lot more hops than I expected. I definitely recommend trying this.

Aroma of dark sweet fruit. Pours a brown with garnet highlights. No head and minimal lacing. The taste is malt forward. Malts and dark fruit with hints of smoke and caramel. Medium-full body with medium carbonation. Overall, an enjoyable Scotch Ale.

Bottle. Rich, earthy aroma; pours dark amber with a decent head. Very rich, full flavor - slightly sweet, caramel, roasted malt and a bit woody. Very full feel in the mouth - lots of body; nice effervescence and a smooth, just slightly bitter aftertaste. Very nice beer.
From the get go, you smell caramel, sweet citrus, malty aroma, dark brown appearance, citrus taste almost a hint of orange/lemon, very floral, the hoppy aftertaste is great. Impressive beer!

Deep ruby red/brown colour with a thin beige head. Aroma is sweet caramel malt, cereal, very light hoppiness. Taste is sweet at first with a peaty/smokey whisky like finish. Oily texture, medium body. A fairly average beer - gets a couple of extra points for the smokey finish which makes it a little bit interesting.

Draft at Draught 55.  Pours dark amber with a thick tan head. Good lacing.  Aroma is of smoke, peat and malts with a bit of hops. Taste is slightly smokey, just the right amount, peat, and a well balanced mix of malts and hops.  Really nice finish. I really liked this one.

I heard some nonsense today, articulately put but flawed and abusive at heart. I heard some things that made me laugh and inspired me. Then Stephen Lewis made me cry in a packed auditorium. Moving, emotional, distressing, inspirational. Im in awe of the man.
12oz bottle. Pours dense, dark amber, almost opaque, with a small off-white head. Aroma sweet caramel barley, alcohol notes. Flavor a bit sweet then flat. Overall unobjectionable.

Founders flagship beer. Dirty Bastard is an absolute beautiful beer to behold. Dark ruby in color and brewed with ten varieties of imported malts this beer continuously lives up to its reputation as a bold and powerful ale. Dirty Bastard is complex in the finish with hints of smoke and peat paired with a malty richness, finalized with a good bit of hop attitude. This beer aint fer the wee lads
Poured a very pretty deep garnet with a thin head. Label says 50 ibu, but those are all on the very backend on the palate. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2014 Tastes like carmalized brown sugar mixed into a hoppy raspberry plum sauce.  The hops make it a very american take on a scotch ale, but if you like hops then what is the problem with that?  One of my favorite session beers, which speaks to how little the 8.5% comes through...

Bouteille 12oz, courtoisie de Maxime D. De couleur brune-ambrée et voilée. Nez de caramel toffee légèrement rôti, léger de fumée (tabac, traces de tourbe), de fruits (petits fruits confits) et de houblon herbeux avec des notes de chocolat et dépices (poivre doux). Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-doux ainsi quune texture légèrement huileuse, crémeuse et sirupeuse. Notes fruitées (petits fruits foncés) et de chocolat noir lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un goût de caramel toffee légèrement rôti avec des notes de malt fumé (tabac terreux, faibles traces de tourbe) ainsi que des traces de pain grillé. Parallèlement, lon retrouve une légère-moyenne amertume de houblon herbeux aux faibles notes résineuses avec un léger goût dalcool. Post-goût moyen-long, léger-moyen amer de houblon herbeux, de rôti doux, léger dalcool et de malt sucré.

Sample at CBC 2013.

Brownish colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of hops, fruit, malt, caramel and chocolate.

I was not sure what to expect,  however i was pleasantly surprized. It poured a dark nutty brown with a slight hint of red. The aroma was pleasant and was dominated by malts. The taste, well damn, is complex up front and full of flavor that mellows to a smooth finish. Top quality brew!
Pours mahogany. Smells and tastes malty, peaty and roasty with notes of toffee. Firm and rather sweet with salty balanced finish. Good stuff!
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; clear dark brown pour with small tan head, sweet malt aroma, taste is sweet with some dried fruit, feel the ABV, some caramel.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2016 Wow...slightly sweet and creamy...very flavorful and smooth...slightly fruity...excellent redish color x2 lower score second time by .3 at chop house for 15th year high school anniversary in Syracuse

Quite thin which is surprising, not the malt monster expected, fairly mellow, if mellow can kick you in the face with its alcoholic brainfuck. Tasty. I like this a lot, but it will get me very drunk. Its unsubtle. But rather lovely. I think I like it, I think I must be drunk. Audible brain leak motherfucker.

I keep reading about the ruby color, but I think I need to break out my crayolas. It looks like a rich brown, with maybe a reddish hue if held to the light. Thin tan head. Taste a little hops, but not overpowering (nor should it be). Malty taste. A bit heavy. Surprisingly easy to drink. A tad sweet (in a real bear sense....not in the flavored beer way). A bit of a boozy taste. Great go to beer.

355ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours a dark chestnut colour with a lovely red hue round the edges. Theres a big fluffy head. The nose has honey and nuts, maybe even nougat. The taste has a really interesting almond thing, maybe even marzipan with a rye bitterness on the end. The palate is gnarly as hell - big structure, really chunky and slightly abrasive texture and a sharp finish that actually brings about a perfect balance that you could never see coming when you consider what an assault on the palate it first is. Overall  Its very interesting but is it what I wanted or expected. Well, its perhaps not what I expected, but it certainly has complexity and an individual personality. Im impressed.

330 ml bottle, pours deep brown with a creamy tan head. Lovely malt character with toffee, caramel, butterscotch and dark choc. The finish is smooth, well balanced and moderate bitter. Can hardly notice the abv. An excellent beer.

Pours a dark hazy golden brown. Aroma is a little malty with some sugar notes. Taste and palate is an assortment of malts. Great as it dances across your tongue. Very nice and refreshing for a darker, high ABV beer.

Very nice ruby color with a creamy head. Aroma is caramel, malt, spice, dark fruit, smoke. Flavor is nicely hoppy, with complex flavors following the aroma.
really like this.

A definitively complex malty beer.  There is actually so much going in with the malts here that I don't quite know what to think.

There is a lot of red Scottish character here... A depth of ruby character so ingrained that I wonder what I used to call a red before meeting the bastard.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The aroma is fresh baked bread with toffee cookies baking. It pours a deep rich red amber. Starts off a sweet, candy like flavor. It has a nice balance of hops and malts to keep its well balanced. It has a sharp coffee/bitter finish. Its very complex and a great beer. I would have liked it more if it did not have as bitter of a finish.

Bottle. Another of my Founders haul I managed to get in Scotland! This is a lovely beer, very much brewed in the Scottish wee heavy style but with an interesting and smooth style. Dark ruby red body, little to no head, warm syrupy malt aroma, quite a thick tasting beer, classic Scotch rough taste with a sweet highlight, interesting clean malt/hop finish, leaving a sugary taste at the back of the tongue. If this beer is bringing back the Scotch style with a twist, then tonight in Scotland its like being visited by a much welcomed lost cousin! Very good!

Deep ruby red. Aroma: Caramel, malt, alcohol, raisins and chocolate. Taste: Very noticable spicy alcohol notes, raisins, caramel, chocolate, rye, coffee and a slight hoppy bitterness. Smooth palate. This is an amazing scotch ale, really delicious and dangerously drinkable.

Pours an absolutely wonderful shade of red, its a shame its not a better food-accompanying ale because aesthetically it would look great with a nice meal. It tastes somewhat tamer than you might be expecting, with a very silky mouth-feel. It starts out quite boozy, but the complex profile grows as you drink more while still maintaining a very nice warming sensation from the high ABV. There are hints of chocolate and coffee (the aroma really makes you brace for harsh coffee) but theyre actually quite subtle and work extremely well with the wonderful yeast/malt aftertaste that is slightly reminiscent of a Belgian strong ale. Given the alcohol content and rich flavours involved, this is very drinkable.

A: smells of spice and malt greet the nose. A: pours a dark maroon with an off white head. T: rather malty with a small spice note. Small hint of alcohol also detected. P: good medium bodied beer. O: this is a great beer to enjoy a pint every once in awhile.
Wonderful ale! Strong, unique, well balanced, still quite "easy" to drink. Some porter-like roastiness in the aftertaste.

When I hear "scotch ale", my mouth doesnt usually water. Until now. Im so pleased that I decided to pick up a six-pack of this from the deli tonight. Yeasty, bitter, sweet, balanced, smooth. Founders is an excellent brewery.
Malt, fruit and yeast aroma. Pours a dark amber with moderate off white head. Burnt sugar, spice. Dark fruit sweetness. Medium bodied with a hop hit on the finish and a lingering warmth.

Draught @ CBC2013. pours clear amber with a creamy brownish beige head that slowly dissipates while leaving some thick lacing on the glass. Smell is sweet, malty and fruity with caramel, toffee, plums, raisins, cookies and hints of wood and peat. Taste is sweet tiny fruity and malty with caramel, toffee, sweet dark bread, prunes, raisins, charred wood, peat, grass and unpleasant hints of puke. Mouthfeel is round, soft and medium bodied. Finish is slightly sweet, tiny bitter, malty and fruity with sweet dark bread, toffee, prunes, raisins, peat and hints of that strange puke-like flavour. What happened here? Did someone throw up in my sample?

Bottle into a chalice.... Pours very dark with a big head... Smells of coffee chocolate and a slight citrus finish....tastes sweeter than expected ....slight bitterness going down...decent amount of lacing
On tap at CBC. Reddish colour, with off.white lacing. Malty and caramel aroma. Same for taste, with some bitterness.

Dusty dark grape skin, wet straw, & hint of vanilla on nose; rich creamy malty caramel & butterscotch up front with hint of smokiness & spicy brown sugar finish on palate. Very enjoyable Scotch Ale -- on tap @ Beverage World!
Dark pour with good lacing. Smells of toasted malts and slight smoke. Tastes of the same.

Draught at CBC 2013. Amber beer with a beige/offwhite head. Malty aroma, toffee, earthy notes, caramel, fruity, some raisins and cocoa. Malty toffee flavor, caramel, fruity, brown sugar, some chocolate.

Nose is pure caramel with traces of butterscotch and dark fruits. Taste is vanilla, caramel and butterscotch. Ok, somewhat bland aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2014 Far clear brown with plenty of frothy beige head. Lots of lace. Aroma is strong; chocolate, caramel, booze, smoke. Tastes like heavy dark malts and significant but not overpowering sweetness with a slight bitterness. Solid.
Drought. Dark brown with large foamy beige head, no discernible aroma,  roasted cocoa-nuts taste, long finish. Interesting but lacks something I cannot describe at the moment.

Aroma: Toffee and dried figs.
Appearance: Dark amber with a quickly vanishing cream head.
Flavor: Sweet malty with toffee and just a wisp of hop bitterness. The alcohol is very well hidden.
Palate: Full bodied, low carbonation with a silky texture.
Overall: I really like this beer, but it does need more carbonation with would also help carry the somewhat restrained aroma.
On tap at Fort Worth Untapped. Poured a clear mahogany with a then tan top. Huge malt profile upfront, finished off by smoked peat. Medium carbonation, medium body.
Deep ruby red pour. Malty, caramel, and slight smokey aroma. Overall rich and full in flavor. Somewhat creamy and hoppy.

12oz bottle into thistle-like crystal wine glass, best I could do.  Deep-ruby brown color with light tan head.  Aroma is malt heavy, notes of brown sugar, caramel, chocolate and a tiny bit of smoke.  Taste is the aroma with added notes of dry fruits (raisins mostly), somewhat creamy and some earthiness from the hops.  Rich body, low carbonation, rich, chewy, sweet with a sweet bready finish.  Im enjoying this sipper a lot.

Pours a great deep ruby red with lasting off-white head and persistent fine-grained bubbles.  Malty, caramel aroma with some hops and sweet berries.  Taste is sweet caramel, malty, a little smoky, earthy , and woody.  Palate is great, with a creamy start and then more sharp carbonation on the way down - really nice.  Overall this is a great beer - rich and complex.

Cor marrom escuro avermelhado. Pouca formação de espuma e media persistência. No aroma, malte tostado, passas, açúcar mascavo, frutas secas. No sabor, médio dulçor, cerejas, passas, caramelo, médio mas prazeroso amargor. O alto teor alcoólico se apresenta muito bem equilibrado com o dulçor e o amargo, deixando- a fácil de beber. Deliciosa!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Malt, nuts, and a little roasty smoke in the aroma.  More of the same in the flavor, with some smoke, hop bitterness, and a fair amount of alcohol in the finish.  Really good, but not for the squeamish.

My first dip into the Founders pool. Rich malty aroma with a little fruit essence. Dark brown sugar color with no head but it was on tap. This was rich with a good mix of flavors but still very much the scotch ale. Spiciness with raisins and a slight burnt finish. There was also a slight alcohol bite. Nice beer but filling.

Excellent beer with a malty, caramel aroma with hints of chocolate and coffee.  Pours a dark redish-brown with a light brown head.  The taste has all the components of the smell, but with added notes of scotch and soil.  Delicious!

Bottled. Brown colour with a light beige head that quickly diminishes. Aroma is sweet, caramel, molasses and alcohol. Flavor is quite similar as aroma with dry fruits notes and raisins. The final is alcoholic with caramel notes, decent alcoholic sensation and malty. Creamy, smooth and dense on palate.
Draft.  Dark brown. A bit sweet and sugary with a nice malt back end. Thick and chewy. Not bad but not my thing.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text:
This is a great beer.  Tastes like a car bomb shot.  Mix if Guinness and whiskey. Very sweet like chocolate milk.  Pours dark brown



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A bit of fragrance in this beer. More taste in all cases. Good and decent long finish.

Deep plum in color. Head leaves dirty rings of lace around the glass. The aroma is like fruit wood pulp. The taste is pretty much all coffee in some form or fashion with various undertones of exsquisite flavors that are surely complex. This finish has some kind of bite like a big pot of salsa made with a single serrano pepper. Scotch ale? Wet, fruity coffee porter IMHO. OMG I used an FLA!

Get it at founders in GR from the tap.  In the bottle it's one of my favorites but right from the source it was amazing...more character, deeper flavors, etc. darn good beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle muled to me by little brother -- thanks!  Sweet, malty aroma of plums, caramel, wood (or whatever that special scent is that I normally associate with whisky barrel-aged beers).  Dark cola brown appearance, minimal head that dissipates immediately, no lacing.  Taste: sweet caramel, smokiness.  Surprisingly well-integrated hop bitterness bite at the end.  A little warming alcohol in the finish.  Medium body, moderate/lively carbonation, slick texture.  Overall: Exceptional.

Bottle date stamped on 8/3/2012. Pours a deep mahogany color with fluffy off-white head that dissipates to thin ring of lace that sticks nicely. Aroma of caramel, toffee, roasted woods, and a hint of smoke Taste is well balanced toffee, caramel, wood, and slight whiskey booze. Clean finish, no real after taste to speak of or lasting notes. Pretty damn good.

Appearance is dark ruby, with a very slight off white head. Aroma of dark fruit and caramel.  Strong caramel in the nose.  The taste is a little compared to the aroma. Mainly caramel. This is very smooth.

Pours a very dark amber nearly brown with a half inch of white head that quickly recedes. Aromas are very thin with bread and molasses/caramel tones. The taste explodes with sweet, smoky caramel flavors, followed by roasted malts and then some very nice peat and ash flavors. The mouthfeel is coating but not too heavy, and perhaps the most balanced part of the beer. Overall a truly solid performer and to be honest I like this more than Alesmith Wee Heavy, which was my favorite of this style. If I could get this in AZ it would be in my fridge at all times.

Poured from a bottle into a  wide tulip. Smells sweet with caramel candy, hops sneaking through. Extremely smooth mouth feel. Pretty thick and coating, in fact. Flavor is dominated by that sweet caramel and not surprisingly, gentle scotch. This is a nice sipper that has a complex malt profile that makes you question if it could have been aged in barrels. Definitely need to compare this to backwoods bastard if you have the opportunity.

Bottle, thnx to Stakem. Cheers! Pours a very murky brown beer with a very small, beige head on top. Aroma is incredibly malted with tones of molasses and dark caramel. Flavour is quite sweet, light on the alcoholic burn. Medium cloying mouthfeel, some residual sugars are present in the flavour, making it a very sweet, malted brew. Very enjoyable, it would be interesting to see this with some age on it.

Poured a dark amber color from bottle. Not much in aroma, faint smell of bread and spruce. But what it lacks in aroma, it makes up for in taste. Medium amount of sweetness with a perfect balance of hops to finish. A great beer.

Bit hazy dark ruby with medium beige head. Lacing
Aroma.. nicely mild roasted caramel malts, dried fruits, decent hops, bit alcohol, bread. Very nice balanced
Bit sweet, not unpleasantly bit sticky.
Very nice beer indeed.

Poured into a standard pint glass.

Appearance: Pours with a short lived, tan head, that leaves no lacing. It has a nice, deep ruby color.

Smell: Even without a minorly stuffy nose, I cant get much aroma out of many beers. This one is no different. This beer has a smell of malt, alcohol, and maybe even some dark fruits. 

Taste/feel: This is my first scotch ale, and I really quite like it. I thought it would be extremely big, bold, and heavy, but it really isnt. You get some sweet malty flavor at first sip, but a warming on the swallow, as well as a nice, bready aftertaste. You can taste the alcohol a decent bit as well, which I expect would be typical from a beer of this style. Yet again, another solid Founders beer.

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Great caramel and toffee malt. Very smooth and just enough kick from the alcohol. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours dark brown/red with medium off-white head. Aroma of light malt and caramel. Medium body with strong sweet malt and notes of hop bitterness.

Date is smudged but it appears to be 04/28/12. 12 oz bottle into a DFH signature alongside a Backwoods Bastard.

A - Pours a deep, dark red that appears brown when not under direct light. A decent bit of floaties and crud swimming around. Two fingers of dense and creamy light tan foam. Really sticky lacing with long lasting retention. 

S - Toffee, tons of dark fruits, caramel, molasses and a touch of smoke. So much fruitier and sharper than its barrel aged counterpart. Has a strong finish of booze and peat. 

T - Toffee malts and raisins. Sweet caramel, vanilla butterscotch and a light smokey finish. Smoother than the aroma led me to believe. Despite being very flavorful and sweet, the finish is nothing but clean with just a lasting touch of peat. Excellent.

M - Thick and creamy with low carbonation. Frighteningly drinkable.

O - A very tasty and well made scotch ale. Its almost night and day when compared to Backwoods though. Backwoods really loses quite a bit of the dark fruits. As a year round, sub-$10 six pack this is pretty damn awesome.
UPDATED: MAR 20, 2013 A really interesting beer. Sweat malts and candied fruit but finishes dry with a bit of smoke.

Caramel, roasty, aroma.  Almost black in color.  Smokey flavor of sweet coffee, follwed by a coating of bitterness.  Full body,finishes with a blend of sweet and  bitterness...... lingers a bit too long for me.  First scotch ale...curious to try others as this is a full octane brew.
Pours dark brownish amber. Aroma is light.  Taste is smooth and very drinkable. Overall it is quite good but a little lacking in some aspects.

Dark brown, copper color, opaque and with dark reddish glitters. Beige head, shortlasting and an almost absent lace. Aromas to toffee, raisins, dried plums, butterscotch, caramel and hints of smoke and coffee. Perfect balance in mouth, sweet of caramel, brown sugar and rhum and American hops bitterness. Long development and a great, bitter finish. Creamy texture, low carbonated and medium to high body. Really extraordinary beer.

So I found this at my local beer store and with the name of Dirty Bastard I had to buy it. Dark black with no head. Smooth as hell but wheres the alcohol, oh there it is...SHIMMY SHIMMY YA SHIMMY YAM SHIMMY YAY

Pours clear brown with a small light tan head.  Nose is caramel, malt, a little smoke.  I get no peat.  Sweet backbone with a little bitterness shining through at the end.  Very well balanced, medium mouthfeel.  Not bad.

Horrid.  Really horrid.  Zero aroma other than maybe some old bad burned rubber tire.  It might look good, but how can you have so much malt and yet so little taste.  The only thing you get from this dredge is burning down the throat.  Maybe just a hint of bitter but otherwise astoundingly tasteless.  I dont mean bad tasting, I mean literally like it was water.  If this is a flagship, wave the flag of surrender.  So tasteless.  No wonder it was discounted from $11, you cant sell it at $6.
Bottle 0.33l at Kaisla, Helsinki. Colour is dark orange with small white head. Aromas and flavour: Dark fruits, plums, caramel and sweetness. Very nice.

12oz. bottle drank out of a snifter. Pours a very dark amber, almost brown. No head at all. Aroma is very boozy up front with a hint of roast. Very similar to a BA stout. Flavor is complex. I cant tell if Im getting hops  or just a weird, sour note. There is a slight sweetness but it is overpowered. My first scotch ale. I wasnt thrilled, but I would like to try others.

Fond memories of this beer. one of my favorites from the regular lineup. Great brown color, nice caramel smell and taste. Big punch of alcohol that knocks your palate for a loop, but balanced enough so it goes down dangerously smooth. I love this bastard.

12oz bottle.  Pours a beautiful brown with deep amber tones.  Plenty of foam and lace.  Giving off a lot of bready malts, toffee, alcohol, and a little herbal hops.  Great smooth taste, with plenty of caramel, warm alcohol and a bitter finish.  Plenty to chew on with this beer.  Just what I need on this dreary February day.

Poured into a tulip, a dark rusty brown/ruby red color with about 2 fingers of coarse beige head. The smell is not strong, and Im not getting much besides the malts. The taste is sweet and malty, and I think I taste caramel, followed by a brief bitter aftertaste. Medium body, with a slightly creamy texture. A dope beer, I wish I had a thistle glass.

Complex with lots of malty body. It has a good amount of hops to balance the flavor and a earthy tone to it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2016 12 oz with an indicated bottling date of 2/8/12 served in a nonic. (revised upwards with a 2/2012 bottle served in 9/2014).

Pours clear, dark mahogany, with a sudsy tan head. Good lacing is left on the glass.  The aroma is moderately attractive, although lightly boozy, with hints of peat and medium roasted malts. The higher ABV is also apparent in the feel but nicely hidden in tasting. 

O: Founders Dirty Bastard  is certainly a decent Scotch Ale when fresh, and improves markedly with aging.

This pours a hazy caramel brown with a small tan head that dissipates quickly. There is some lacing, and the cloudiness does not fade (a characteristic that Im somewhat partial to). I smell caramel, molasses, and maybe a hint of honey. The aroma is definitely the star of this brew. This ale tastes sweet at the outset, but, rushes to a grassy hops that are overpowered by grainy malts and smoke finish. The sweetness is imediately killed by almost a "burning" of the tongue. This truly IS not a beer "fer the wee lads"! The after taste rings of hay and cereal- and a numb tongue. Although, I wouldnt say that Bastards flavor profile is all that "complex", I am thoroughly enjoying this beer. This is a wonderful Scotch Ale.

Bottle @ Home. Pours slightly hazy dark brown with a small creamy light brown head. Aroma of malt, caramel, nuts, peat, light smoke. Flavor of rich malts, dark caramel, notes of coffee, peat and smoke, little earth, light booze. Medium body, soft carbonation, warming alcohol in the finish. 190213
My favorite.  The taste is wonderful and the after taste is great also.  Founders struck gold when they brewed this up.
Minimal aroma with a dark brown color and solid head.  Powerful flavors that last well after finish.  Flavor not for the weak.
UPDATED: APR 10, 2015 Very interesting beer - almost no perceptible smell, but then there?s an explosion of peaty flavor. Not bitter at all - a great effort from Founders.

12oz bottle poured into glass. Brownish color with a thick bubbly head. Aroma is slightly hoppy but definitely more geared towards the malts here. It felt a little dead or past its prime but it was still somewhat interesting. Nothing Id trade for again though.
Chocolate, coffee, nuts, roasty a little hot but it is a heavyweight. Great scotch ale

Somehow this one escaped my ratings although this is a mainstay in my fridge.  Pours a dark mahogany with medium off-white head, decent lacing.  Aroma of perfectly roasted caramel malts, brown sugar, slight citrus hops, dark dried fruits, and a slight nutty character.  Flavor matches and comes together very nicely.  What a great brew.

Bottle poured into pint glass. Dark copper color with thin tan head which dissipated quickly. Aroma is a sweet, malty scent with hints of dark fruits. The taste is huge amounts of malt with caramel and dark fruit undertones. Not a lot of bitterness. Very smooth, the carbonation doesnt detract from the taste at all.
Goodness, what a tasty wee-heavy. A strong scotch ale with notes of golden grains, hay, smoke, and malt balanced well. Delicious.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2013 Very malty scent with a little smoke and caramel. Bitter taste, low-medium carbonation, sweetly sour aftertaste. Complex and interesting but not particularly refreshing. *+0.2 bump on re-try, thought it was smoother, nice maltiness.*

Chestnut brown pour with a beige head. Aroma has a nice bready malt backing with toffee, caramel, raisins. Flavour mimics the aroma. Quite smooth and sweet, but not overly. Theres just enough bitterness to cut the sweetness, leaving a burnt almond flavour on the finish. Pairs wonderfully with a piece of dark chocolate. Tasty stuff.

Aroma is more of carmel and licorous.  Flavor is a bit to sweet.  Correct mouth feel but very sweet.  Im having a hard time finding the scotch in it I can see this being a carmel beer.  Thin to no head.  I would go for an oskar blues any day.  Just not impresed on this one.  Not bad but much better in my opinion.

A creamy beer with heavy caramel tones. The scent and flavor are refreshing and satisfying. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice head that disappears quickly leaving nice lacing. Sweet malty nose. Sour sweet palate with alcohol heat. Raisin and malt flavors. Finish is dry and slightly bitter.
UPDATED: MAR 4, 2013 Pleasant aroma. Smoked hoppy taste. Not an everyday beer but good non the less. Drank from bottle.

Dark reddish-brown. Tall fluffy off-white head that diminishes but has good soapy retention with some sticky lacing. Aroma is malt, dark fruit, some alcohol, yeast, toffee I suppose. Definitely a sweet smelling initial whiff.  Medium to full body with nice texture. Malt and sweetness upfront and gives way to spice and hops. Smooth bitter finish. Very enjoyable.

It pours a dark brown and yields the same color body. The body is too dark for any carbonation to be seen rising. There is a spectacular looking foamy, somewhat spider web lacing. The one inch white head dies within several seconds. The smell has the caramel up front with a bit of toffee, tobacco, and some dark fruits. The taste is basically the same with a bit of chocolate coming out. The palate is about a medium with an exceptionally smooth feel all around. There isnt any sharpness on the tongue. The alcohol does come out a bit, but its not overbearing, still drinkable for the most part. Overall, this is very impressive.

Deep ruby orange color, with an absolutely stunning but short-lived yellow head. Deep malt flavors, with little sweetness. A traditional and quite good Scottish ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drank in pilsner poured from 12 oz bottle. Smells more like rye beer than the red rey from founders. Can smell the alcohol. Appearance- dark auburn color with no carbonation or head. Taste - lots of yeast and malt flavors. Almost like beer drenched bread. Its ok. Not my favorite beer. Somewhat like an amber ale. Palate- poor mouthfeel. Get the heat and barf flavor. Not a fan. Overall- its ok. Will not drink again but still better than expected from a scotch drink.

Low malt aroma for a scotch ale. Chocolate, coffee malt present pouring light black/dark brown.  Hops used are low profiled. Finishes with bourbon flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a 12oz bottle.  Pours a ruby dark amber.  Smells or caramel smoked peat and biscuit. Tastes of overpowering caramel vanilla and smoke. Really good scotch ale
This has to be one of my Top 5 favorites. Its my goto beer when I just want to relax and drink a freakin good beer.
Bottle at Kaisla. Brown color, white head. Malty, roasty taste with peat, caramel, fruits, plum and herbs. Nicely balanced body. Malty sweet finish with raisins. Very nice scotch ale.
Dark red with a small off white head. malty with fruity notes. malt, fruit and biscuits. Full body with a very nice bitter sweet after taste.

Kaatuu lasiin ruskeana ja sameana, vaahto on todella niukka, mutta jää reunalle. Haju on hyvin makean karamellinen, kuivatun hedelmäinen, marjainen, keksinen, rusinainen ja havuinen. Maku on karamellisen makea, pihkainen, kuivatun hedelmäinen (etenkin päärynää), havuinen ja mainen. Tasapainoinen suutuntuma on tahmea, hieman hiilihappoinen ja katkerahko. Kokonaisuutena tämä scotch ale on melko makea ja karamellinen, mutta nautittava olut. Hyvin tasapainoinen ja miellyttävä tapaus.

12oz bottle into a tulip.

Pours a slightly hazy dark amber with barely a half finger head. No head retention and just a thin ring is left around the top of the beer.

Aroma of dark caramel, brown sugar, and molasses. A little bit of roasted malt and a touch of smoke, but caramel really dominates.

The flavor is very much like the aroma. Tons of caramel and molasses with some yeasty fruit flavors coming through as well. I dont really pick up on much smoke but there is a nice roast underneath that barely peeks its head out. Bitterness is quite light with sweet malt taking hold throughout. Finish is on the sticky side.

Overall, I found this beer to be a little bit one dimensional. The caramel maltiness is excellent but I wouldve liked a little more complexity. The sweetness is a little much for me as well. Backwoods Bastard is ten times better than the Dirty.

Peaty smell.  Cloudy amber red color.  Malty peaty woody slight bitter taste.  Little to no head and oily mouth feel.  Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into snifter glass at room temperature. Thick brown head, dark color. Not nearly as thick as I feel it should be for a scotch ale. Dry finish. Heavy in roasted malts in the aroma and taste. Not a strong scotch ale IMO but its still a go-to for me. Possibly better cold?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
An all time favourite.  Gorgeous, malty, boozy goodness.  Read the brewers description and the reviews.  Repetition accomplishes nothing.
Dark ruby pour with off-white head. Light malty aroma. Taste of sweet malt with mild bitter hops. Very nice beer.

Very awesome and drinkable beer. Definite notes of cherry in the nose, and the body of the beer contributes a definite malt sweetness and body.  There is a hop balance, but this is definitely a sweet beer, not a bitter one. That being said, this is still an excellent beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark reddish brown with a slight tannish white head that quickly dies off.  The beer has a spicy, sweet aroma of malts, caramel, vanilla and brown sugar. Flavor is full or malts up front with a lot of raisin and figs.  The taste is kind of earthy with some alcohol on the finish, just the right amount to know its there but doesn?t overwhelm. The body on this one is medium to heavy, almost syrupy with low to medium carbonation. Overall a great beer, one of my favorite scotch ales.
I guess Im a bit against grain here but Im not a fan of raisins and this was all raisins. Too intense in that one direction. A quality ale, but too much about the raisins.

Nice dark caramel color..little head..nose of booze.vanilla.bourbon..sweet malt also..dried fruit.figs as well..pretty interesting nose almost smells like barrel aged..palate and mouthfeel are not what i was expecting..leaves warming spice like presence..however not as enjoyable as i was expecting..ok scotch ale..

Aromas of caramel, peat, cocoa, subtle booze, and hints of hops.  Appearance is ruby-brown with very little head.  Taste is somewhat sweet, lightly bitter, and lightly boozy.  A rich, full-bodied beer, with moderate carbonation and a long warming finish.

Dark brown Amber color with a one finger creamy head color. kind of clear. Smell some berries maybe a little citrusy with a little caramel. Taste the caramel up front with the berries getting in the way and on the back straight alcohol.
12 ounce bottle pour.  Great beer for the money - good strength and palate pleasing.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a dark brown color with a small tan head.  Robust aroma with caramel, vanilla, nuts and roasty flavor.  Taste was sweet and malty with smokiness.  Medium to full body beer with a very nice balance to hide the alcohol.  Very good Scotch Ale.

Dirty Bastard has a nice caramel, toast, nuts, and roasty aroma. I drank it in a bottle so cannot comment too much on appearance, the taste was very heavy sweetness, a medium body with creamy texture, overall if I had the money I would drink this again.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2012 [4749-20120819] Tap. Fruity toasted malt aroma. Clear, orange body with no lasting head. Heavy booze up front, flavour has a lot of malt grain and not-spicy whiskey notes. Medium-full body. Interesting, quite big. (6/3-/6~/3/13) 3.1
(@ Coles, Buffalo, NY)

[5005B-20121208] Tap. Sweet cherry Twizzlers aroma. Clear, ruby red body with a quick creamy off-white head. Sweet grainy cherry Twizzlers flavour. Medium body. Good, but quite sweet. (7/3/7/3/13) 3.3
(@ Coles, Buffalo, NY)
Very good! Flavor hits you like a ton of bricks but not over done in any dimension - just right. Was a nice surprise over Christmas.

Poured from bottle into glass. Poured a dark amber with almost no head, lacing and alcohol legs are present. On the nose I get sweet fruity notes maybe bananas caramel. Definitely getting a malty smell as well. Taste is malty with bitter caramel notes along a weird but pleasant banana bread flavor.
Bottle,poured dark brown with hardly any head.Malty aroma.Sweet malt taste with a little toffee and slight smokiness.Went down OK.

Draft @ Strange Brew Tavern. Also had in 12 oz. bottle. Shaker glass shows dark amber to the point of nearly being brown. Thin soapy white head clings to the glass as I sipped. Nose is just a bit mellow but follows the flavor as it warms. Flavor is Sweet and malty, toffee up front, leading into Smokey peat and a light note of Scotch. Notes of raisins with plenty of caramel. Some alcohol presence towards the finish. Body is leaning on the full side. Texture is slick. In the style of Scotch Ale, this is a fine brew.

Poured from a bottle, dark amber, brown, with red tints. Very little head. Aroma of malt, caramel, roasty. Taste is actually smoother than I expected, slightly sweet with a burn and hop bitterness at the end. Good medium body, not thick at all. My first scotch ale.

A dark brown ale with a flash of crimson. The head disappears leaving the beer free to lure you in. It's got a robust body with a bit of bitterness on the backside. Overall a robust ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer is really nice, but its not anything to write home about.  It has a bit of a malty aroma and a touch of spice, with, as suspected, no hop aroma.  There is no real discernible flavor...malty-sweetness and a bit of booze.

12oz bottle----> shaker.  Pours a dark red/brown with minimal head and lace.  Aroma is molasses, raisins, and light toasted malt.  Taste follows smell with the smallest bit of hop bite near  the end.  Nice medium creamy palate with little carbonation.  Very nice scotch.

12 oz. bottle. It pours a very dark orange color with a disappearing orange head. The aroma is super sweet and malty with lots of toffee, caramel and vanilla. Seriously, like malt candy. The flavor is pretty much the same with a bit of maple syrup and honey. There is a toasty/smoky background that keeps it from being sickeningly cloying. A pretty nice sipper if youre in the mood for a very sweet scotch ale.

Deep amber/red color with a tan head reminiscent of soap bubbles that laces briefly, but doesnt last.  Heavy on the spice with strong toffee, caramel, and malt with some smokiness.  A good deal of alcohol warmth.  This is not a subtle beer at all.

Poured from bottle on a cold night. Red-brown color with 2 finger tan head that went away quickly. Lacing was just avg. Aromas were nice, caramel, pitted fruits, vanilla, soft wood, dough and malt. Taste was mostly the same with some smoked malt and cocoa in the finish. Very smooth on the mouth, with soft carbonation and pleasent aftertaste.

This is one of my favorites. Pours magony red, minimal creme caramel head, fading to some nice lacing on glass and the top. Faint baking cookies aroma. Taste is full on treacle, not sweet, but deep and mellow. Medium to heavy body. Satisfying. Puts a smile on my face.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2013 dough, hay, roasty, tan foam, clear, golden brown, lightly bitter, medium body, fizzy, slick feel, 


The aroma of this beer is a subtle fusion of roasted and caramel malts, and the appearance is a gorgeous blend of a cloudy brownish red color with a large tan head that fades quickly. The taste is slightly sour and slightly umami, and the palate fuses a medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation, and a slightly sour and malty finish.
Pours redish brown hue capped by an off white head. Nose and taste of toffee, caramel, raisens, plum. Sweet on the palate. Body is big but silky at the same time.

Pours a murky brown with no head and no lacing.  Caramel, toasted malt. Perhaps a little clove. Woody, taste of sweet bourbon. Hint of grapefruit hop, but more resinous/herbal notes. Starts sweet and hop bitterness blends in and predominates in the finish. Medium bodied with small to medium carbonation. Medium finish.  This beer doesnt look pretty, but it tastes pretty good.
12 oz bottle pours reddish brown with a off white head.  Aroma of malts, sweet and caramel.  Taste is malt, toffee, caramel and a little fruit.

From bottle pours dark reddish brown with a thin light brown head that disappears quickly. Aroma is light malt. Taste is medium to heavy sweetness. Overall it had a lot less taste than I was expecting given other reviews and the description. A bit disappointing.

12 ounce bottle.  Pours a nice dark reddish brown with a decent biege head.  Aroma of malt, fruit, and caramel.  Taste is malt, dark fruit, caramel, toffee, and some smoke.  Nice balance, nice Scotch Ale!
Hides the alcohol content very well.

Bottle was a bit past its prime, so take that into account. Pours a deep mahogany with a 1-finger tan head and some sediment due to the bottles age. Aroma is of caramel and smoke. Taste is the same, but more yeasty. Overall decent, but would have been better if it was more fresh. Doesnt hold up to long-term storage well.
Good, smooth dark ale. Had it from a tap. Nice color. Sweet in flavor with hints of caramel.

Smells a little malty with some oakand dry whiskey. Has good head with dark mahogany colour. A little whiskey bitterness in taste. A really malty feel, medium carbonation. Had this while walking down the street between Village Beer Merchant and Blue Monk in Buffalo. Didnt really warm me up.
Nice appearance. Thick foam head fades fast.  Good malty bite covers the alcohol well. Not for the faint of heart.
pours dark reddish almost brown/black. Delicious warming alcohol taste with some nice malt and a bit of caramel. Leaves a nice coating on your tongue. Would buy again
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: so, this is the legendary Founders. pours brick red with a off white head that dissipates quickly. aroma is all dark fruits and peat. toffee and dark brown sugar albeit not as sweet, some raisins and dates and some spiced bread. finish is a bit oily and brandy like. nice but too heavy for more than a couple. glad i was finally able to try something of theirs though.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2014 Tap @ Encinitas Ale House...  Poured dark brown with thin forming head.  Malty, dark fruit aroma.  Sweet, moderately boozy and malty.  Borderline barleywine on the sweeter side with a hint of smoke and charred wood.  Very nice.  I cant believe this is the first time I am trying Dirty Bastard.
Bottle. Pours deep brownish red. Sweet chocolate/caramel aroma and taste. Twists in a little bitterness on the finish. Hides the alcohol well. Good beer.

12 oz. bottle from BlackIPA, Thanks! Pours a dark reddish brown. The aroma  is malt forward, fruity, and a touch of smoky peat. The taste has some peat, smoke and some fruit in there. This is a very well balanced beer especially for its style and alcohol percentage.

This is my first scotch ale. It was a little bold for my taste at this time. I think it was probably right on the money for how its advertised. Just beyond me at this point. Smells and looks great in glass definitely a smoky malt flavor up front with a little hops bitterness in the finish. You know your drinking something with alcohol.
UPDATED: MAY 31, 2013 Bottle->stem.  Dark hazy red amber.  Aroma is light wet hops, peat, yeast.  Taste is malty with notes of chocolate and spice.  A bit overpowering to the palate.
Attractive as it hits the glass and rich in aroma. Its a bit more hop-forward than what I expected in a Scotch Ale. Good ABV that gives you a bit of warmth without getting you into trouble.

Side by side with Backwoods Bastard.  This is a deep reddish brown with some sediment.  I think bottled in July, the stamp is wearing off.  Very smooth for a wee heavy.  Caramel, dried fruits, some smokiness.  Backwoods is a sipper, this is a creamy malt bomb with some milky chocolate. Very nice!  I think drinking beside backwoods was a disservice to this beer.
Great dark ruby appearance. Light but pleasant and complex aromas. Great flavor with a malty aftertaste. From draft.

Good blend of malt and hops with some slight smokeyness.  Looks great, tastes really good, goes down nice and smooth.  Theres a slight flavor in the jumble of flavor blends that Im not quite liking (perhaps scotch?), but not enough to say I dislike the taste. In fact it tastes amazing.

What a great beer. Pours a dark, thick, clear mahogony. Creamy off white head. Aromas are massive toffee, malty notes...some peat and chocolate notes too...dark fruits as well. Very oily and full bodied mouthfeel...beautiful. Sweet and malty, corn syrup and toffee up front...with just enough hop and smoke to even things out. Excellent.

12oz bottle thanks to Auroracrisis. This was probably my least favorite Founders beer to date. The color was a turbid and murky brown, scant head. Smell was slightly malty but faint. The taste was spot on for the style but just didnt wow me. Sure its malty but Id rather have anOld Chub any day of the week.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-14-2011 16:49:59
Ruby in color as explained with a little forming head and little lacing.  Good malt taste and not over powering smokiness.  Good brew.

22/X/2012 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle from The Bottle Shop (Canterbury) @ home - bottled: VII/13/2009 (2012-1167) 
Clear copper red beer, lots of sediment floating around, big aery beige head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: marzipan, figs, caramel, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: bit sour, alcohol, caramel, chocolate, cocoa powder, bitter, some marzipan, dried fruits. Aftertaste: bitter, caramel, dried fruits, mocha.

Poured into snifter glass: dark brown, with thin half-inch head that vanishes in a matter of a minute. Some bubbles along the side. Little thin, bubbly traces of lacing.

Scents of chocolate, light roasted malts, toffee. All very faint.

Taste is same, with a fairly thick body, medium carbonation. Umm, pretty good, but very light on the flavors.

Could be better.

Pours a perfect ruby red with little head which disipates immediately.  Aroma has a mild malt caramel up front with little scotch on the end.  Taste is a very malty caramel up front with some alcohol presence towards the end.  An overall medium to heavy mouthfeel for a scotch ale.  Nice beer.

On-tap at Dutchs bar. Enjoyed with a sandwich at their larder next door. The beer helped ignore the hipster chick behind the counter. She was slamming  breweries that werent from her hometown or something, typical of the hipster behavior. Pours a deep ruby-tinted mahogany. Smells of flaked barley, sourdough, black olive juice, croutons and ash. Tastes of Karo syrup, fried peanuts, tobacco leaves, mint, White Labs Edinburgh and caramel. Pretty straightforward.

Draft at the local steakhouse in Kingston.  I became quite talkative.  Dark brown/ deep ruby with a thin film of head.  Founders on draft...what an easy choice to make!   Malts march madly and tease tender taste-buds.  The light lingering smoke pairs well with the sirloin tips.  One consumed slowly over dinner and conversation.  Nice.
From bottle. Poured a nice brown color with lots of toffee aroma. Taste follows with sweet toffee malt and finishes with slight bitterness. Great example of style.

A magical scotch bag of raisinets. A beautiful opaque dark ruby in the light, pours with a small head and some lacing. Smells sweet and peat. Tastes like the aforementioned sweeties with so much grown-up behind it. Just a touch of smoke, plenty of toffee, choccy and fruit along with the perfect bitterness that never lets on about the 50ibus and just the tiniest hint of the 8.5%. A session beer that will end your session well early. Hot contender for my favourite beer from an almost flawless brewery. Git in ma baelly wee man.
UPDATED: NOV 18, 2015 A little too heavy, raisiny and sweet. Not enough hop action to balance the malt. Meh.
Bottle  Deep Burgundy color, slightly cloudy. Classic malty, caramel nose with the faintness vinous note. Sweet nutty taste with a slight cloying finish. Solid Scotch ale.

Great beer and one of my favorite styles.  Thin head and an aroma that doesnt match the robust flavor.  Lots of thick smokey malt flavor with hints of caramel and chocolate.  Oddly (and in a good way) brings to mind rich loamy soil.  A strong offering from one of my favorite breweries.

Bottle.  Pours a deep brown with a tinge of red, and a thin light brown head.  Almost no lacing.  Smells of toffee and caramel.  Tastes of coffee, caramel, roasted grain, and a little dark chocolate and peat in the end.  I dont get any smoke like the commercial description states.  This is a great scotch ale though; amongst the best.
toast, caramel, roasty, citrus, brown, clear, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, fizzy,
Pours sweet brown color. Smells sweet and toffee. Taste follows with a malty, sweet flavour. Hints of chocolate. Sticky, thick mouth feel. Very enjoyable beer.
